For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married, 45 years of age, and lives in Poblacion Bonifacio Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. Evangeline is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and she earns 10,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Evangeline's business is very stable in her community.  

She joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Evaneline will use her income to support her two kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Evangeline wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods to sell

loans.name: Rwibumba 1 Sk Group

texts.fr:
Théophile fait partie du groupe Rwibumba 1 SK. Il a 28 ans et il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 an de secondaire.

Théophile est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation des engrais. Dans les prochaines années, Théophile voudrait être un grand agriculteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de se marie et construire une maison moderne.
texts.en:
Théophile is a member of Rwibumba 1 SK Group. He's 28 years old and unmarried. He attended middle school for six years.

He's a rice cultivator who's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growing his business is to use chemical fertilizers. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be a big rice farmer in his region.

With his profits, he intends to get married and build a modern house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.en:
Gaspard is married with 10 children. He has been a maize farmer for 60 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Natalia Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia nació en la  ciudad del Lima y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Claudia tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. 

Claudia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad del Cusco. Desde hace 12 años que trabaja en una tienda de venta de repuestos de carro pero actualmente Claudia se independizo y tiene su propio negocio. Ya son seis meses que se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carro de forma independiente. 

Claudia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Claudia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por amortiguadores, sistema de refrigeración, amortiguadores, soportes, pistones y otras cosas más. 

Claudia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudia was born in the city of Lima and now lives in Cusco. Claudia is 37 years old and has two children.
Claudia conducts her daily and economic activity in the city of Cusco. For 12 years she has worked in a store that sells car parts but now Claudia has gone independent and started her own business. She has sold car parts independently for a living for 6 months now.
Claudia belongs to the communal bank, “Ñahupacman Purisun” of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco. Claudia needs this loan buy goods such as shocks, cooling systems, shock absorbers, struts, pistons and other things.
Claudia is thankful for the opportunity afforded by this means and likewise promises to comply with the corresponding payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy goods such as shocks, cooling systems, shock absorbers, struts, pistons and other things.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом  женат имеет троих детей. Он и его жена предприниматели. Абдусалом занимается предоставлением услуг по замене масла и балансировки автомашин. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается более трех лет. И имеет достаточный опыт  для расширения бизнеса. Он хотел бы получить займ для  закупа масла и автопокрышек для автомашин. Он надеется, получить займ в размере  5000 сомни для закупа товаров. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание. И благодарен тем, кто его поддержит в этот час. Спасибо.
texts.en: Abdusalom is married with three children. He and his wife are entrepreneurs. Abdusalom has been providing services in oil change and balancing of vehicles. He has been in this business for more than three years and has enough experience to expand his business. He wants to get a loan to purchase oil and tires for cars. He hopes to get a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni for the purchase of goods. He looks forward to your support and understanding. And he thanks all those who will support him in this hour. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 21 años de edad, es madre de dos niñas de 5 y uno años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, ella se dedica a atender un negocio en su casa, en el que ofrece a los clientes mercadería de primera necesidad, lleva dos años en él y hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas con su clientela.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo fresco, quesos, carnes, embutidos, huevos, y otros productos que sus clientes le compran a diario, esto le ayudara para incrementar su inventario y obtener mejores ventas.
La aspiración de ella es fortalecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
21 year old Rosa is mother to two children of 5 and 1 years of age and she lives with her husband. She runs a business from her home were she offers her customers basic groceries. She has been doing this for 2 years and, to date, hasn't had problems with her clientele. She is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh chicken, cheese, meat, sausages, eggs, and other products that her customers buy on a daily basis. This will help her to increase her inventory and get better sales. 
Her wish is to strengthen her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fresh chicken, cheese, meats, sausages, and eggs.

loans.name: Khairulla

texts.ru: Хайрулла  - молодой фермер, живущий на юге Кыргызстана. Он – единственный сын в семье, который согласно кыргызским традициям, живет со своими родителями и заботится о них. Основным источником дохода для семьи Хайруллы является животноводство. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Хайруллы, его хозяйство  сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Хайрулла обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку трех бычков для откорма и перепродажи. В бизнес – планах Хайруллы - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в личных – в ближайшее время обзавестись собственной семьей.
texts.en:
Khairulla is a young farmer located in south Kyrgyzstan. He's the only male child in the family, therefore, according to Kyrgyz tradition, he lives with and supports his parents. Their main source of income is animal husbandry. Thanks to Khairulla's dedication and tenacity, his farmstead bring in about 10,000 soms (KGS) per month via the sales of milk and meat products. 

In order to increase the herd, Khairulla turned to "Bai Tushum and Partners", requesting a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three bulls for subsequent fattening and sale.

Khairulla's business plans for the near future consist of investing in his farmstead and increasing his herd, while his personal goals are to get married and raise a family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Reyna tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 8 años de edad cada uno.

Ella tiene 14 años de dedicarse a elaborar tamales de gallina, de elote y pisquez, todos los días. Trabaja 6 días a la semana y cada día vende como mínimo 200 tamales, pero no le son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ya que recientemente tiene como cliente a una funeraria que le realiza pedidos grandes. 

Por esta razón Reyna solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar papas, garbanzos, aceite, por mayor cantidades y un recipiente en donde pueda almacenar más cantidad de tamales, así ella no tendrá que viajar todos los días en la mañana a comprar los insumos que necesita como hasta hoy lo hace, ya que viaja dos veces al día a la ciudad: en la mañana a comprar los insumos, luego se regresa a su casa a elaborar los tamales y en la tarde vuelve a la ciudad a venderlos. 

Con el préstamo ella se ahorrara tiempo, que será utilizado en atender a sus hijos, ya que su esposo trabaja todo el día fuera de la casa en la albañilería. También dispondrá de suficiente insumos, para cubrir cualquier pedido, en cualquier momento, ya que muchas veces por falta de insumos no puede realizar algunos pedidos.

La señora Reyna, desea tener un puesto en la ciudad, para vender sus tamales y todo tipo de antojitos, para tener mayores ingresos y lograr que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Reyna is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their four children ages 16, 13, 10 and 8.

She has worked for 14 years making chicken, corn, and pisquez (bean) tamales everyday.  She works 6 days a week and each day she sells a minimum of 200 tamales, but that is not sufficient to satisfy the demand of her customers, since recently she acquired as a customer, a funeral home that makes large orders.

For this reason, Reyna is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to purchase potatos, garbanzos (chick peas), and oil at wholesale quantities and a container in which she can store a greater quantity of tamales.  This way, she won't have to travel everyday in the morning to purchase the supplies that she needs like she has been doing up until now.  She travels twice a day to the city: in the morning to purchase supplies, then she returns home to make the tamales and in the afternoon, she goes back to the city to sell them.

With the loan, she will save time, which she will use to care for her children, since her husband works all day out of the home in the bricklaying business.  Also, she will have sufficient supplies readily available to fulfill any order, at any time, since many times, for lack of supplies, she isn't able to fill some orders.

Reyna would like to have a place in the city to sell her tamales and all types of snacks, in order to have a greater income and achieve a university education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase potatos, garbanzos (chick peas), and oil at wholesale quantities and a container in which she can store a greater quantity of tamales.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachael is 47 years old. Rachael, a business lady, is married to Evan, who is employed. This couple is blessed with four children. She has been selling cereals for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family.

Rachael is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Rachael will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Lea Marie

texts.en: Lea Marie operates her general store more than 15 years.She and her husband both works hard to generate income for living.The couple was blessed with two children who are still attending to school.Lea Marie would like to have a progressive and stable source of income that's the reason why she's asking for a loan of PHP20,000.She will use this amount of loan in buying stocks of grocery items.She would be grateful if her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to be use in buying stocks of grocery items for her general store

loans.name: Sergey And Natasha

texts.en:
Sergey, 35, and his wife Natasha have a teenage daughter age 13. They are both Technical school graduates and have been in the shoe retail business for more than 5 years. Sergey and Natasha started in retail as hired market vendors. They are both industrious hard-workers. Through integrity and persevarance they were able to save some money and start their own shoe sales business. Loans recieved from “Nadiya Ukraine” have promoted the growth of their business. They purchased two kiosks at one of the local markets and now manage them successfully and efficiently. The loans have also helped Sergey and Natasha purchase a new apartment and increase the well-being of their family. Sergey and Natasha are requesting a loan to expand the assortment of shoes and boots they have available to sell. Winter season in Ukraine means low temperatures which guarantee growing demand for the footwear Sergey and Natasha offer. This loan will give them a chance to purchase more high quality, stylish, leather shoes and warm, comfortable boots. Having a variety of available footwear in their kiosks will definitely attract more potential clients. This loan will help Sergey and Natasha increase their inventory to cater to an ever increasing number of customers and promote stable expansion for their business.

Сергій (35) та його дружина Наталія виховують дочку-підлітка (13). В них обох середньо-технічна освіта. Вони займаються продажем взуття вже 5 років. Сергій та Наталія почали торгувати на ринку в якості реалізаторів. Вони обидва дуже наполегливо працюють. Завдяки чесній та відданій праці вони заощадили гроші та відкрили власний бізнес з продажу взуття. Позики, які вони отримали в „Надії України”, спряли розвитку їхнього бізнесу. Сергій з Наталією викупили два кіоски на одному з місцевих ринків, їхні справи йдуть дуже добре. Позики також допомогли подружжю придбати нову квартиру та підвищити рівень статку родини. Сергій та Наталія просять про позику для того, щоб розширити асортимент взуття. Взимку в Україні часто буває дуже холодно, а це гарантує великий попит на товари, які пропонують Сергій та Наталка. Позика надасть їм можливість купити більш якісне, стильне шкіряне взуття та теплі, зручні чоботи. Широкий вибір різноманітного взуття в їхньому кіоску обов’язково привабить більше потенціальних клієнтів. Позика допоможе подружжю придбати великий асортимент товарів для того, щоб задовольнити постійно зростаючий попит з боку покупців, та сприятиме стабільному зростанню їхнього бізнесу.

loans.use: To expand the assortment of shoes and boots

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena is 37 years old and a father of 3 children who are in school. He had education up to the basic level. Some 7 years ago, he branched out into the sale of VCD/DVD compact discs and currently is one of the major distributors in the city. He also benefited from the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions in October last year.

He has plans to expand the volumes of discs but is largely restricted by the size of his shop. He thus intends to utilise the KIVA loan to acquire a secured shed to strengthen his operations.

loans.use: Shed Acquisition

loans.name: Nin

texts.en: Mrs. Nin H. lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 3 children.  Nin works as a small grocer, selling some snacks, drinks, and soap near her home.  She earns about $3/day in this business, and her husband contributes $4/day working as a taxi driver.  This loan will be used for Nin H. to purchase more grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for stocking store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 45 years old and hails from Asaba in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a deep freeze and more goods for sale. Rose has been a LAPO client for 5 years.

loans.use: To invest in her little restaurant

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roun, aged 37, sells fish in her community and earns $5 per day. Her husband, aged 44, is a motor-taxi driver who earns $10 per day. They have 2 children.

Mrs. Roun is requesting a $1,200 loan to fund the purchase of farmland so that she can grow and sell vegetables alongside fish, thus diversifying her business and increasing the profits she can earn.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to grow and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Twenty-eight year old Nelly is an enterprising and enthusiastic mother of a seven-year-old-girl. She has big dreams of improving herself; ever since was very young, she always helped her dear parents in their carpentry shop creating a wide variety of items, particularly elegant furniture for home and office. Now that she has started a family with Fredy, she's decided to devote herself entirely to this work. Thanks to her ingenuity and diligence, her business is succeeding, enabling her to cover the basic needs of her home and finance her higher education. She is avidly studying accounting at the local university, always desirous of improving herself and her family. Nelly’s wish is to purchase more raw materials (wood) to produce the articles that she is entrusted with everyday. For this, she is turning to your generous heart and requesting this highly beneficial loan, promising to repay it within eight months. Your help is very important to Nelly and her beloved family; let’s make her request possible.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly de 28 años de edad es madre de una niña de siete años, muy emprendedora y entusiasta, con grandes deseos de superación en la vida, desde muy pequeñita siempre apoyó a sus queridos padres en su taller de carpintería en el que elaboraban gran variedad de artículos y sobre todo elegantes muebles para los hogares y oficinas..Ahora y una vez formada su familia junto a Fredy, decidió dedicarse por completo a esta labor, gracias a su ingenio y diligencia está teniendo éxito, permitiéndole cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y solventar sus estudios superiores de contabilidad que muy ávidamente sigue por las noches en una universidad particular, siempre con el afán de superarse y con ella su familia.El deseo de Nelly es comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima (madera) para la producción de los artículos que diariamente le encomiendan fabricar . Para esto recurre a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo que le será muy beneficioso y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses.Vuestra ayuda es muy importante para Nelly y su querida familia, Posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to create beautiful home and office furniture

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Client’s history: Mrs. Modesta buys vicuña and alpaca wool. She spins the wool to weave her shawls, and hires another person to help her with braids and fringes. Her children are now independent and work for themselves. Now that she weaves her blankets based on orders, she lives and works out of her home in the Callapa zone. She has been a client of Impro since December 2005. This is her second request for Kiva’s support; she has finished paying the last installment of her first, so she is requesting a new loan at this time. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first rate client as far as fulfilling her payment obligations. The sum requested will be used for the purchase of raw materials (vicuña and alpaca wool). Her work and her prior credits with Impro permit her to apply for this loan as she has experience in her business that will enable her to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Modesta compra lana de vicuña y alpaca. Ella hila la lana para poder tejer las mantas y para trenzado y flecadura contrata a una persona, sus hijos ya son independientes y trabajan por cuenta propia. Vive en la zona de Callapa donde tiene su taller, ya que las mantas que elabora son a pedido. Es cliente de Impro desde diciembre de 2005 y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana de vicuña y lana de alpaca) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of vicuña and alpaca wool to weave shawls

loans.name: Erika

texts.en:
Erika owns a stand where she sells french fries and sausages in the town of San Juan, district San Martin, province El Dorado,  department San Martin.  Her food, which she sells at night, is a popular regional dish.  She started the stand one year ago to help her family earn more money.  Over this time, her sales have increased and she is looking forward to taking the next step.

Erika is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She says although running a business and having a family is difficult, she organizes her time wisely every day and works hard so she doesn’t have very many problems.  Erika also mentioned that because she sells her food at night she has all day to spend taking care of her children.  Erika is determined to send her children to University so they can become professionals; she never had this opportunity.

Erika is part of the community bank Las Margaritas and is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 so she can buy a larger food stand and will repay the loan in four months.  She says that right now her stand is too small and doesn’t meet the production level she needs to serve her clients.

loans.use: To buy a larger food stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Nuru's Faith Group

texts.en:
Nuru A. is a 28-year-old married woman living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. To her support her children, ages 3, 7, and 10, Nuru works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local stall. Each month, she earns about $50 in profit.

Nuru hopes to expand her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $400 U.S. dollars. Nuru completely trusts her two other loan partners, Ester E. and Fatuma F.. Both of these women have their own businesses, selling supplies and cloth.

loans.use: To buy more food and supplies for a vending business

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 21 years old man, the father of one child. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Alaa is a baker. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy equipment and invest in the decoration of his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and decorate his business.

loans.name: Arun

texts.en:
Arun is 37 years old and married with one child. He started working a year ago with the SOS Children's Village. His main responsibility is to help the SOS children and their foster mothers to live cooperatively.

Arun would like to build a small house for his family and has finished the foundation. Because it will take him a long time to save to continue with the construction, Arun is requesting a loan of $350 (Le1000000) for cement to make building blocks. He will pay the loan installments from his monthly salary.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi Tsige is 52 years old, married and the mother of one. She is a merchant of traditional style skirts in Kpalime, a town around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. She has been practicing her profession for 5 years now. With this loan, she would like to purchase 10 large bags of traditional style skirts so that she can satisfy customer demand that is ever growing. The profits she earns will be used to support her child's education needs.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Afi T. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Elle est revendeuse de pagne à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Kpalimé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité de puis plus de 5 ans. Avec ce crédit, elle souhaite acheter 10 balles de pagnes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle dont la demande ne cesse d’accroître. Les bénéfices qu’elle dégagera de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux supporter les charges scolaires de son enfant.

loans.use: To purchase 10 large bags of traditional skirts.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S. grows crops on her farmland, which is located behind her house. Mrs. S. makes a living by selling these crops at the local market, where she earns approximately $4 per day from her farming activities. She and her husband, Uch Chung, live with one child in Thnal Trang Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mr. Chung is a motorcycle taxi driver. His motorcycle is old and does not attract many customers, so Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a newer motorcycle for him. The new motorcycle will allow him to serve more customers and thereby increase their family income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a newer motorcycle for motorcycle taxi business

loans.name: Winfrida

texts.en:
Winfrida J. is married with a two-year-old child. She has been selling vegetables since 2007. Every day she works from 9am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Winfrida now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables -- particularly tomatoes -- for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at L. (pictured with his mother), 20, is single, and lives in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has six brothers and sisters. Three of them study in a local school. One sister is a silk weaver, and one brother is a worker. His parents buy recycling materials to sell in the village.

Mr. Sam-at has been a worker for many years. He works for villagers in his village and earns about $70 per month for helping his parents. He stopped his studies when he was young.  His house is always flooding when heavy rains come, so he wants to level his house's foundation but lacks the money. Therefore, Sam-at is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase dirt for leveling the house's foundation and purchasing silk material for his sister's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase dirt for leveling his house foundation and purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem N. is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She sells groceries, making about US$5 of profit each day. Selling groceries has been hard since inflation keeps increasing. It brings the price of goods to unreasonable levels. The report from ADB to the government says that the domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent. It is a huge concern to every class of people, especially farmers and poor people.

Tem said that since her husband's death, she faces difficulties meeting daily expenses and she needs to take care her two school-aged children. Her education costs for her children are less than they will be in the future and she must work hard and save money for them to continue with their education.

Tem N. has requested a loan of US$500 to plant yams to help increase the family's income. (She is pictured with her son, wearing a black shirt.)

loans.use: To purchase starter bulbs and begin growing yams for resale

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en: Geoffery A., 35, sells basic home provisions like toothpaste and detergent in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan to purchase more of these products to sell to his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINACE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more basic provisions to sell to customers

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Tiene un estudio fotográfico desde hace 5 años, este negocio es el fruto de su deseo de ser independiente, atiende todos los días, durante casi todo el día para poder tener los ingresos necesarios para poder cubrir los gastos de arrendamiento, así como el de los materiales que utiliza para imprimir las fotos, como el papel impresión y mantenimiento de sus máquinas. De esta manera, Ana es un sostén importante para su familia, sobre todo por sus 2 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio, por lo cual ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida en los próximos años. Es la segunda vez que Ana solicita un préstamo en MFP, durante el primero demostró ser puntual en sus pagos. Ahora solicita este préstamo parta comprar una máquina impresora de fotos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She has run a photography studio for the past 5 years which is the fruit of her desire to be independent. She works in the studio every day for almost the entire day in order to have enough income to cover rent and materials which she uses to print the photos; these include printing paper and the maintenance of her machines. In this way, Ana provides sustenance for her family, especially for her two children who are still in school. She hopes to be able to improve the quality of life for her children in the next few years. This is the second time that Ana has requested a loan from MFP; she was very punctual in her payments on her first loan. Now she is requesting this loan in order to purchase a photo printing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photo printing machine

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 60-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Mouhamad has been in agriculture for thirty years, and he also has cattle. He plants cabbage, tomatoes and white beans. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to purchase a milk cow. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because of his experience. When he first started his work, he had some cash difficulties. He decided to do this business because of his experience, as well as to earn money to buy raw materials. In the future, he plans to expand his production of milk and yogurt.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
A sus sesenta y un años Lucila aún sigue trabajando con la misma fuerza con la que cuando era joven lo hacia. Debido a la preocupación de mantener a sus ocho hijos ella siempre ha visto el modo de generar ingresos a su hogar.

En un inicio, además de vender comida se encargaba de atender en su tienda de abarrotes, pero al cabo de unos años  decidió que una de sus hijas se encargara de la tienda para poder dedicarse por completo a su negocio de comida. Esta decisión fue muy sabia ya que independientemente la tienda y la venta de comida han crecido.

Lucila se encarga de preparar desayunos y almuerzo para repartirlos a numerosos clientes que han ido creciendo en número conforme ella los atendía cada vez mejor. Más adelante, quisiera abrir un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
At the age of sixty-one, Lucila stills works with the same strength she did when she was young. Due to her concern of maintaining her eight children she has always sought ways to generate income for her home. At one point, apart from selling food, she ran her general store, but after some years she decided the leave one of her daughters in charge of the store in order to dedicate herself completely to her food selling business. This was a wise decision as both the store and the food sale businesses have grown. Lucila works to prepare breakfasts and lunches to sell to a large clientele, which has grown in number in proportion to how she has improved her customer service. In the future she would like to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the lunch dishes she sells.

loans.name: Mr. Tol Nhieb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of ten people, is located Chrolorng village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Tol N. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who grows lotus in his lake. His plantation now faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy more lotuses to grow in the lake. Thus, he has decided to request a loan for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Min Lao, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Mr. Tol N. is 29 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study because they are only three and four years old. All the members are presented in the picture but one is blocked.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more lotuses to grow in the lake.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
A sus cincuenta y seis años Rosa lleva toda su vida trabajando en la misma profesión: la confección de ropa bajo pedido, y en general, a la compra y venta de ropa.
Solo lleva ocho meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero como es viuda y sus tres hijas ya son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente ella puede dedicar los préstamos y todas sus ganancias a los pocos gastos de si misma y lo demás, invertirlo en su negocio.
De esta manera espera poder poner in negocio estable de compra y venta de ropa desde su propia casa, hasta un día llegar a tener una tienda.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Rosa has been in the same line of work her entire life: making clothing to order and generally buying and selling clothes. She has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for only eight months, but because she is a widow and her three daughters are adults and financially independent she is able to use her loans and all her profits for her small personal expenses and invest the remainder of her income in her business. In this way she hopes to have a stable business buying and selling clothing out of her own home until she can some day open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She used her last loan to buy material for her clothing business

loans.name: Devmaiya

texts.en:
Devmaiya M. is a resident of Chetrapati, located in Kathmandu district. Most people in this area are engaged in small businesses.

She has three members, including herself in her family. Devmaiya has one daughter who attained grade seven. Both Devmaiya and her husband, Ratna M. opened their grocery shop five years ago, in their own house. They sell different types of grocery items like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting Rs.10,000 loan to buy different types of grocery items for her business. She would like to use her increased income to provide a better education to her daughter.

loans.use: Buy grocery items.

loans.name: Migdalia

texts.es: Migdalia es casada, tiene un  niña de 8 años que estudia 3er grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca de su papa, y le ayuda con los gastos  familiares, trabaja como docente desde hace 10 años en el nerpe Paulino Halssall, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to  crédito para arenillar la casa, a pesar que es  de escasos recursos economicos y que solo cuenta con su salario de maestra  ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsables, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene gran espiritu  de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente esta terminando su ultimo semestre en la  carrera de ciencias de la Educacion. Expresa que se siente agradecida con la institución de AFODENIC  ya que con los anteriores logro tener su propia casa poco a poco, su sueño es tener salud para su familia y tener estabilidad laboral para sacar a su hija adelante.
texts.en:
Midgalia is married, and has an 8 year old daughter who studies on elementary school, her husband works as a farmer at his father's farm, and helps her with family expenses, Migdalia works as a teacher for the past 10 years at Paulino Halssall school. She is requesting refinancing of her 6th loan to repair her house. Although she only has her salary as a teacher, she has demonstrated to be a very responsible woman, honest and hard worker, she has a spirit of professional and work improvement. She is currently finishing her last semester on Educational Science. She is very thankful with AFODENIC because with the previous loans she was able to get her house, her dream is to be healthy for her family and have work stability to help her daughter's improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair at her house

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johann  es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Johann es conviviente  tiene 25 años, dos hijos de 8 y 4 años que están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Termino el colegio  y salio embarazada tuvo que ponerse a trabajar,  se puso a vender ropa por catalogo pero  la mercadería se  demoraba en llegar mas de quince días, y muchos de los pedidos no llegaban por que estaban agotados y sus clientas se desanimaban, hasta que llego ha Finca y puede comprar mercadería al contado y ofrecer a sus clientes, ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa. 
Johann necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de ropa  para venta. 
Desde que esta en Finca se siente espaldada por los préstamos puede comprar ropa y dar a sus clientas a crédito, ha aprendido a ahorrar.
El sueño de Johann es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Johann is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. 25-year old Johann lives with her partner and has two children aged 8 and 4 who are students in the local school. She finished high school, became pregnant, and had to start work. She sold clothes via catalogue, but the goods were slow to arrive, sometimes taking more than fifteen days, and also many of her orders didn’t come because the items were out of stock. Eventually her customers became discouraged. Finally Johann made her way to Kiva partner, Finca, and she can now buy merchanise on credit to offer her clients. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy clothing. Ever since she has been with Finca, she has been able to count on their support to buy clothing, and she can now offer credit to her customers. She has also learned how to save money. Johann’s dream is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Mrs. Thol C. lives in Rolus village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She faces a problem because her field is infertile, which has a bad affect on her crop. In order to solve this problem, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and to make her crop more productive. She would use the rest of the money to buy ducks to boost her poultry business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Toem Mom, is a hard working man who has been hired by the others villagers to do something. Mrs. Thol C. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented on the left of her in the photo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joe’s car accessory business is art in motion. He invented custom external car covers made from unique patterns of faux fur. As an artist he pays attention to detail and has spent countless hours developing his product. His products are very unique.

A few years ago, Joe came to ACCION USA for a loan to create his website. Recently he has requested a loan to purchase more faux fur and to invest money in advertising. His best advertisement is his own car, which he proudly cruises all over New York City and occasionally takes to other cities. The design is “loud” he says, “people are forced to love it or hate it, but at least it wakes them up”.

Joe already has plans for his next loan. He would like to grow his business through high profile advertising.

loans.use: Faux fur and advertising

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is a twenty-one-year-old young lady. She is single and has no child. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Akua is a caterer and deals in pastries. She prepares and sells pastries such as chips (french fries), meat pies, doughnuts, etc. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and also supplies other retailers in her community. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Akua has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Tol L., 49, has been selling little fritters from home for an income. She is a married mother blessed with six children. Four of her children are single and two are married in their own homes.  Another source of family income comes from her husband who sells rattan furniture. He buys furniture in bulk on credit from a handicraft maker and then uses his trailer to sell them door-to-door around the community. Tol L. thinks that her husband’s business is a profitable one so she has decided to seek a loan to increase the capital of his business.

loans.use: To increase the capital of her husband’s business

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en: D. Gunjilmaa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  In 2000, she moved her family to the city in the hope of finding better opportunities and improving their life. In her previous home of Govisumber province in southeastern Mongolia, Gunjilmaa worked as a salesperson at a local grocery store. Upon settling in Ulaanbaatar, she and her husband started a clothes selling business out of a stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. Since then, their business has grown steadily and they have used their profits to open a second stall at the market. Today, their business has capital that exceeds 1.5 million tugrugs (approx. $1,036 USD) and operates with a profit margin of 30-40%. In the future, Gunjilmaa hopes to provide her children, who all currently attend  secondary school, with a quality education. She dreams that they will become well educated and important people for Mongolia. She is requesting a 2million tugrug (approx. $1,381 USD) loan to purchase more clothing goods to sell as her busy season is fast approaching.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing goods

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Mrs. Bella Arbaquez of Barangay Calumangan in Barrio Site, Bago City, Negros Occidental, is a 52-year-old wife and the mother of two children, who is concerned about her family's future. This is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon.

When she and her husband considered starting a business, his skills and knowledge in electronics made them decide to offer electronic repair services to the townspeople of Bago. The only difficulty they had was that they needed capital to start the business so that they could buy the necessary equipment and tools and have working capital. Joining NWTF-Project Dungganon solved this problem for the couple.

With the business up and running, both Bella and her husband work as partners in running the business, and the arrangement has worked well for their family. It has made them more united, and the business is doing well, earning about PHP 30,000 per month, which provides well for their family's needs, and allows them to set aside some money for the future security of their children.

This is Bella's 14th loan from NWTF. She wants to borrow PHP 19,000 to buy more equipment and tools for their business and also add to their working capital.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional equipment and tools to expand business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun D., age 31, is married and resides with her three school-aged children in Kompong Chnang province, Cambodia. D. is employed in a local garment factory, earning approximately $2.60 of profit per day, while her husband is a construction worker, typically earning about US$2 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have been employed, so they would like to take out a loan of US $600 to purchase animals to raise. Any money left over from the loan will be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Victor Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es socia del Banco Comunal Pueblo Libre que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Ramiro es casado, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Ramiro vende ropa variada, sus ventas son al por mayor y reparte a tiendas de acuerdo a pedidos, además Ramiro junto a su esposa tienen cabinas de Internet en su casa.
Ramiro necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora.
Los sueños de Ramiro son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, establecer su negocio y tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.

loans.use: Para la compra de una computadora.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 28 years old. She is a single parent with one child. Her child is currently in school.  She is a hawker and has been hawking cosmetics like earrings, necklace, make ups, perfumes etc. in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income for the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Victoria Maria Carlos

texts.pt:
Victoria Maria nasceu na província central de Sofala, no distrito de cheringoma, tem 49 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 15 e 23 anos e encontram se todos a estudarem. Fez 11 classe e parou há muito tempo por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vive com seu esposo e filhos na mesma casa (cedida pelos serviços) e sustenta também a sua mãe que se encontra na província na tal, enviando dinheiro para despesas correntes. 

Saiu de Sofala no ano de 2002 juntamente com sua família transferida pelos serviços para a província do Maputo e foi afecto no distrito de Boane. É membro da Policia da Republica de Moçambique com salário mensal no valor de 9.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da família e poupa algum valor no Banco comercial (BCI). O seu esposo também é Policia e afecto na mesma esquadra de Boane.

Vem construindo a casa em fase. Já teve empréstimos no Banco comercial (BIM) e depois de terminar o pagamentos decidiu aproximar se a Hluvuku-Adsema e desembolsou duas vezes para aplicar na compra de materiais de construção no valor de 10.000,00mt e 20.000,00mt, respectivamente.

Com o presente credito de 24. 600,00mt pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, areia, ferro e outros) para ampliar a casa e iniciar o murro de vedação.
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder mais créditos com o intuito de finalizar o processo de construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Victoria Maria is from Sofala, central Mozambique. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of 5 children between 15 and 23 years old, all students. She finished 11th grade but had to drop school because of her parents financial difficulties. She lives with her husband and children and also supports her mother by sending her money for basic expenses. She is a member of the Mozambique Police Force and makes U$308 per month, money that she uses to support her family and save some at the Commercial Bank (BCI). She is asking for a U$850 loan in order to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, iron and others) to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies (cement, iron, sand, rocks, and others)

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Doña Ana Alicia de 41 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 18 años que estudia 2do año de la universidad y el menor de 17 años, el cual necesita cuidados especiales, pues cuando era un bebé se enfermo de meningitis y quedo con problemitas, ademas es asmatico. Esta solicitando su 5to credito para la construccion de un porche para su casa, la cual la construyó por medio de un proyecto con CARITAS, pues actualmente esta alquilando y necesita darle condiciones para que su niño esté en un ambiente agradable, expresa que gracias a AFODENIC ella ha logrado comprar los electrodomesticos de su casa y ha podido ir comprando puertas de hierro para darle seguridad a su casa, y ahora espera ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva para mejorar su casita.       Sueña con lograr tener su casa amplia para que su familia pueda vivir comodamente, y si Dios lo permite solicitar otro credito que le ayudaria a cumplir este sueño.
texts.en:
Ana Alicia, 41, is single and the mother of two children. Her eldest is 18 and is a second-year university student and the younger, a 17-year-old, is a special needs child because when he was a baby he got meningitis and this left him with developmental problems; in addition he is asthmatic. She has worked for the last 11 years as an adminstrator. She is requesting her 5th loan to build a porch onto her house, which was built through a project sponsored by CARITAS, because she is still renting because she needs to upgrade her house to accommodate her son's special needs so that he will be in a comfortable environment. She states that thanks to AFODENIC she has been able to buy home appliances and has been buying metal gates to secure her house. She is hoping now to be a beneficiary of a Kiva Fund grant to improve her house. She dreams with having a spacious house so her family can live in comfort and, God willing, be able to request another loan to help her reach this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and get more land under the plow.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin S. C. tiene 66 años, es casado, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Pueblo Nuevo solo con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas para cría. La ayudará em que consequira ingresos cuando venda las crías. Don Agustin se dedica a la ganadería donde vende las crías de las vacas y así obtiene el ingreso, tiene mas de 10 años de estar en esta actividad.  Es la primera vez don Agustin se financia con FUDECOSUR  pero ha tenido otros creditos con coorperativos agricolas. En estos momentos que ya solo vive con la esposa, busca obtener un ingreso para salir adelante. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Agustin S. C. is 66, married, and has no children. He lives alone with his wife in Pueblo Nuevo. He is seeking a loan to buy cattle to breed so he can sell the calves to help him earn income. Agustin has earned his living selling calves for the past ten years. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR, but he has received prior loans from agricultural coops. Since he's just living with his wife, he's looking to earn a living so he can be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Santos Elida

texts.es: Santos Elida A. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San salvador. Vive junto a su madre y una hermana. Santos se dedica a vender bebidas como sodas, cervezas y jugos, así también vende fruta en trocitos, en una cancha en la cual las personas llegan a observar partidos de fútbol. Ya que posee varios años de trabajar de esta manera, ella es muy conocida en el lugar, y las personas le compran por ser una persona muy confiable y aseada. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas y así mismo poder comprar diferentes tipos de fruta. Para Santos es de mucha importancia mejorar las ventas debido a que es este la única fuente de ingresos con el que cuentan en su hogar, es por ello muy necesario obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos Elida A. A., 41, lives in San Salvador department with her mother and sister. Santos sells beverages like sodas, beers and juices. He also sells sliced fruit at a sports venue where people come to watch football games. Since she has been in this line of work for several years now, she is well-known and people buy from her because she is trustworthy and clean. Santos is requesting funding to buy a larger amount of beverages as well as different kinds of fruit. For Santos it is very important to improve sales because this is her only source of income for her family so it is very necessary to produce higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and beverages.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma Y. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Alma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel de 56 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos mayores de su primer matrimonio Luisania de 38 años, Dolores de 28 y Luis de 25, todos trabajan y tienen  su familia formada.  Don Luis trabaja para el MINED en Tecolostote como maestro  desde hace 20 años.  Esta solicitando su 8vo credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de poder reparar las paredes del cuarto de su casa que se encuentran en mal estado, y espera lograrlo con el apoyo de kiva.  El mayor sueño del profesor Luis Manuel es poder mejorar su casa poco a poco para vivir comodo cuando se jubile.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is 56 years old, is married and has three adult children from his first marriage: Luisania who is 38 years old, Dolores who is 28 and Luis who is 25. All of them work and have their own families. Luis has worked for MINED in Tecolostote as a teacher for 20 years. He is requesting his eighth loan from AFODENIC with the goal of being able to repair the walls of the room of his house which is in disrepair and he hopes to achieve it with the support of Kiva. The greatest dream of professor Luis Manuel is to be able to improve his house gradually to live comfortably when he retires.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines está integrado por tres personas humildes y trabajadoras ellos son  Blas Antonio F., María Ines M. Mejía y Jenny Vanessa M. García. El señor Blas Antonio F. apesar de tener 78 años de edad es una persona muy activa e independiente quien desde 2002 tiene su propio negocio una pulperia en la cual va invertir el credito con la compra de productos como granos básicos, queso, confitería, pollo, coca-cola y  pan entre otros.
 
Mientras Jenny Vanessa M. García comenzo vendiendo por encargo luego puso su pequeña tienda donde incio con una docena de ropa. Actualmente su negocio es más gran y requiere de mayor cantidad de inverción  en ropa y    María Ines M. Mejía de 25 años de edad comercializa perfumes desde el 2006.
texts.en:
The group "Los Bailarines" (The Dancers) is made up of three humble and hard-working people. They are Blas Antonio F., Maria Ines M. M. and Jenny Vanessa M. G.. Sr. Blas Antonio F. is 78 years old, and is a very active and independent person. Since 2002, he has had his own business, a local store in which he will invest the loan for the purchase of products such as basic grains, cheese, pastries, chicken, Coca-cola and bread, among other things.

Meanwhile, Jenny Vanessa M. G. began selling to order, then she put her small store where she began with a dozen clothes. Currently, her business is bigger and requires a greater amount of investment in clothing. Maria Ines M. M. is 25 years old and has been marketing perfumes since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, fruits, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia sells baby things like cream, Pampers (diapers), clothes and flasks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is a friendly and hardworking woman.

Felicia is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She is married with four children and she is 38 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy F. is 46 years old and a widowed mother of two. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" THIECKENE for six years and has always paid back her loans on time. Her main activity consists of selling fruits at the local market. With this loan, Amy F. will buy more fruits which she will resell.

loans.use: To buy fruits for resale

loans.name: Marilyn Tayco Group

texts.en:
Marilyn T. is from the village of Bliss, Cabol-anonan Tudela. She is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. Marilyn is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marilyn T. Group.

To make a living, Marilyn runs a store selling both food and daily use products. She has had this business for over six years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month.

In 2007, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cécile H.

texts.fr: Née en 1977, S. Cécile H. vit depuis une quinzaine d'année au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cécile est mariée à DOSSOU Jean, un cuisinier, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Cécile n'a jamais été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. En plus de cette activité qu'elle exerce, Cécile vend également des mèches, des produits de coiffure et des tissus dans son atelier de coiffure situé au quartier Sodjéatinmey à Cotonou. Cécile achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Cécile sollicite un cinquième prêt en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1977, S. Cecile H. has lived for fifteen years in the Dandji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to DOSSOU John, a cook, and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  She lives with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Cecilia never attended school, but she learned how to style hair.  In addition to this work she has, Cecilia also sells hair extensions, hairdressing products, and fabrics in her hair salon located in the Sodjéatinmey district in Cotonou.  Cecilia is a former ALIDé client having already obtained four loans, which have all been repaid. She is requesting a fifth loan to raise her business level and to cope better with the different demands of her customers. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and hairstyling products

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en: T. Ainur is the leader of this group. She is forty-five years old and has three children. Her two sons are sixteen and fifteen and her daughter is eleven. For Ainur’s family, living in a village does seem to be a burden, unlike many other villagers who leave villages because of an absence of opportunities for improving one’s living standards. Ainur’s husband has been working as a physics teacher in a local school. As for Ainur, she has been engaged in cattle breeding and increasing the total population of their livestock. Their stable income from raising the livestock for resale, is $90 a month. Ainur’s children have already learned the aspects of this activity and actively provide help when needed after school. Ainur and her husband are good examples of the category of people who prefer to make the best use of the conditions and opportunities available instead of blaming others for not being able to live properly. Recently they made a decision to make some changes to their house as well. They decided to build a new house and a separate bathroom. This is not an easy task and they need quite a lot of financial support. Therefore Ainur strongly hopes to obtain this loan to start building. Ainur’s partners: R. Lira, 51, has three children. Her husband works as a security guard and he also farms land. Lira is a housewife. Besides that, she keeps some cattle at home and thus helps her husband have an extra source of family income. Lira needs a loan to buy fuel, seed potatoes and wheat seeds for the family farm. I. Baktygul, 53, has four children and her husband is a private farmer. Baktygul is a language schoolteacher; she teaches both Russian and Kyrgyz. They also own a piece of land and now need a loan to buy fuel for farming. Z. Aftandil, 24, is single. He wants to get married and buy a car but he knows that to achieve this, he needs to work hard and earn a sufficient amount of money. He has already started saving money. Now he farms land and needs a loan to buy fuel and seed potatoes. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To start building a house

loans.name: Carreon's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 37 years old. Evelyn is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is C.'s Group.

Evelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional capital for her sari-sari store. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Lucia is 41 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a member of 'Transparency' self-help group under Faulu Kenya.  She operates  Hardwork Retail Shop which has been running for one and a half years.  She was previously employed but went into business so as to earn more income.  Her husband is an accountant by profession and he works hard to support her in the business.  

Christine, a mother of two, hopes to venture into a salon business in the future.  For this reason, she wants to expand her shop for better income so as to invest in the salon business.  She has requested 40,000 KES to add stocks of cereals, vegetables, fruit and spices. She describes herself as assertive and hard-working.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals, vegetables, fruits and spices

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 53 years old and a widow.  She has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells food, mainly snacks, meats, fish and other kinds of food. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $87 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Janima de 23 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene una tienda de víveres en la ventana de su casa. 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la ventana de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, legumbres para mejorar y surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande y surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Janima, 23, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a hilly periurban area with unpaved streets). She has a grocery store in her home. She started out with just a display case selling candy and beverages. Gradually she stocked foodstuffs. She now has a small stocked store that she operates out of one of her home’s windows; she sells candy, beverages and grains. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, beverages and vegetables to improve and better stock her store. In the future she’d like her store to be larger and better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice and beverages.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios D., 58, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Victoriano D., a salesman, and she has five children, one of whom is already working while the younger children are at home and help Remedios manage the household and the business. By the grace of God, Remedios has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Remedios, but as she herself has been a college undergraduate she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Remedios operates a food business. She sells frozen cuts of cured, sweetened and spiced meats such as pork, sausages, hot dogs and ham. She peddles these rather like direct selling (but instead it is food rather than clothing and cosmetics). Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue to operate her business, Remedios is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more cured meats. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Remedios dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have a comfortable and well-off future with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more cured meats

loans.name: Justo Juan

texts.es: Justo Juan tiene 47 años vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposa con su hijo a su cargo de 13 años. Hace más de 3 años, se dedica a su pulpería, pues luego de varios años de trabajo y esfuerzo logró establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda, le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque interactúa bastante con sus clientes, pues su día empieza a las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche ya que todo el día pasa atendiendo a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, pues no quiere defraudar la confianza depositada en él, y porque más adelante quiere seguir trabajando para progresar, comprará granos básicos de primera necesidad, jugos, mecates, detergentes y golosinas por lo que espera tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Justo Juan is 47 and lives in his own home with his with his wife and his son of 13 years. He has worked in his neighborhood convenience store for over three years. He succeeded in establishing his own business in his home after many years of work and effort. He enjoys his work very much because he interacts a lot with his clients. His day begins at 6 in the morning and goes untils 9 at night since he attends to clients all day long. This is his first loan and he promises to make his payments on time. He does not want to let down those who have placed their trust in him. In the future he wants to continue to work towards progress. He will purchase basic foodstuff grains, juice, string, detergents and sweets, with which he hopes to make the biggest gains.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline C. is a 29-year-old married woman, who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and food vending business. She lives in Sitio To-ong, Sam-ang, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 4,000. 

Jacquiline is now borrowing PHP 13,000, so that she can purchase more merchandise to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of  PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jacquiline aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
