They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Restock her general store with new merchandise

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo, de 45 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Adolfo, son el principal sustento que tiene, tanto la papa como la arveja, son productos muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar la producción de estos productos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 45 years old and a simple, hard-working man who lives alone in the house he inherited from his parents.  His greatest desire is to be successful in life.  Adolfo has planted his fields with a great deal of effort, and they are the principal source of his livelihood. He grows potatoes and peas, products that are in high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma.  His reputation for growing high-quality crops helps him to sell his products at very good prices.

The part he most enjoys about his work is protecting his seedlings from the insect plagues that can damage production.  He has 15 years of experience in this type of work and he considers the most difficult thing to be transporting the sacks of potatoes and peas, as they are very heavy and it tires him out.  In the future, he hopes to buy more land so he can increase his production.

This is his sixth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and he knows that this support will be very beneficial towards developing his work.  Among his communal bank, he is a very cheerful member who always brings order to their meetings.  He will use this 2,000 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to make his fields more fertile.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ligsaa

texts.en:
Ligsaa H. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Harhorin, the ancient city of Mongolian empire. His daughter attends a local elementary school and his wife works as a milkmaid with 50,000 MNT of monthly salary.

Ligsaa has been working as a carpenter and providing a service to saw wood for households since 2000 and has gained much experience. He usually produces a truck of firewood, worth between 20,000 and 40,000 MNT, using his own handsaw. With his loan, he is planning to purchase a new motorcycle and start operating a transportation business in his town in order to support his family. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan, plus his own cash, in order to purchase a new motorcycle at 800,000 MNT for his future transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela S. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Estela is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Estela owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Estela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 36 years old, has a very supportive and responsible husband, Glecerio, who is now 41 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.  One source of their income comes from fishing.  Her husband works as a fisherman but this only gives them a small income.  Her husband works hard all day catching fish in the ocean, but he brings home a very small amount of money because the ones who own the fishing equipment get a larger amount, and they will only give him a small percent.

So Agnes decided to request loan again with Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy fishing equipment so that the revenue will be only for them. She will used the loan to buy fishing cages (fish traps), fishing nets, and other things that are needed in her fishing business. She will help her husband sell the fish that he will catch in the sea. 

She decided to set up this business in order to increase their daily income and sustain their needs, like everyday expenses and the education of her five children: Christine Joy - 17 years old, Crister - 14 years old, Jess - 9 years old, John - 7 years old, and Roman - 4 years old. 

Agnes is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support for her business dreams.

loans.use: To buy fish cages/traps, nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo O. is from the village of Benito, Soliven, Isabela. He is 46 years old and married. To make a living, Guillermo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Guillermo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Guillermo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillermo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and crops to raise. Guillermo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Guillermo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shaimkan's Group

texts.en:
Kyrgyz and Russian markets are interdependent. Russia imports fresh vegetables, fruits and dried fruits from Kyrgyzstan, which in turn is dependent on Russian flour and grains. So far the exchange has been successful and both sides are hoping for a bright future of goods exchange. 

Shaimkan A., 52, is a treasurer of this group. It’s been 19 years since she and her husband began exporting fresh vegetables and fruits to Russian markets. They have raised two sons and a daughter, who have chosen different professions in life. Their daughter became a professional cook, one of their sons chose electrical maintenance, the other became a musician. 

After she was widowed, Shaimkan decided to stop her involvement in international trade and she started working in a local food market. She invested 20,000 soms for a business start-up. Now she earns 17,000 soms in monthly profit and puts this back into goods circulation. Shaimkan joined this group for a loan that would bring changes to her life. She would like to diversify the goods in her shop, and spend the proceeds on purchasing a new house. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry L. is from the village of Upper Lamac,Oroquieta City. He is 35 years old. Larry is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Larry owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation service to local community members. Larry has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Larry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Larry is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Larry from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide  improvedservice

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr:
Femme de 46 ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 13ans à 19ans tous scolarisés. Elle se lança dans la vente des boîtes de peintures et de sanitaires au marché en 1990. En 1995 avec ses bénéfices elle ouvre une quincaillerie avec un capital de 500000frs.
Le premier prêt était très bénéfique pour elle , ses ventes journalières sont passés de 50000F à 800000F. 
Avec le second  prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant: des carreaux, ampoules , pinceaux,  robinets, prises et contacts pour l'électricité et autres matériaux de construction.
 
Elle épargnait lors des remboursements, ce qui lui a permis d'améliorer son étalage  pour attirer plus de clientèle. 
Elle aimerait que son activité prospère   afin d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille , les encourager et les aider dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
A 46-year old woman, single and the mother of two children, 13 and 19 years of age, both of whom in school. In 1999, she started selling house paint and toilet bowls. In 1995, thanks to her income, she was able to open a hardware store with a starting capital of 50000 West African francs. The first loan has been very beneficial for her. Her daily receipts have gone up from 50,000 francs to  800000.

With the second loan, she is going to bolster her business by purchasing tiles, light bulbs, brushes, faucets, electric outlets and  plugs and other building supplies. She was able to save money after repaying her loan, which has allowed her to enhance her stock of goods and attract more customers. She would like her business to succeed so that her family’s life conditions would be improved. She would like to encourage and help her children in their studies.

loans.use: Purchasing tiles, faucets, electric outlets and plugs, brushes, cans of paint

loans.name: Miriam Noemi

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam, ella tiene  años 56 años de edad, está separada hace ya algún tiempo atrás y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad solo su hija menor que ya es casada vive en su casa con su familia.

Trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la localidad pero además de esto se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días de dos a tres horas por dia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todas las  semanas, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 10 años y que le va muy bien, lo que más vende según nos cuenta son los cosméticos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Esta desde el segundo ciclo que se formo el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener recursos suficientes para ayudar a sus hijos a que tengan sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the Esperanza Nueva Communal Banks meets in the city of Tosagua, a place that is known for being very dynamic.  Most of the inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is also an area of abundant vegetation.  

In this place, we meet Miriam.  She is 56 years old and separated from her husband some time ago.  She has 5 children from this relationship, all adults. Her youngest daughter is married and she and her and her family live at home with Miriam.   

She is a teacher at the town school but in addition she has a business selling Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies’ accessories).  She works two to three hours a day leaving her products on credit and collecting payments each week.  She tells us that she has been in this business for ten years and that she is doing very well. She also tells us that cosmetics are the product that she sells the most.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  The loan is from the communal bank’s second cycle.  Miriam is pleased because the payments are easy to make.  She dreams of having sufficient resources to help her children establish their own businesses.    
.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Nicolen

texts.en:
Nicolen V. is 52 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. He is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Nicolen is engaged in the retail sector running a general store. Despite close competition in the market he was able to manage his business for more than two years and earned a monthly net income of 3500 PHP. The secret of his success came from being hard-working and maintaining his good customer care.

In 2010, Nicolen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolen is requesting his 1st loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock for his existing business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for the store

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty is a married woman who lives in Sofronio Espanola, Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling rice (palay), operating a general store and farming. Her husband Sebastian, who is 47 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between 10 and 18 years old. Liberty joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liberty has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase rice to sell and fertilizer for her farming operation so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of business. Liberty is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 28 years old, married, with 5 children and 4 of them go to school. Elizabeth borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Salome Wangari

texts.en: Salome is 28 years old, married to Joseph Wanjiku and they have one child. She has operated her beauty salon shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy hair products and chemicals for use in her salon. In the future, Salome hopes to expand her beauty shop and be able to offer more services.

loans.use: to buy hair products and chemicals for use in her salon

loans.name: Sor Dionicia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sor Dionisia esta integrado por tres mujeres que tienen negocios propios, este grupo esta ubicado en la colonia Sor Dionicia de la ciudad de NAcaome, las integrantes tienen varios años de conocerse y son muy amigas, decidieron formarse en grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
a continuacion detallamos las actividades que ellas realizan:
La señora Cruz del Carmen A., se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
La señora Alcida A. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y la joven Yennifer C. se dedica a la venta de ropa.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de abarroteria, frutas, verduras y ropa.
Estas mujeres tienen muchos deseos de superacion, sus metas es crecer con sus negocios para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group Sor Dionisia is made up of three women who have their own businesses. The group is located in the suburb of Sor Dionicia in the city of Nacaome. The members have known each other for some years and are very good friends. They decided to form this group to get ahead with their businesses and their families. 

We will detail the activities that they carry out:
Mrs. Cruz del Carmen A. sells popular consumer goods from a small grocery store in her home.
Mrs. Alcida A. sells fruits and vegetables.
The young Yennifer C. sells clothes.

The loan will be used to buy groceries, fruits, vegetables and clothes. 

These women really want to move forward; their goals are to grow their businesses to give a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, lard, oil, margarine, corn, flour, bread, sodas, juices, soups, pastas, toilet paper, toothpaste, vegetables, fruits, pork, beef and chicken, cosmetics, sandals and clothing.

loans.name: Nguluwe

texts.en:
Nguluwe is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells coconuts, which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nguluwe dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of dry fish and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of dry fish and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is an entrepreneur from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has two kids.

Nenita is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises pigs. Nenita plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She also plans to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Twebaze Womens Group

texts.en: Norah is 40 years old and sells beverages, fruit, and vegetables at her grocery store in Mpigi town.  She is a happily married mother of seven.  Norah says that she worked in weaving and making handcrafts before she joined this business. Since becoming involved in the grocery store, she has stopped her weaving and handcrafts work.  Norah is an easygoing, upbeat, hard-working and focused businesswoman. This may just be the stock in trade she needs to open up a better horizon of opportunity for her business in the future. On the side, she ekes out further revenue from a small brick-sales business. She says her business generates profits of 150,000 shillings each month. This loan is to aid her in purchasing more crates of soft drinks and fruit and vegetables to resell at her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, fruit, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: La Volonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA VOLONTE DE DIEU est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Micheline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Micheline est née le 04 Avril 1976 au Bénin. Micheline est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Micheline a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Micheline mène comme activité la vente de tissus, d'ustensiles de cuisine et de bijoux de façon secondaire, depuis une trentaine d'année. Micheline s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus, l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Micheline et aux autres membres du groupe LA VOLONTE DE DIEU, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
LA VOLONTE DE DIEU (God's Will) is a group made up of three people whose president (the one who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Micheline. The members of the group live in the same district. Wishing to grow their working capital, this group is asking for a loan from ALIDé for the second time. 

Micheline was born on April 4, 1976 in Bénin. She is married to a teacher named Christophe. The couple has three children, all enrolled in school, and living together with their parents. 

Micheline stopped attending school at the secondary level. To support herself and her children, Micheline has been selling cloth, kitchen utensils and secondarily, jewelry for some thirty years. She buys her merchandise in a market in Bénin. This activity generates income that helps her cover the various family expenses. This second loan will certainly help Micheline and the other members of the group LA VOLONTE DE DIEU, to expand their businesses and grow their clientele and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and jewelry.

loans.name: Demtila

texts.en:
Demtila is 45 years old and married. She has six children who depend on her. She is a businesswoman operating a quarry. She has been in this business for the past ten years.

Demtila knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid her previous loan successfully, without complication. This is her fifth loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to employ temporary workers to aid her business. 

She hopes to venture into other businesses and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to employ temporary workers to aid her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 57 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha luchado por sobresalir, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Emilio de 55 años y su querida hija menor Yoisela de 17 años, a quien brindan todo su apoyo. El restaurante de Reyna es el más concurrido del barrio “Vista Alegre” de la ciudad de San Francisco, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su restaurante para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara como: arroz con pollo, tallarin, lomo saltado, entre otros platos. Ella es una cocinera muy buena, aprendió de los secretos de su madre y desde entonces le nació el amor por la cocina. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y poner el toque del sabor es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más dificultoso es cuando sus clientes se acumulan y le falta la mano para poder atender a todos. Reyna espera beneficiarse con el crédito ya que desea renovar sus utensilios que están deteriorados por nuevos porque desea brindar una buena atención a sus asiduos comensales. Y Más adelante espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante. Es será su 15avo crédito de Reyna con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y  por ello espera contar con el mismo apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos trata de mejorar su condición de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará utensilios nuevos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 57, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Emilio, 55, and her beloved younger daughter, Yoisela, 17, that they give all their support to.  

Reyna’s restaurant is located in the crowded “Vista Alegre” neighborhood in the city of San Francisco.  Every day customers schedule themselves to enjoy the delicious meals she prepares in her restaurant like: rice with chicken, noodles, ‘lomo saltado’ (dish consisting of strips of sirloin marinated in vinegar, soy sauce and spices, then stir fried with red onions, parsley and tomatoes. It is traditionally served over white rice with homemade French fries that look more like potato wedges), among other dishes.  She’s a very good cook having learned her mother’s secrets and loving cooking since then.  What she most likes about her work is cooking and adding a touch of flavor which she does with much dedication.  She’s been in this line of work for 28 years and thinks that it's most problematic when customers crowd in and she lacks sufficient hands to tend to all of them.

Reyna hopes to benefit from the loan because she wants to exchange her deteriorated kitchen utensils for new ones because she wants to provide better attention to her demanding customers.

This will be her 15th loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her payments and because of this hopes to once again enjoy the same level of support she’s had from lenders because thanks to their support she tries to improve her living conditions.  

She is a very responsible member of the communal bank which makes her very well liked.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy new kitchen utensils.

loans.use: to buy new utensils.

loans.name: Hanzel Feda

texts.en:
Hanzel Feda is 29 years old and single. She has a grocery store in her home where she works. She has been running this business for one year and three months. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly. 

Hanzel Feda would like to ask for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to be used in buying groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, sugar, oil, canned goods and rice for her retail shop business. She dreams of having a well-stocked store to attract more costumers, increase sales and improve earnings in order to expand her shop into bigger one.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, sugar, oil, canned goods and rice for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Fausto Euclides

texts.es:
Fausto Euclides tiene 37 años soltero tiene una hija pero no vive con él de 16 años  vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

 Fausto se dedica al cultivo de cacao, maíz y plátano. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es  tener casa propia para dejar a la hija.

Le gusta  salir de viaje con la hija y pasar con los padres.
texts.en:
Fausto Euclides, 37, is single.  He has a 16 year old daughter but she doesn’t live with him.  He lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Unión” (New Union) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

Fausto grows cocoa beans, corn and bananas.  He makes his purchases and his sales at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the fall in price of the products he sells and dealing with middlemen. 

His dream is to have a house of his own to leave to his daughter and he enjoys going on trips with his daughter and spending time with his parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Nowadays, life becomes difficult due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, but according to Estrelita, "Life must go on whatever happens." She is a hardworking mother who is now 55 years old and has seven adult children. Through her patience and sacrifices, most of their children are graduated from college. Rice farming is the main source of their income. Her husband is her only partner in managing their rice fields. They have been in this business for almost 40 years, earning a profits of 25,000 Philippines pesos (P) in every harvest season.

They aimed to increase their yields this coming harvest season so that they will earn a higher income to acquire their daily needs and save for future emergencies. But due to inadequate capital, Estrelita is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. They believe that the loan will help a lot to increase their yields, and they hope that in the future, they will become financially stable as they continue to work and strive.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 54 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos, a quienes les brinda todo su apoyo. Victoria es responsable y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante; pues ella cultiva cacao, café y achiote, productos que son llevados a vender en los centros de acopio de las ciudades de  Santa Rosa y San Francisco. Ahí tiene diversos compradores, quienes sabiendo de la calidad de sus frutos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le es muy rentable por que gracias a ello mejoró de a poco su condicio de vida y apoya a sus hijos con su educación. Con el crédito solicitado comprará estiércol de animales para mejorar la calidad de sus productos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos ya que desea que sus hijos sean profesionales. Este será su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este porte le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará estiércol de animales para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en: Victoria, originally from the city of Santa Rosa, is 54 years old. She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own house. She lives with her two children, to whom she offers all of her support. Victoria is responsible and works with great care in order to get ahead. She cultivates cocoa, coffee and achiote. She brings these to sell at the trading centers in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco, where she has various buyers who, knowing the quality of her products, do not hesitate to wait to buy from her. When it comes to her work, Victoria most enjoys planting her fields and making them fertile and productive. She has been doing this work for twenty years and considers it to be quite profitable. Thanks to her work, she has been supporting her children's education and, little by little, improving her quality of life. She will use this loan to buy animal manure to improve the quality of her crops. Going forward, Victoria hopes to continue to save her earnings, and she dreams that her children will become professionals. This will be her third loan through MFP and she knows that this support will be very useful in the progress of her work. She will use the 3,000 nuevos soles to buy animal manure to fertilize her land.

loans.use: to buy animal manure

loans.name: Shijir

texts.en: Shijir is 35 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His eldest daughter goes to high school, and his two sons go to kindergarden. His wife is currently unemployed and sometimes sells livestock. He started his business in 2007 by transporting goods and products between cities. Before, he used to drive a truck. He switched the truck for a minivan. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I do my best to bring good service to my clients. I also want to provide a good education and good living conditions for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000-Mongolian-tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Bumali

texts.en: Bumali is a Ugandan male aged 43-years who needs a loan to buy maize produce for resale. The produce retail store owner hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of seven children aged between 24 - 8. Having had this business for 10 years, he dreams of owning a food store and acquiring a vehicle so as to ease the transportation work plus educating his children.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for resale.

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru: Латиф женат имеет двоих детей. Для содержания семьи он занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Также в сезон занимается торговлей яблок. Имеет хорошие доходы. Он построил себе веранду и хочет получить займ для отделки и ремонта своего дома. Он надеется получить займ и улучшить свое благосостояние.
texts.en: Latif is married and has two children.  In order to support his family, he is involved in fattening up cattle.  He is also involved in selling apples during the season.  Latif built himself a veranda and wants to obtain a loan for finishes and repairs of his house.  He hopes to get this loan and improve his well-being.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Maigul

texts.en: Maigul is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her eldest daughter is a college student and the younger two are school students. She started her garment retailing business in 2002. Now, her daily income is 100,000 MNT. Now that winter is approaching, she needs more warm clothes to retail. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Since my business is the only income to the family, I have to do everything I can in order to support my children". She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has 10 children. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With the profits from farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Madame Marie et une femme mariée de 33 ans qui habite dans une des  banlieues  du Sénégal. Elle est commerçante  et s’active dans la vente  de tissus et prêts  à porter, fruits  en meme temps qu’elle est restauratrice. Elle a une expérience de 9 ans dans ses activités. Elle a hérité son activité de sa mère qui l’a initié depuis qu’elle avait 17 ans. Ce qui l’y intéresse  le plus ce sont  les revenus que lui génère son activité et qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels, mais aussi  le Relation ship entre elle et la communauté. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons qui seront destinés à la vente. Ce financement lui permettra de pouvoir développer son commerce ce qui aura des conséquences financières et sociales positives  sur sa vie.
texts.en: Mrs Marie is a married 33 year old woman who lives in a suburb of a Senegalese city. She is a business woman who has been involved in sales of cloth, ready to wear clothing and fruits during the past 9 years. She inherited this activity from her mother who initiated her from the age of 17. She is pleased with the profits she receives, which allow her to satisfy her personal needs, and also enjoys the relationship she has with her community through this work. She has been a member of the UIMCEC bank in her community since 2002. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs [approximately 1050 USD] in order to purchase lambs, which she will re-sell. This financing will allow her to further develop her activity, which will have positive financial and social benefits in her life.

loans.use: purchase lambs to re-sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Marilou has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 18,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yodenis

texts.es: Yodenis de 26 años es una joven casada que tiene un hijo de 3 años,  con el que sueña ver convertido en una persona de bien y exitosa. Ella es propietaria de una tapicería de sillas para  vehículos,  a través de diversos tipos de telas en hermosos colores. Yodenis  trabaja en compañía de su cónyuge diariamente  y en horarios extendidos.  Sus principales clientes son los propietarios de vehículos  de transporte público y privado. Alcanzar su sueño de crecimiento es una constante en su vida, pues desea   estar bien posicionada y tener un centro especial de tapicería en un punto comercial de mucha concurrencia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer  financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, cordobán, esponjillas, telas de alfombras, silicona y otras materiales e insumos, en mayor volumen con el fin de ganar descuentos, aumentar su producción y más aún poder responder a su creciente clientela. Su mayor desafío ha sido  lograr la financiación de su negocio y esto es justamente lo que planea alcanzar con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Yodenis is 26 years old. She is a young married woman and she has a 3 year old son and her dream is to bring him up to be a good successful person. She is the owner of an automobile car seat upholstery shop and she carries various types of fabrics in beautiful colors.

Yodenis works with her husband every day with extended hours. Her main customers are the vehicle owners of public transport services and private owners. Her dream of reaching her goal is always on her mind because she wants to be well positioned and to have a special upholstery shop in a commercial field where there is so much competition. 

She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first loan through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she would be able to buy fabrics, leather, sponge padding, carpeting, silicone, and other materials and supplies in larger quantities in order to qualify for discounts, increase her production, and even more, to be able to respond to her growing client base. Her biggest challenge has been to obtain financing for her business and this is just what she plans to achieve through the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, leather, sponge padding, carpeting, silicone, and other materials and supplies in larger quantities

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella vende desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,tambien se dedica a cocinar platos como estofado de pollo,pollo al horno,saltado (es un plato a base de carne frita con papas fritas) entre otros platos,por medio de este negcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma keeps on engaging in her meals selling activity. She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner meals, and she also cooks dishes such as chicken stew, baked chicken, strip steak (fried meat with french fries) and more. Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children. Her dream is to expand and improve her meals selling activity. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetable at wholesale price.

loans.name: Mariela De Jesus

texts.es: A sus 39 años de edad, la señora Mariela es madre de 5 hijos de 23, 17, 15, 9 años y un bebe de 14 meses de nacido, con el ánimo de brindar a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, día a día la señora Mariela se dedica a la compra, engorde y venta de pollos en un pequeño lugar adecuado en el patio de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le brindo todo el conocimiento necesario para desempeñarse en esta labor. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, la señora Mariela necesita de la compra de pollos con los cuales pueda seguir con su negocio y cumplir su sueño de ampliar su negocio y brindar un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: At the age of 39, Mariela is the mother of five children who are 23, 17, 15 and 9 years old and a 14-month-old baby.  With the aim of providing her children with a good quality of life, Mariela buys chicks to sell that she raises in a small space she set aside in her yard to do so.  She learned this activity from her mother who taught her everything needed to develop in this activity.  Aiming to improve sales and income, Mariela needs to buy chicks to stay in business and reach her dream of expanding it and provide better wellbeing for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygamiques à NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers populaires de la ville de KADIOLO (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
SITAN debout 1ère à droite sur la photo fait la transformation et vente de beurre de karité dans ce groupe. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une douzaine de sacs de 100kg de noix de karité. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Kadiolo ville et au grand marché de la ville les jour de foires.
Après transformation en beurre de karité, elle les vend au marché  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djantoyerela group are married women averaging 41 years of age, with five children. They live in polygamous families in Noumousso, a working-class neighborhood  in the town of Kadiolo (the third administrative district of Mali). They are on their seventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. Prior loans have been duly repaid. Sitan, standing on the far right on the photo, is the one who prepares and sells shea butter in this group.

She plans to use her loan to purchase a dozen of 100-kg bags of shea nuts. She stocks up in the villages around the town of Kadiolo, and at the big town market on market days. After preparing shea butter, she sells it at the market and out of her home, to a customer base composed of both men and women, for cash. She plans to achieve an average monthly profit of 37,250 West African Francs, one part of which will be used to pay off the loan with interest, and the other part put away as savings.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts

loans.name: Lilian Carmita

texts.es: Lilian tiene 58 años vive Suburbio zona sur urbana de Guayaquil. Tiene un taller de confecciones y bazar el cual inicio hace 22 años. Su trabajo diario empieza a las 9 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Lilian nos comenta que es muy  agradable su trabajo. Ella comenta que sus clientes frecuentes están muy asociados a ella ya que le gusta darles un buen trato. Gracias a su carisma y a sus amistades tiene exito en negocio. En la temporada de clases es cuando mas costuras tengo el por eso mi negocio crece mas. Espera conservar las fuerzas para continuar y ayudar a sus hijos en especial a su hija menor que está culminando sus estudios de secundaria. Lilian en su vida a tenido fortaleza en Dios y ayuda de su esposo  que trabajo de conserje y es pastor de una iglesia. Algunas dificultades para ella en su negocio es al comprar su mercadería lo hace con mucho receló al temor de la delincuencia. A pesar de las pruebas que Dios ha puesto en su vida a sabido continuar. Ella se siente realizada con su negocio quiere seguir trabajando. Nos dice que gracias a los créditos su casa su negocio han ido cambiando poco a poco...
texts.en: Lilian González Espinoza is 58 years old. She lives in El Suburbio, in the southern part of the urban area of Guayaquil. She has a tailoring workshop and stationery store, which she started 22 years ago. Her daily work begins at 9 in the morning until 10 at night. Lilian tells us that her work is very pleasant. She says that her frequent customers are very close with her, since she gives them good service. Thanks to her charisma and her friendships she is successful in her business. During the school year is when she has the most sewing, and this is why her business is growing more. She hopes to conserve her strength in order to continue and help her children, especially her youngest daughter, who is finishing her secondary school studies. In her life, Lilian has had strength in God and help from her husband, who works as a concierge and is the pastor of a church. A difficulty for her in her business is that when she buys her merchandise she does so very warily, afraid of delinquency. In spite of the tests that God has put in her life, she has known how to continue on. She feels fulfilled in her business. She wants to continue working and to continue with D-MIRO. She says that thanks to the loans, her house and her business have been changing bit by bit...

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a widower aged 43; he has two children. He applied for a loan of eight million shillings to buy cows to trade. He has been in this business for the last ten years and has vast experience in this and because of this very business he has been able to educate his siblings as well as children.

Apart from cattle keeping and trade, Wilson is also engaged in various economic activities like trading in milk and goats which supplement his income. However, Wilson faces some challenges: lack of enough capital being the biggest contributor followed by vagaries of weather and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a 52-year-old man who lives in a town of San Dionisio, Iloilo. He is a father of two children; one adult and one school aged child. For thirty two years, this man raised his family by buying and selling second hand television.
 
He dreams to improve this livelihood because he wants to have better and more comfortable means of living in the future. To do this, he needs an additional capital to operate this business continuously. He will buy more second hand television to sell. In this way, he will be able to increase her profit

loans.use: to buy more second hand television

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Born June 6, 1967 in Lomé (Golfe prefecture), Ms. Fatima R. is a married mother of two children and also takes care of another child. She has a shop where she sells cosmetic products. Her husband has been unemployed for five years and barely contributes to the household income. Most of the family’s expenses are thus her responsibility, which is very difficult for her. With her business she manages to meet the basic needs of her family, but she does not have enough capital to develop her business and increase her income. She is a very serious businesswoman and has easily been able to manage and repay her first two loans.

Today Ms. Fatima R. is requesting a new loan of $1000 to create a larger stock of cosmetic products and to meet the needs of her customers. This loan will increase her income and allow her to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 06 Juin 1967 à Lomé (P/Golfe), Madame R. Fatima est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et à sa charge 1 enfant. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits de beauté dont elle a une boutique. Son mari en chômage depuis 5 ans, ne contribue presque plus aux besoins du ménage et la grande partie des charges de la famille repose sur elle, ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Avec à son commerce, elle se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accroître son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Très sérieuse dans ses affaires, elle pu gérer et rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans difficulté.

Aujourd’hui, Madame R. Fatima sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1000 pour augmenter son stock de produits de beauté et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Ce crédit augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Cosmetic product sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase chairs, tables and expand the business premises

loans.name: Kerubo

texts.en: Florence is a 35 year old mother of three. She has been selling potatoes for a living for a long time and is seeking a loan to help her expand her business to include more vegetables. This will enable her to earn a gross profit of 4 USD per day and allow her to educate her children and have them lead a better life.

loans.use: to diversify my business to include vegetables

loans.name: Vegina

texts.en: Vegina E. is 40 years of age, and is married with three children. She started her business in 2004 has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization for eight years. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in cooked food, and the sale of drinks and water. She is requesting the above loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy drinks, flour & food items

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.ru:
Umriniso is the mother of 5 children and is 41 years old. Her husband is earning money in Russia and sends money to support the family. Umriniso sells greens and canned vegetables at the market. The profits from the business add to the family income. She has been working with MicroInvest for a year. The loans have had a positive effect on her business.

Umriniso plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умринисо мать пятерых детей и ей 41 год. Ее муж находится на заработках в России и присылает денег на содержание семьи. Сама Умринисо продает зелень и консервированные овощи на рынке. Доход от бизнеса является прибавкой к семейному доходу. С Микроинвест она сотрудничает уже год. Полученные займы положительно сказываются на течении ее бизнеса. Она собирается получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Ni Komang Swastini

texts.id:
Penghasilan suami yang pas-pasan sebagai  tukang bangunan bahkan sering tidak cukup untuk biaya hidup keluarga, membuat Ni Komang Suastini turut bekerja keras untuk mendapatkan tambahan penghasilan . Usaha yang menjadi pilihan Ni Komang Suastini adalah sebagai pedagang hasil bumi, yaitu membeli berbagai jenis hasil panen petani seperti Pisang , mangga, kelapa, nangka ,kakau ,dan yang lainya tergantung musim. Kemudian di bawa ke pasar Negara untuk di jual kembali. Dalam sehari  Ni Komang Suastini mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 30,000,- s/d 35.000,- dari modal yang hanya Rp 500.000,- . Aktifitas yang dilakukan Ni Komang Suastini mulai dari pukul 10.00 pagi berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor  miliknya untuk mencari barang dagangan , setelah barang terkumpul dirasa cukup , kira-kira pukul 16.00 barang itu langsung di bawanya ke pasar Negara untuk di jual pada pedagang yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetapnya . Demikian kegiatan ini dilakukan hampir setiap hari.  
         Mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari oleh Ni Komang Suastini di gunakan untuk menambah modal dan juga untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor  yang ada sehinga usahanya berjalan lebih lancar.

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi barang dagangan dan untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor yang dipakai untuk berdagang agar memperlancar usahanya

loans.name: Marila

texts.es:
History of the client: Marila sells food and prepares dishes to sell in the mornings. She lives in Irpavi II en the city of La Paz. Her stand is located at bus stop 248. This is the second time she is requesting a loan. Her history qualifies her as a 1-rated client, which means she has a good history of making her payments. The requested amount will go towards purchasing merchandise (rice, noodles, potatoes, and vegetables). Her work qualifies her to apply for this credit, and since she has experience in this business, her income will let her pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Historia del Cliente: La señora Marila vende comida y prepara platos extras para vender por las mañanas. Vive en Irpavi II en la ciudad de La Paz, su puesto esta ubicado en la parada del minibús 248. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (arroz fideo papa y verduras en general). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of inputs for her food business

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha´s passion is dressmaking, and some time ago that was her main source of income. But as time went on, her sewing machines became obsolete and it became harder and harder to compete with other dressmakers. For that reason, two years ago she put in a beauty salon and 8 years ago put a phone booth in the same premises.

In addition to these businesses, three days a week Mirtha cares for an elderly couple. She does not do this for money but because of the affection she feels for them.

Mirtha´s dream is to once again have a dressmaking workshop, for which she will need money to buy the necessary equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La pasión de Mirtha es la confección, y hace algún tiempo fue su principal fuente de ingresos. Al pasar el tiempo, sus máquinas se volvieron obsoletas; por lo que le era cada vez más difícil competir con los grandes confeccionistas. Por este motivo, hace 2 años puso una peluquería y hace 8, un locutorio en el mismo local.

Además de estos negocios, Mirtha cuida, tres días a la semana, a una pareja de ancianos. No lo hace por dinero, sino por el cariño que sienten por ella.

El sueño de Mirtha es volver a poner un taller grande de confecciones, por lo que necesitaría dinero para comprar las máquinas necesarias.

loans.use: Start up a dressmaking workshop.

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
Juaquina is a brave mother who has struggled to gain respect and rights for her dear daughter. Juaquina’s child was born with a physical limitation that left her unable to communicate like the other members of the family. In spite of this, Juaquina’s daughter has been able to attend school and to receive an education thanks to the bravery and strong character of her mother. Juaquina has for many years confronted the authorities and demanded an inclusive rather than discriminatory education for her child. Juaquina is not only brave but also hard-working and dedicated to her grocery business. This activity has helped her to cover the expenses of her three children. However, all of this hard work could be in vain if her business were to decline. In order to avoid any such calamity, Juaquina is asking for a loan in order to consolidate her product and acquire larger quantities of articles for her small store. With your contribution she will be able to reach her goals. She awaits the help of someone like you.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juaquina, es una valiente madre que ha sabido luchado por el cumplimiento y respeto de los derechos de su querida hija que nació con una limitación física ya que no puede comunicarse como el resto de los miembros de su hogar, a pesar de este hecho dejo de asistir a una escuela y a recibir educación y todo ello gracias a la entereza y valentía de su madre, quien por largos se ha enfrentado a las autoridades y ha exigido una educación inclusiva y no discriminatoria.Ella no sólo es valiente sino trabajadora y dedicada al negocio de venta de abarrote, esta actividad la ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de sus tres hijos.Pero esto podría ser truncado por el decaimiento de su negocio con el fin de evitar este acontecimiento solicita un préstamo a fin de consolidar y adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos para su pequeña tiendita.Con su contribución podrá logralo solo espera por la ayuda de personas como usted.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of necessary products.

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace K.. She is currently in the business of operating a public pay phone and selling crafts and is requesting a loan to buy more air time cards. Grace is 40 years old and is a widow. She has 2 children aged 14 and 20, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 210000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her household's needs. Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy a phone and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Juliet S. and Justine M.. Juliet S. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Justine M. is currently operating a business selling shoes and wants a loan to start selling scrap.

loans.use: To re-invest in public phone business and expand it

loans.name: Sophia's Mwamboni Seleboss Group

texts.en:
Sophia is 34 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 14 years. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 92 years old. Sophia owns a small beauty salon and she is a hair dresser. She started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (hair conditioner and hair treatment weaving, for instance) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rose and Joyce, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items (hair conditioner, hair treatment, weaving) for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is 48 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs, a business she has been into for the past eight years.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Luis Jeremias

texts.pt:
Luis is 36 years old and he was born in the province of Maputo, in the district of Boane. Luis is single and father of 4 children with ages ranging between 4 and 15 years old. They are all in school. Besides his children he also supports his mother and father -- both live with him. Luis went to school until the 5th grade and he says he did not continue due to financial hardship his family encountered and the civil war in Mozambique. The war caused the family to flee to the neighboring country Swaziland. Today Luis lives in his own home located at the 14th kilometer in Boane. Luis is a construction worker and a retailer since 2003 and, gradually, he has been taking over the family's business. He learned how to be a construction worker in Swaziland, and he learned how to be a retailer with friends by selling cookies and sheets around town. He has been doing this for 5 years. The best selling products are sugar, sold for 23,00 MT per kilo, and peanuts for 35,00 MT per kilo. Running his business is difficult because he gets the products in the city of Maputo once a week by public transportation. He generates 300,00 Mt daily and 2.100,00 Mt weekly which amounts to approximately 9.000,00 monthly. Luis has not been able to save any money because he invests largely into the business. The challenge to increase business volume and maintain it moving along is to have enough merchandise and good customer service. This is Luis' second loan. The first one was in the amount of 15000,00 Mt and it was used to purchase basic need products which triggered business expansion. Luis has never requested loans from any other institution. He found out about Hluvuku through friends and made contact with it to request his first loan. This second loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise to beef up stock and, therefore, improve business performance. Luis' plans include fostering business growth and, in the future, he intends to request another loan to further expand this venture.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Luis tem 36 anos de idade e nasceu na província de Maputo no distrito de Boane. Luis é solteiro e pai de 4 filhos com idade variando entre 15 anos o mais velho e 4 anos o mais novo. Todos vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mãe e seu pai que vivem com eles na mesma casa. Luis estudou apenas até 5ªClasse e diz que não continuou por difícil situação financeira da família e devido a guerra civil de Moçambique, que fez a família abandonar a zona para o pais vizinho Swazilandia. Hoje Luis vive na casa própria no Km 14 em Boane. Luis é pedreiro e comerciante permanente desde 2003 e vem assumindo na integra a questão de negocio da família. Aprendeu na Swazilandia a ser pedreiro, e com os amigos a ser comerciante, vendendo biscoitos e mantas na zona. Fazem 5 anos que se dedica ao negocio. Os produtos com destaque é açúcar que vende o kg por 23,00mt e amendoim por 35,00mt o kg. A sua atividade é um pouco difícil por que os produtos adquire na cidade de Maputo e vai dos transporte públicos uma vez por semana. Tem rendimentos diários entre 300,00mt e 2.100,00mt semanais e aproximadamente 9.000,00mt mensal. Luis não consegue poupar algo por que a tendência é investir mais no negocio. O desafio para aumentar ou manter o seu negocio será ter sempre mercadoria e um bom atendimento aos clientes. Este é o segundo empréstimo para Luis onde o primeiro foi de 15000,00mt que usou para compra de produtos da primeira necessidade ampliando assim o seu negocio. Luis nunca levantou empréstimo noutras instituições. Conheceu a Hluvuku através dos amigos e assim contactou e solicitou o seu primeiro empréstimo. Este segundo empréstimo Luis usara para compra de mercadoria para aumentar o stock para melhorar assim o seu negocio. Luis tem como planos fazer crescer mais o seu negocio e futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para ampliar o seu negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand business.

loans.name: Milad

texts.en: Milad, 35 years old, is single and lives in Tripoli,  North Lebanon. where he owns a snack shop. His enthusiasm and will power help his business grow every day. Milad has requested a loan of US$1,000 to increase and diversify his inventory so that he may offer a larger menu to his clients. Indeed, during the summer season, Milad's snack-cafe cannot satisfy the demand of all his clients. This is the first time that Milad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase food products and diversify the snack inventory

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is twenty-eight-year-old Khadija I. from Dar es Salaam. She owns a beauty salon in the city centre that she established in 2007 and now runs with one employee.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

Khadija has been making monthly profits of approximately US$ 110 from her salon and is now requesting a loan of US$ 275. She intends to use this money to buy a hair dryer and other hair products for her salon. In the future, she aspires to increase the quantity and range of her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and other beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en: Mtumwa is married with five children aged between 3 months and 16 years old. She has been a coconuts and firewood  seller since June 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales. Mtumwa now requests a loan to buy more coconuts and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Mtumwa would like to buy more coconuts and firewood for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 39, is a rice farmer and makes less than one dollar each day. She plants a rice crop twice a year. In the dry season, it takes about 3-4 months for rice to grow enough for harvesting and in the rainy season, it takes 6-7 months until harvest time. The price of rice has doubled over the past year as have the fertilizers for the fields. When the weather is reliable, Sem can count on a good inventory. Her husband, Dong Ban, 41, works at collecting palm juice and refines it to sugar palm for sale. He is able to make US$3 each day. The couple has five children; two are construction workers; one is a student and the others are of pre-school age.

Sem S. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her children for commute to work and use the leftover money to buy firewood for her husband for refining palm juice.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and firewood.

loans.name: Estilista

texts.es:
Estelista es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Estelista es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Estelista tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, en un local alquilado en el centro de la ciudad, Estelista cuenta con la ayuda de un personal permanente y en algunas oportunidades dependiendo de la demanda contrata a mas personas. 
Estelista necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de deudas contraídas con la muerte de su padre.
Estelista sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener mas personales, mayores ingresos y brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Estelista is a member of the Communal Bank “Sonrisa.” She is married, 40 years old, and has 3 children. Estelista has a seamstress shop in a rented space in the city’s center where she makes clothing. Estelista says that with the help of a permanent employee and depending on some opportunities she will hire more people. Estelista needs a loan of 400 soles to pay debts related to the death of her father. She dreams of expanding her business, have more assistants, greater income, and provide the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay debts related to her father's death.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un año decidió emprender su propio negocio de manera estable, antes lo hacia de manera ambulante, para ello arrendó un puesto de mercado cercano a su casa, para poder vender todos los días diversos artículos de uso personal, como útiles de escritorio, detalles para regalos, entre otros. Yudith está motivada cada día por sus hijos, que son su razón de seguir. Es la  primera vez que Yudith solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Solicita esta cantidad para invertirla en la compra de juguetes y aprovechar la venidera campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Yudith is 36, and lives with her husband and her three children. A year ago she decided to open her own business of a stable nature, before it was in a traveling way, for this she rented a spot in a market close to her house, to be able to sell every day various personal uses, like office supplies and supplies for gifts among others. Yudith is motivated every day by her children, who are her reason to continue. This is the first time that Yudith is asking for a loan in MFP, so she promises to be punctual in her payments. She is asking for this amount to invest in purchasing toys and trying to sell for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Pelucia

texts.es:
La señora Pelucia se dedica en macate, es decir, ventas de prendas de vestir a créditos, esta actividad viene desarrollando hace 7 años. Ella es casada, su marido es el señor Crescencio Páez, que actualmente se dedica en la fabricación y ventas de chipitas, estamos hablando de una pareja muy creativa y con una actitud emprendedora genuina. 
La señora Pelucia tiene 36 años, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella se inicio en el comercio gracias al apoyo de su marido, pues, fue con el que aprendió a  negociar sus productos.

 Ya tiene más de 400 clientes y quiere seguir aumentando por lo que solicita el crédito, ella manifiesta que el crédito le da la posibilidad de aumentar su cartera de clientes porque con los ingresos que ella percibe a diario es solamente para mantener lo actual y dice que necesita mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarle mayor comodidad y educación a su hijo, porque ellos no tuvieron esa oportunidad, por venir  padres pobres.
texts.en:
In Macate Pelucia sells clothing from home to home on credit, an activity she has been doing for 7 years. She is married, her husband is Crescencio Páez, and today he makes and sells “chipitas,” a type of corn bread. We are talking about a very creative couple with a genuinely enterprising attitude. Pelucia is 36 years old, has a school-age son, and she began her business with the support of her husband and she learned to market her products with him. Now she has more than 400 customers and she wants to continue growing her business so she is seeking a loan, which will give her the possibility of increasing her customer base because with the daily income she receives she can only maintain her business and she says that it is necessary to improve her income in order to provide greater comforts and education to her son as they didn’t have this opportunity as they came from poor parents.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans for women and men

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita R. lives in Mansabay, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 9 kids. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired working to support their big family. In 2000, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of member in good standing; she always repays her loans in a timely manner.

Recently, Rita requested financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000 for additional working capital for fishing. She makes use of teared foam in their fish vending. She hopes to buy new ones. Through this project, she believes she can raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business. Rita has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum MPC and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him N., 61, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She sells vegetables in the market and makes about $10 profit per day. She has one child who works as mechanic in a local garage and receives $250 per month. To make more money, Mrs. Him would like to create another business by purchasing rice in bulk and reselling it when the price is high.

loans.use: To purchase and resell rice
