location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Paula Angelica,

texts.es:
Paula se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa y chompas de ambulante desde hace más de treinta años. Sin embargo, aún antes de empezar con este negocio siempre ha estado trabajando para si misma, hace algún tiempo vendiendo pollos.
Ya lleva tres años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y a sus cincuenta y seis años espera poder en un futuro estabilizar su negocio poniendo una tienda para vender su ropa.
Paula tiene ocho hijos, cinco de los cuales ya son mayores e independientes económicamente. Paula utiliza sus ganancias, junto a las de su pareja conviviente, para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de los demás.
texts.en:
Paula has had a business selling clothing and sweaters for more than 30 years. She used to sell as vendor, on foot. Before she started that business [selling clothing], she had worked for herself selling chickens. She has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for 3 years, and at 56 years old hopes to be able to establish her business more. She'd like to have a store she can sell her clothing in. Paula has eight children, five of whom are already of age and are financially independent. Paula uses her earnings, together with her partner’s, to cover the household expenses, and to help raise the rest of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invirtió en mercancía para su negocio de venta de ropa.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 63 years old and married, lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She has 3 children. Her husband is a pensioner. Nenita is interested in rice retailing, that’s why she has ventured into this kind of business. For her, it is very saleable because Filipinos eat rice thrice a day.

The working capital will not be a hindrance for her because she has been a member of Paglaum since May 2002. Recently she applied for PHP 25,000 to buy more sacks of rice for retailing. She hopes that her business will become successful in order to gain more profit and more blessings for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for sale

loans.name: Atoe

texts.en: Atoe S., 46, is married with five children.  She has two years of experience in the Ice cake business. She sells to the village people and the general public six days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.  SPBD loans are Atoe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase ice, coolio, sacks of sugar and foam cups

loans.name: Amalio

texts.es: Amalio tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una hija, acaban de mudarse a su casa nueva. Desde muy niño se dedica a los cultivos de la tierra, siembra papas y alverjas, sus cosechas siempre fueron muy buenas, para ello abona constantemente, lo que requiere de mucha inversión. A pesar de lo arduo de su labor termina contento al final del día porque es la única fuente de ingresos que conoce. Amalio recalca que para cosechar bueno productos para el mercado exigente, cuesta de mucho sacrificio y generalmente depende del tiempo, ya que siembra en chacras temporales, así que el se encuentra sujeto a los factores climatológicos. Por ello, su meta es de adquirir terrenos de regadío, donde no invierta mucho para cosechar. Amalio ha sido un cliente muy responsable durante estos 9 préstamos consecutivos que viene trabajando con MFP, y las veces que dispone de tiempo apoya en las labores de la junta directiva para el desarrollo y el progreso de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, ya sin ello las cosechas no están aseguradas, le alcanzará para diez sacos de abono y para la compra de semillas de alverjas.
texts.en:
Amalio is a 27-year-old man who lives with his partner, with whom he has one daughter. They have just finished moving into their new home. Ever since he was a child, he has been involved in agriculture. He grows peas and potatoes for a living. His crops have always done well because he is constantly fertilizing them, which requires a lot of investment. Despite how arduous his work is, he is happy at the end of the day because it is the only thing he knows how to do and his sole source of income. Amalio stresses that in order to harvest good crops for the demanding market, it takes a lot of sacrifice and it generally depends on the weather. He grows crops on seasonal farms, so he is subject to climate factors. For this reason, his goal is to obtain irrigated lands in which he does not have to invest too much to grow his crops. Amalio has been a very responsible client during the 9 consecutive months that he has been working with MFP. Furthermore, whenever he has time, he helps out the executive board for the progress and development of his microfinance institute. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers because without them, he has no way of ensuring a good harvest. He will have enough money to purchase pea seeds and 10 sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Tavakkal

texts.ru: Муминов Таваккал Рачаббоевич 1974 год рождения ,женат имеет 3 детей .Жена Нематова Хусния .Место жительства г. Истаравшан к. Суфи-Ориф .Клиент берёт заем для сельского хозяйства ,он занимается  этим уже около 10 лет .Кроме этого он ,ему помогает жена .Клиент берёт заем 1200 сом. на 10мес. Дополнительный   семейный доход клиент занимается частными строительными работами.
texts.en:
Tavakkal M. was born in 1974 and is married with 3 children. He and his wife, Husniya Nematova, reside in Sufi-Orif, Istaravshan. For the past 10 years Tavakkal has been working in agriculture. His wife helps him around. He earns extra cash by doing construction work. He is planning to use his loan for planting onions.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant onions

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Apolonia M. Narváez tiene 66 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, pero dio inicio a este negocio por iniciativa propia para sacar adelante a sus hijos, anteriormente Apolonia tenía problemas económicos muy duros, y sufría al ver que no tenia que ofrecerles a sus hijos, es por esta razón que decide establecer esta pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, recargas telefónicas entre otros. Es sueño de Apolonia es predominar en el mercado con su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Apolonia M. Narváez, 66, is a single mother. She supports her five children who are all in school. Her business is a mini market. She has had this business for over twenty years. She started this business on her own initiative in order to help her children. Apolonia previously had very severe economic problems. She suffered to see that she did not have anything to offer her children. For that reason, she decided to set up a small mini market in her house. The loan is to buy sweets, soft drinks, and cards to reload minutes for cell phones, among other things. Apolonia’s dream is to dominate the market with her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan acaba de cumplir 35 años, desde hace 15 años vive con amada pareja que le dio 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo; actualmente viven en su casa propia.  De pequeño apoyaba a sus padres en los trabajos agrícolas, desde entonces ha ido aprendiendo las técnicas de la agricultura y cuando formó su propia familia comenzó a cultivar cítricos y café, los cuales trabaja con el valioso apoyo de su esposa. Adicionalmente, hace como 6 meses se viene dedicando al servicio de taxi, desde las 6.00am hasta las 6.00pm, por ello le pagan 20 soles diarios y los fines de semana trabaja hasta las 11 de la noche en aras de acumular mayores ganancias para la mantención de su familia. Pero durante los meses de cosecha de café deja de lado su trabajo como conductor y se dedica netamente a la recolección para evitar perder los frutos de café tan valiosos para su familia. Juan se siente muy a gusto con sus siembras y mientras trabaja con el carro piensa en sus cultivos, ya que alguna vez ha sido víctima de robos debido a su ausencia. Por ello que su esposa trata de acudir a sus chacras constantemente para cuidar ser frutos, puesto que cuando los comercializa obtiene buenas ganancias, de ahí que sus anhelos son de incrementar sus cultivos de café. Este es su 5to préstamo consecutivo que viene trabajando con MFP, cumpliendo todos los pagos en las fechas programadas. Juan tiene un sobre nombre muy gracioso, es cual siempre es motivo de risa para sus compañeros de banco comunal, le dicen “la gorda bella”. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en tramitar su licencia de conducir en la municipalidad de su localidad, con el resto del dinero comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus siembras de café.
texts.en:
Juan just turned 35. He has lived with the beloved mother of his two children for 15 years. They are the motivation for his efforts. They currently live in their own house. Since he was little he helped his parents in the agricultural work. From then on he was learning farming techniques. When he formed his own family he started planting citrus and coffee. He does this with his wife’s valuable help. Also, six months ago he started driving a taxi from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. They pay him 20 PEN a day. On the week ends he works until 11 at night plowing in order to get greater income to support his family. During the coffee harvesting months he leaves aside his work as a driver and works on gathering his harvest to avoid loosing the coffee beans, which are so valuable for his family. Juan feels very pleased with his farming, and while he is driving in his car he thinks about his crops. One time he was robbed because he was not there. Because of that his wife tries to go to the fields constantly to take care that they bear fruit. When the crop is sold, he gets very good earnings. His goal is to increase his coffee crop. This is his fifth consecutive loan working with MFP. He makes all of his payments on time. Juan has an amusing nickname, which is always the cause for laughter with his colleagues in his community bank. They call him the “the big beauty”. The money he is asking for is to process his driver’s license in the local town hall. With the rest of the money he will buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay to process his driver's license and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Zinatoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Зинатой - 32 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Зинатой работает в Городской электросети в качестве контролера. Она зарабатывает средне. Ее муж таксист. Зарплату Зинатой они тратят на жизнь, а на зарплату мужа планируют провести ремонт санузлов. Поэтому они просят кредит, чтобы сделать ремонт санузлов, а потом погашать кредит с зарплаты мужа. До наступления холодов Зинатой и муж планируют закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zinatoy is 32 years old. She is married and is a mother of two children. Zinatoy works in the city electrical station as a controller. She earns average. He husband is a taxi driver. They spend Zinatoy's salary on everyday life and plan to use husband's salary to repair the bathroom. They are asking for a loan for this purpose and then will make payments on it from her husband's salary. Before the coming of winter Zinatoy and her husband plan to finish the repair.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the bathroom

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan K., 43, has rented a place outside the market where she sells a variety of fruits for daily income. Her husband, Hem Pouy, 61, assists her, as does a school-aged son when he is not going to school. Although the enterprise is profitable, to generate a larger daily income Kan needs to improve her business but lacks the capital to do so. She would therefore like a loan to order different kinds of fruit to sell.

Note: The picture shows Kan K.'s husband at the selling place.

loans.use: To order different kinds of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa M. is from the village of Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old, and is married with five adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Josefa joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad de collantes municipio de Santiago Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca contamos con un grupo solidario que está integrado por cinco personas mujeres cuatro de ellas son casadas y una es madre soltera todas las integrantes se dedican al comercio que es la actividad economica que predomina en esta zona, cada una de ellas se dedica a vender diferentes productos de manera ambulante en la misma comunidad o en localidades aledañas a collantes,la sra. Maria Teresa M. vende carne fresca de puerco, Maribel D. M. vende ropa y perfumes, Emiliana Velasco D. vende dulces en el interior de una escuela primaria y como su esposo se dedica al cultivo de papaya cuando recojen la cosecha apoya a vender papaya que es cada seis meses aproximadamente,Cira Lidia D. S. compra y vende pescado fresco, Ana Maria D. S. vende pollo fresco destazado.
el tiempo promedio que estas personas tienen realizando esta actividad es de hace 15 años, comentan que decidieron trabajar para apoyar economicamente a sus esposos ya que con el salario que ellos perciben del trabajo del campo en ocasiones no cubre los gastos necesarios de sus familias y mas cuando tienen una persona mas a su cargo como son un nieto u otro familiar que mantener como es el caso de la cliente Cira Lidia D. S. que tiene a su cargo una nieta.
La cliente Maribel Domiguez M. quien es la representante del grupo dice que se entero de los microcreditos que otorga Fundacion Realidad con pocos requisitos, reunio a los demas integrantes y los requisitos y solicitó el credito para que se apoyen en la compra de los productos que ellas comercializán como son compra de carne fresca de puerco, ropa y perfumes, dulces, pescado fresco, carne de pollo fresco destazado asi como los gastos que generan cuando tienen que realizar sus compras y viajan a la ciudad de Pinotepa Nacional ó a el Puerto de acapulco Guerrero.
Las clientes dicen sentirse satisfechos con el apoyo del credito que brinda Fundacion Realidad ya que cuando iniciaron su negocio hace tiempo no tenian acceso al credito porque no cubrian los requisitos que pedían los bancos,  esperan que la institución no pare de brindar este tipo de servicio ya que tienen la esperanza de que ciclo a ciclo su inversion sea cada vez mayor y el bienestar  de sus familias sobretodo de los niños sea cada vez mejor y si es posible algun día contar cada una con un lugar ya establecido para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
This unified group of five people is located in the Collantes community in Santiago Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca. Four of the women are married, and one is a single mother. All of the members work in commerce, the predominant economic activity in this region. Each one of them sells different products as street vendors in the same community or in the outskirts of Collantes. Maria Teresa Martiniez sells fresh pork. Maribel Domínguez M. sells clothes and perfume. Emiliana Velasco D. sells sweets inside of an elementary school. Her husband grows papaya. When they collect the harvest she helps to sell papaya, which is approximately every six months. Cira Lidia D. S. buys and sells fresh fish. Ana Maria Domínguez S. sells fresh, butchered chicken. On the average, they have spent 15 years doing these activities. They decided to work to economically help their husbands. Their salaries for sometimes working in the fields do not cover the family’s necessary expenses. This is especially true when they have another person to take care of like a grandchild or other relative to support such as in the case of Cira Lidia D. S., who is raising her granddaughter. Maribel D. M., the group’s representative, found out about the micro loans with few requirements that Fundacion Realidad gives. She got together with the other members. They met the requirements and asked for a loan to help them buy the products that they sell like fresh pork, clothes and perfume, sweets, fresh fish, and fresh butchered chicken. The loan will also help with the expenses generated when they have to makes their purchases and travel to the city of Pinotepa Nacional or El Puerto de Acapulco, Guerrero. These clients say that they feel satisfied with the support from the loan given by the Fundacion Realidad. When they started their businesses a while ago, they did not have access to a loan because they did not meet the requirements of the banks. They hope that the institution does not stop offering this type of service. They hope that, cycle to cycle, its investment will be larger each time. Then the well being of their families, above all, the well being of the children, will be better each time. If possible, some day each one will have an established place to sell their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell products

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia P. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia runs a general store. She sells a variety of different products in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Tienen 2 hijos, uno de ellos ya está estudiando y el otro es todavía un bebe. Juntamente con su esposo, es propietaria de una chacra de 200 hectáreas, donde viene sembrando 3 hectáreas de yuca y 8 de maíz. Esta actividad la vienen ejerciendo desde hace 3 años y María tiene muchos objetivos debido al tamaño de su terreno, por lo que no duda en implementar dos galpones para dedicarse a la crianza de pollos en un futuro cercano, ya que también es un negocio muy rentable. A María le gusta mantener limpia y ordenada su chacra y estar pendiente de su maíz cuando las aves se acercan a destruirlos. Lo bueno de su negocio es que ya cuenta con un comprador seguro a quien le vende toda su cosecha.
Esta es la primera vez que adquiere un préstamo con MFP y desde ya le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque ha notado que sus compañeros son trabajadores y buscan la unidad del grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará granos de maíz, fríjol y otras variedades para sembrar y ampliar sus terrenos cultivados.

loans.use: Compra de semilla

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana S. A., tiene la edad de 23 años, es soltera, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar fertilizante para darle mantenimiento a la siembra de maíz y frijoles que tiene en la finca. Además, su finca es de 18 hectáreas, y tiene gallinas, cerdos y pasto para vacas. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva.También, nos cuenta que ella ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales como lo es El Banco Nacional de Costa Rica, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria a su hijo para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada  y pueda enfrentar de manera más fécil la vida.
texts.en:
Diana S. A. is 23 years old. She is single and has a son, who is her highest priority. She would like to buy fertilizer in order to maintain the corn and bean crops on her farm. Her farm is 18 hectares in size, and she also raises chickens, pigs and grass for cattle. She has worked on her farm for several years now, and she would like to expand it. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any problems with her property, but she wants to make her farm more productive. She also tells us that she has taken out other loans with state banks, such as the National Bank of Costa Rica, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. Diana also wants to provide her son with the education he will need to prepare for his future and face life more successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer for corn and bean crops

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells diesel at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. She is married with seven children. She is 42 years old. She has been in this business for two years. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more diesel to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell

loans.name: Ciria Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Ciria Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años, es conviviente,  tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió solo hasta tercero de secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 1 años, se dedica a  la compra y venta de ganado  vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 con el que compró  ovinos, tambien se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores los cuales  vende en momentos de necesidad.

Ella solicitará el monto de S/. 1,100.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello comprará 01 toro para engordarlo en 03 meses para luego venderlo en la feria de ganado.


Su anhelo es tener su tienda de abarrotes  en la plaza de armas del Centro Poblado de López.
texts.en:
Sra. Ciria Maruja is a member of the community bank “Jesús de Nazaret”, in the district of Ilave, province of El Callao, department of Puno. She is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She studied until the third year of high school.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela R. (Manuela R. Movement) for one year, and she buys and sells cattle. Her first loan was for 500 soles, with which she bought sheep. She also raises and sells small animals which she sells in moments of necessity.

She is requesting a total of 1,100 soles, with which she will buy one bull to fatten in three months and then sell it in the livestock fair. Her wish is to have her grocery store in the Plaza de Armas in the center Poblado de López.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one bull

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking wife and mother who dreams to improve the living conditions of her family. She is married to Rogelio, who drives a sugarcane truck during the sugar milling season and farms rice the rest of the time. They have three children who are between 23 to 27 years old and they live in Brgy. Bi-ao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.

Nilda already had a general store before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997, but she was able to expand her operations by selling her products in the nearby school, earning more income from a bigger customer base. She even expanded to selling food, and this has become a stable source of income, earning about 19,800 PHP per month. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was well utilized as working capital for her general store and now she is borrowing the same amount to continue sustaining the business momentum of her general store and food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" --  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Rocio

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Ahorro está formado por un grupo de mujeres alegres, carismáticas y  triunfadoras que  buscan la manera de salir adelante siempre con una sonrisa y siendo visionarias de un mejor futuro para ellas y su familia saliendo avante    ante las dificultades que la vida les presenta en su día a día, todas  viven en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad que se caracteriza  por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, proclamada también como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su belleza natural, incomparable  arquitectura de  su centro histórico.

Ana Aucapiña es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro  hace dos  años, vive en el sector Cristo del Consuelo  en la urbe cuencana, tiene 21 años de edad es soltera  y vive con sus padres, actualmente  estudia en una academia de belleza que está casi por culminar sus estudios, la casa de sus padres es propia y colabora económicamente en lo que puede en con ellos.

Ana se dedica a la elaboración de Artesanías como las cabuyas (sogas) que son elaboradas de  totoras (plantas), este arte le enseñó su mamá  y lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad que se ha convertido en un negocio familiar  puesto que cada miembro de la familia elabora diferentes artesanías,  sus actividades inician a  las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y por la tarde asiste a clases en su academia.

 Los préstamos recibidos ha invertido para incrementar su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar cabuya para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Su mayor sueño es montar su propio gabinete.
texts.en:
“The Savings” communal bank is composed of a group of happy, charismatic, even triumphant women who always seek a way to get ahead with a smile. They have visions of a better future for them and their families, despite the difficulties that life presents from day to day. They all live in the city of Cuenca, the 3rd most important city in Ecuador. It has been declared a part of the “cultural patrimony of humanity” for its natural beauty and the incomparable architecture of the historic center.

Ana Aucapiña has been a member of the bank for 2 years, and lives in the Cristo del Consuelo sector of Cuenca. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. At present, she studies in the beauty academy and is nearly finished with her studies. The parents own their home and she collaborates with them economically as much as she can.

Ana makes artisan crafts, especially cords elaborated from the “totora” plant. Her mother taught her the art and she has been doing this for 8 years. Artisanry has become a family business, since each member has learned a different artisan art. Her activities begin at 6:00 in the morning and continue until 12:00 noon, then afternoons she attends classes at the academy.

Her previous loans have been invested to expand her business and with this new loan, she will buy “totora” fiber to be used in her artisan craft. Her big dream is to build her own dressing-room.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FIBER TO MAKE CORDS TO SELL

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en: Ofeliya A. is 52 years old, the self-sacrificing mother of two sons. Her work as an agricultural laborer together with the low income of her husband and her very low pension as a former teacher is not enough to meet her goals. Ofeliya is requesting 1600 AZN to invest in purchasing cattle that will allow her to increase her earnings. This way she will be able to finish remodeling her home in order to give her son and his new wife a place to live. Ofeliya plans to collaborate in the busisness with her daughter-in-law and her mother.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Naweeda Group

texts.en: This is the 'Naweeda' group; M. Akram is the leader of the 'Naweeda' group. He is married and the father of five children. After hard work, Akram made up a group of two members who have requested a group loan of 26000 Afghani to expand their businesses and make a good monthly income for their families. Akram wants to take a loan for his fresh fruit cart. With this loan he will be able to buy fresh fruit for his cart. The second member of 'Naweeda' group is Habiba who wants take out a loan for her tailoring business. With this loan she will be able to buy some necessary things for her tailoring business. They would like to thank all lenders from around the world.

loans.use: to add to their business inventory

loans.name: Marling Leonor

texts.es:
Marling L. es una dama muy trabajadora que ha sbido llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar a los que debe de brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ella invertirá el dinero en el pago de la matricula del colegio y en la compra de utensilios escolares como lo son cuadernos, mochilas, lápices, entre otros. 
Al recibir el crédito, se contribuye con el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de sus pequeños y así algún día llegaran a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Marling L. is a hardworking woman who has been able to provide for her family, which includes her two small, school-age children, for whom she must provide adequate conditions for their development. She is requesting a loan to invest in her children's education. She will use the loan proceeds to pay for school tuition and to buy school supplies such as notebooks, backpacks, pencils, among others. Receiving this loan means she will give a better life to her little ones and one day, they will become great professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies and paying tuition for her children

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Panamericana se encuentra al inicio de la carretera que lleva a orillas del Lago Titicaca.  La asociación comunal Señor de Lagunas es parte de este centro focal, y le debe su nombre al Santo encargado de las lagunas. Esta asociación, formado por 9 mujeres, tiene los mejores deseos de llevar adelante su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer. 

Los negocios de las socias son: tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, albañilería, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de papas fritas, venta de mantas, ropa y zapatos, abarrotes.

La presidenta de 29 años de edad, señora Rosmery Huriste, casada  desde hace varios años.  Ella tiene el negocio del comercio de Mantas en la Feria 16 de Julio, los días jueves y domingo, entre las ocho de mañana y 4 de la tarde.  Ya lleva en el negocio 5 años.
texts.en:
The Panamericana regional center is located at the beginning of the highway which leads to the shores of Lake Titicaca. The communal bank "Señor de Lagunas" is part of this regional center, and it owes its name to the saint who is believed to watch over the lakes. This association is made up of 9 women with a strong desire to undertake their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer. The members' businesses are: weaving blankets; selling shoes; masonry; weaving vicuña wool ponchos; selling fried potatoes; selling ponchos, clothing and shoes; and selling groceries. The group's president, Rosmery Huriste, is 29 years old and has been married for several years. Her business is selling ponchos at the "16 de Julio" market, on Thursdays and Sundays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. She has operated this business for 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ponchos to sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is married with four children and she is 35 years old. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Christiana is a lovely and happy woman and is hardworking. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her family.

To make a living in Ughelli, Christiana sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She sells her cooking oil in market. Cooking oil is used by Nigerians to prepare mouth-watering cooked foods.

The demand for her cooking oil is high and Christiana hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Las Ovejitas Group

texts.en:
Indhira is the coordinator of her group, Las Ovejitas (The little lambs), and her story is typical of her group members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. The group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Indhira is twenty years old and makes her home here in a simple structure with her mother and father.

Indhira is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza and at the opportunity to grow her business with capital at low interest. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing a hair dryer. She will use the profits to invest in herself by continuing her university studies and saving towards some day owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isatu J. is 52 years old, married with five children.  Her first child is married, the second is in college, and the last three are in primary school.

Isatu is a member of Kiva field partner LAPO SL, and has taken two previous loans,that helped her to expand the inventory of her shop.  Isatu lives in Laka with her entire family, and has a shop very close to her house where she sells provisions.

She is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to enable her buy more goods for her shop and also to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for sale.

loans.name: Dianké

texts.fr: Dianké Y. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE depuis 4 ans et demi et a 9 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de vente d'huile de palme et de balais faits à base de feuilles de palmier. Cette activité lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices jusqu'à s'équiper en meuble et achetant un lit en bois. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille en assurant pleinement le marché quotidien.
texts.en:
Dianké Y. is 52 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the TEREMBASSE « Banc Villageois » loan group for 4 ½ years and has been granted nine successive loans, all reimbursed without problems. Her new loan will enable her to develop her business selling palm oil and brooms made of palm fronds. This activity has so far provided income she used to buy home furnishings and a wooden bed. She contributes towards family expenses by funding daily purchases at the market.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 61 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 29 mars 2008. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, son crédit lui permettra d'acheter 5 moutons qu'elle va engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois et revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Amy S. is 61 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group since 29 March 2008. She fattens sheep, and her loan will enable her to buy five sheep she will fatten for at least five months to be resold at the weekly market fairs in her area. This activity will bring in profits that will allow her to help her husband manage the household.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy five sheep for fattening

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn U. (pictured here), age 42, is widow with two sons and one daughter. One of her children is married, another one is a garment factory worker and the youngest one attends school. The family lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarorn has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for a year. She is asking for her first loan, in the amount of $1,200, to use for raising pigs and to purchase a motorbike and trailer to transport rice wine to sell.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs and to purchase a motorbike and trailer to transport rice wine to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: AM/FM radios, boxes of electric knives, electric irons, hammers, extension cords, belts, and security locks

loans.name: Alice Waruguru

texts.en:
Alice Waruguru W. is 52 years old and her spouse is Charles. She supports eight members of her family. Alice and her spouse have been farming their own piece of land together for the last ten years.

This will be her third loan. She is planning to spend ten thousand to buy wheat seeds and twenty-five thousand to purchase fertilizer and chemicals to spray the wheat. She has been paying back her loan successfully without default.

With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, Alice is planning to increase her farm production by ploughing more acres and also to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and also see her children go to a better school with good learning facilities

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: Iveth Del Rosario

texts.es:
Iveth  de  27 años de edad trabaja para la Universidad URACCAN desde hace 3 años como auxiliar de Biblioteca, tiene un bebe de 2 añitos de edad el cual esta bajo el cuido de la abuelita materna cuando Iveth trabaja, su esposo trabaja como analista de crèdito y se encarga de los gastos del hogar.  

Iveth està solicitando su 2do crèdito para invertirlo en acondicionar mejor una habitaciòn, hecharle el piso y repellarlo, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo crezca sano y saludable, mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando para ser una profesional con mucha experiencia, pues actualmenteestà estudiando un curso de Ingles en la misma universidad donde ella labora.
texts.en:
Iveth, 27, has worked for the Uraccan University for 3 years as an assistant librarian. She has a 2 year-old baby who is cared for by the maternal grandmother when Iveth works. Her husband works as a credit analyst and takes care of the household expenses. Iveth is requesting her 2nd loan to invest in improvements to her home, to put in some flooring and plaster it. Her main dream in life is for her son to grow up safe and healthy, and to improve her living conditions and continue studying to become an experienced professional. She is currently taking a course in English from the same university where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put in new flooring and plaster in her home

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh D. est un jeune agriculteur-éleveur de 25 ans qui habite dans la localité de Wayembam  à  Bambilor. Il est marié mais n’a pas d’enfant. Après ses études primaires il s’est orienté vers l’agriculture avant de se spécialiser à l’élevage de poussins. Il a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis janvier 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 450000frs destiné  à l’élevage de 300 poussins. L’accroissement  de ses bénéfices  a travers ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale et plus précisément d’acquérir des mobiliers.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh D. is a 25-year-old poultry farmer living in the Wayembam district of Bambilor. He is married but has no children. After primary schooling he turned to vegetable farming before he specialised in raising chickens. He has over ten years’ experience in his business. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch (of UIMCEC) since January 2010. He is requesting a loan for 450,000 francs he will devote to raising 300 chicks. This loan will enable him to increase his earnings, improve his social situation and more specifically buy some furniture.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: strengthen working capital

loans.name: Jimmy Santiago

texts.es: El señor Jimmy Santiago tiene  39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres son menores de edad. El se dedica al negocio a brindar el servicio de acarreo de materiales de construcción. El señor ya tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, este negocio empezó primeramente en su familia ya que su papa era poseedor de un camión y el empezó a acarrear materiales. Fue con el tiempo que el señor logro hacerse de su camión propio para hacer sus propios negocios. El señor desea este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de materiales para realizarle un mantenimiento completo del camión, con el propósito de brindar un mejor servicio. Este es el tercer crédito que trabaja con Fundación León 2000. El señor espera mejorar sus ingresos al hacer una sola reparación al camión ya que no se atrasara en el futuro realizando pequeñas mejoras al mismo. Su sueño es llegar a comprar otra unidad para ponerlo a trabajar y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Jimmy Santigo, 39, is married and has 4 children, three of whom are minors. He is a construction materials hauler. He’s been in this business for 12 years. The business started out in his family because his father owned a truck and he started hauling materials. In time, he acquired his own truck for his own business. He wants this loan in order to buy the materials he needs to give his truck major service maintenance so that it will provide better service. This is his 3rd loan with con Fundación León 2000. He hopes that by doing a major service on the truck he won’t lose work time having to do several minor repairs and thus his income will improve. His dream is to manage to buy another truck and put it to work too to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For major service for his truck.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B. is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: operating a general store, raising pigs and growing corn. She lives in Prk. 7, Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 PHP. 

Aida is borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she can buy new merchandise to sell at her general store and to fund the operations of her other businesses.   This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise to sell and fund business operations

loans.name: Luz De La Esperanza 1 Y 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una de los miembros del Grupo Luz de la esperanza 1 & 2 , ellos son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, etc; en la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo. Está asociada de Esperanza se dedica a la educacion, tiene una pequeña escuela en su comunidad, esta recibiendo su segundo prestamos para invertirlo en libros, y sillas, ya que necesita invertir en utiles y hacer algunos cambios y arreglos. 

Manuela va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invertir en su negocio, ya que es mucho lo que le falta lograr para tener una buena estructura pero nos dice que gracias a los prestamos va a poder creciendo. Su reto mas dificil educar y criar a sus hijos a la ves que estudiaba y trabajaba. Su sueño es poder ofrecer la mejor educacion de su comunidad, y que a la vez pueda constribuir con los demas.
texts.en:
Manuela is one of the members of Grupo Luz de la Esperanza 1 & 2.  They are micro-businesses dedicated to selling clothing, natural products, shoes, education, etc. in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for soccer players and for the sugar refinery business.  The city’s economy is currently dependent on the “Free Zone”, the cement industry, and to some degree other industries such as tourism.  Manuela dedicates herself to education and has a small school in her community.  She is receiving her second loan, which she will use to invest in books and seats.  She also needs to invest in school supplies and make some changes and repairs.


Manuela will use her profits to continue investing in her business, since there is a lot she needs to achieve in order to improve the school.  However, she tells us that thanks to the loans that her business is going to keep growing.  Her most difficult challenge is to educate and raise her children since they have to study and work at the same time.  Her dream is to be able to offer the best education for her community and at the same time to be able to contribute to the community.

loans.use: To buy books, seats, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more good quality cosmetics.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida comes from Chichawatni which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a 4-room house in a combined family system. She moved here after her marriage a few years ago. 

She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household chores. She is a very caring mother who is raising her children very well. She has proved herself as a responsible wife who is always ready to support her husband in every difficult time. She is a mother of three children, a daughter and two sons. Her sons are enrolled in school while her daughter is still very young and has not started to go to school. 

Her husband’s name is M. N. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family and he runs a motorbike showroom. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery business. Her husband will invest the loan in purchasing grocery items according to his customers' needs and increase his sales. Shahida is hopeful that through this loan investment her husband’s business will grow and her family’s living standard improve. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Dorila De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Dorila de 53 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 14 años. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Inicio su negocio comprando pocos productos para poder mantener a su hijo ya que está separada. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo invertir dinero en arroz, enlatados, bebidas para tener más variedad en sus ventas. En la actualidad trabaja sola desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm. Vende arroz, azúcar, verduras, vegetales granos etc. 

Aunque no tiene a su cónyuge ella quiere seguir trabajando para darle una mejor vida a su hijo, comprando con el préstamo enlatados, arroz, bebidas, dulces para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un minimarket para así que su hijo tengan una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Dorila is 53 years old. She is a single mother with a 14-year-old child, living in a peripheral suburb on the outskirts of Guayaquil called Duran, characterized by its disappearing ecosystem.

She started her business by buying a few products so she could raise her child, as she is separated. Little by little with hard work and dedication she was able to invest in rice, canned goods and drinks to offer more variety in her sales. She currently works alone from 7 am until 10 pm. She sells rice, sugar, vegetables, grain cereals, etc.

Although she is separated from her spouse she wants to continue working to provide a better life for her son. With the loan she will buy canned goods, rice, drinks, sweets for her store. In the future she wants to operate a minimarket so that her child can benefit from a better economic situation.

loans.use: Canned goods, rice, drinks, sweets

loans.name: Bethuel Murimi

texts.en:
Bethuel has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 47 years old and married to Elizabeth Wangui. They have three school-going children.

Bethuel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 70,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount for land preparation and to buy seedlings, fertilizers and a calf. In the future, Bethuel hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: land preparation and to buy seedlings, fertilizers and a calf

loans.name: Asylgul's Group

texts.en:
Asylgul K. is a young woman of 26, she is the mother of three children; the two elder children are school pupils, and the youngest one is a toddler. 
In 2003, the family started to increase family budget after purchasing a calf and 5 goats, since that, this business is successfully being operated by Asylgul’s husband and their son. During 7 years of working hard, Asylgul has managed to make house repairs and increase the number of livestock up to 22 animals.

Obvious achievements don’t stop new plans concerning business development. Today the family needs to obtain hay for feeding animals and a sheep for breeding. For this purpose they need to get a loan. In future they wish to be able to obtain a car.

	 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and hay.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Thun S., 55, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations.

S. sells Cambodian noodles, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $82 on food and $5 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase more fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 33 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في كاراج لتصليح السيارات له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويريد تطوير نفسه وتطوير
عمله كان للقرض السابق الاثر الجيد وقد لقى دعم من عائلته واثر في تطوير عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء
سيارة جديدة للتجارة يحب ان يدعم عائلته وان يزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Ahmad, 33, is married and a father of two. He has been working at an auto repair shop for 15 years.  Ahmad seeks to develop his business. His family supported him during his previous loan cycle with which he developed his work.  He wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a new car to further improve his business. Ahmad seeks to increase his income and help his family.

loans.use: Buy a new car for his business

loans.name: Dioselina María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Dioselina, ella tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de   siete hijos los mismos que son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de 7 años que estudia en escuela y que es como su hijo. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por seis años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de parte de sus compañeras como de la institución.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada la misma que es de dos a tres meses de acuerdo a la raza que ella lleve, nos cuenta que hasta su casa llegan los comerciantes a quienes les entrega a precios razonables y con los cuales le quede ganancias. Lleva algunos años que se dedica a esta actividad, los pollos los compra pequeños en una incubadora en Tosagua.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para estos. Sus sueños son tener una gran comercializadora y productora de pollos.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic where most of its residents raise animals and are farmers because it’s an area with much vegetation.

We met Dioselina, 52, here.  She’s a single mother of 7 children who are all adult and independent.  She lives with a 7 year old grandson who is in school and is like her son.  She’s been in the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the help she gets from her fellow members and from the institution.

She raises chickens.  She has a small farm where she can place up to 200 chicken per season which can last two to three months according to the breed she brings.  She tells us that merchants come all the way to her house and she sells to them at reasonable prices so as to have some profits. She’s been in this work for several years.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Tosagua.

This loan is to buy chicks, feed and medicines for them.  Her dreams are to have a large chicken producing and merchandising firm.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: K. is currently in the business of selling goods. She is 27 years old, married to a farmer, and has five children. Four of them go to school. K. took out a loan to stock more goods to sell. With extra profits from her business, K. hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina M. is from the town of Naguillan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Carolina is married and has six school-aged children. Carolina owns and operates a piggery. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Carolina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carolina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela L. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Stela is married. To make a living, Stela owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like "nata de coco", popcorn & ice cream pops in the local community. She is also selling used clothing or "ukay-ukay" by going house-to-house. Stela has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Stela is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like popcorn. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Stela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products like  popcorn for sale.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora que junto a su esposo Erick; con quien convive desde hace 7 años. Cuidan de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de San Antonio. Desde que tenía 15 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, aprendiendo de sus padres todas las técnicas de cultivo. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja y habas, productos que cuida y fertiliza constantemente en sus propios terrenos agrícolas que le fue heredado de sus padres, a quienes quiere mucho. Menciona que le va muy bien en la comercialización de estos alimentos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, pues tiene habilidad en la negociación de sus productos. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de madera, comprando grandes lotes de árboles, para después procesarlos. Su principal inconveniente son los gastos económicos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos. Teniendo que alquilar una casa en la ciudad de Tarma para que pueda estudiar y recibir una mejor educación. Por eso sus planes son ahorrar lo necesario para comprar su casa propia, y así poder minimizar los gastos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo constante que recibe de parte de sus integrantes. Soledad, invertirá el crédito en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, como también varios sacos de abono orgánico; que esparcirá después de la siembra.
texts.en:
Soledad is 34 years old. She and her husband Erick have been together for seven years. They have four children and live in their own home in the village of San Antonio. Soledad began farming 15 years ago, utilizing the cultivation techniques that she learned from her parents. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas, and beans. She cares for and constantly fertilizes the crops grown on the land that she inherited from her parents who she loves dearly. Soledad says that she has done a good job selling her products at the wholesale market in the city, where she is able to utilize her negotiation skills. In addition, she sells wood. Soledad buys tree trunks by the lot for subsequent processing. Her main challenge is being able to pay for her children’s education. She rents a house in the city of Tarma so that her children can study and receive the best education. For this reason, she plans to save enough money to buy a house so that she can minimize her expenses.

Soledad is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful for the constant support that she receives from the other members. Soledad will invest her loan in the purchase of a bag of seeds for planting peas and several sacks of organic fertilizer that she will apply on her crops after they have been sown.

loans.use: purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and seeds for planting peas.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and is a married woman with two young children. Her older child is 12 years old.

Jane is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him till their land to grow rice crops. She also helps sell their harvest at the market. Jane also grows pigs at their backyard. Jane plans to use her loan to buy pig feed, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor.

In the future, Jane hopes for her family to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor.

loans.name: Hanilyn

texts.en:
Hanilyn is from the village of Karugmanan, Suarez, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Hanilyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish and sardines, in the local community. Hanilyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hanilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like mackerel and sardines. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like mackerel and sardines.

location.town: Suarez, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Nancy es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la costura, elaboración de porta joyas, sábanas, crochet, en fin realiza varios elementos con la confección.
Es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene 4 hijos y su marido es Guardia de Seguridad, por lo que mutuamente se ayudan con los gastos del hogar.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Nancy solicita el crédito para la compra de mas materiales que necesita para su costura, en especial de telas e hilos.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso came together.  The members form a much unified group capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their companionship.

Nancy is one of the group members.  She is a Seamstress and makes jewel cases, sheets, crochets; in reality, all sorts of sewn items.  She is a very creative woman and her customers are quite impressed with her work.

She has four children and her husband is a Security Guard so they help each other meet household expenses.

She is very satisfied with her work and with the training the group gets.  Nancy is asking for the loan to buy more materials she needs for her sewing, especially fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Pablo Boanerges

texts.es:
Pablo Boanerges tiene 45 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos de plagas y enfermedades como langosta y cogollero. Su sueño es salir adelante.

Le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Pablo Boanerges is 45 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "Unidos Venceremos" (United We Shall Overcome).  It is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Pablo grows crops, especially corn and rice.  He has been doing this for a long time.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the same town.

Pablo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his business: plant diseases and pest infestations such as locusts and budworms.  His dream is to get ahead in life.

Pablo enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Jesús Mi Proveedor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús mi proveedor lo conforman David Antonio, María Teresa y Carelia del Rosario, originarios de Diriomo. El coordinador es el señor David Antonio de 40 años de edad. Él se dedica al comercio de leche la cual distribuye en distintas comunidades por medio de su moto.   
El con el crédito comprara  leche para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
Mientras María Teresa  y  Carelia del Rosario se dedican al comercio de pan artesanal y a la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas de temporada.
texts.en: The group "Jesús Mi Proveedor" ("Jesus, My Provider"), consists of David Antonio, María Teresa and Carelia del Rosario, who come from Diriomo.  The coordinator is Señor David Anthony, who is 40 years old.  He sells milk, which he distributes in various communities via his motorbike.  With the loan, he will buy milk to further strengthen his business.  Meanwhile, María Teresa and Carelia del Rosario work selling artisanal bread and buying and selling seasonal fruit.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is forty years old and married with six children. She has a shop where she sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has been in business for three years.

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Eufemia Gregoria

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Gregoria tiene 51 años es madre. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en su propio negocio que sería la venta de mercadería en general, tiene más de 27 años en este negocio en donde conoce muy bien las diferentes calidades de productos que ofrece y a sus clientes. Sale todos los días a ofrecer productos como mochilas, sabanas, bolsos, perfumes, tratamientos, calzado y otros productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de estos prodcutos que les muestra a sus clientes todos los dias ya que tiene una gran variedad de encargos.  Su sueño es ver crecer a su hijo y seguirle proporcionando apoyando con el estudio. Con el préstamo solicitado comprara la materia prima que necesita.
texts.en: Doña Eufemia Gregoria is 51 years old, and a mother. When she was very young, she started her own business, which would be the sale of merchandise in general. She has now had more than 27 years in this business and well knows the quality of the products she offers her customers. She goes out every day to sell products such as rucksacks, sheets, handbags, perfumes, toiletries, socks and other goods. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of these products, as having them will show to her clients that she has a large variety of merchandise. Her dream is to see her son grow up and to continue supporting him in his education. With the loan she will buy the raw material needed.

loans.use: to buy rucksacks, sheets, handbags, perfumes, toiletries, socks and other products.

loans.name: Dilbar's Group

texts.en:
Dilbar is the treasurer of this group. She is 52 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she has raised a son, who is 21 and employed. A year ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Dilbar started to sell products such as fruit and vegetables, macaroni, chocolate, etc. In this way she earns 7000 soms per month. 

With the profits gained from the business, Dilbar built a kiosk and increased the commodity turnover. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more goods for her inventory and a fridge to keep products cool. In the future Dilbar wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge to keep products cool.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS MARGARITAS DE OCONGATE”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Clorinda; la socia es casada y tiene 44 años de edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, la socia cría cuyes al por mayor, ella cría alrededor de 200 cuyes amas y ahora también se dedica  a la crianza de truchas, la socia tiene una pequeña picigranja en su domicilio y está continuamente implementando su criadero de truchas y para ello ella requiere el préstamo para implementar los pozos, el cuidado del agua, la compra de truchas bebes para incrementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de truchas bebes, también de animales menores como cuyes para aumentar su negocio.
