La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Clorinda is 44 and married, with 2 children; she is a member of the communal bank "Margaritas de Ocongate" in Quispicanchis, Cusco.  She raises small animals, buying them wholesale, and has nearly 200 cuyes (guinea pigs).  She also raises trout in a small fish farm she operates at home, and seeks this credit to put in new tanks of treated water as well as buy stock of fish hatchlings to raise and in this way grow her business.  Clorinda is grateful for the support given to her and is committed to prompt repayment of the funds borrowed.

loans.use: to buy stock of trout and cuyes (small animals) to raise and sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señoraMartina tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Eduardo que trabaja de taxista, ellos tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando. Doña martina y su familia viven en un aregin que se caracteriza por ser unos de los principales productores de Azucar.

Doña Martina nos comenta que desde hace 9 años dedicio iniciar con su negocio de venta de tamales porque quiere ofrecerle a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida y a su hijo que se encuentra estudiando darle una profesion.

Ella realiza sus ventas de tamales, un dia antes de elaborar sus tamales levanta pedidos y al dia siguiente se levanta muy tempranos para hacer sus tamales despues de que ya estan hechos los reparte entre sus clientes y recibe el pago por su alimento, pero tambien nos cuenta que hace un poco mas de tamales para salir a caminar casa por casa para que pueda tener un poco mas de ganancias, en otras ocasiones le hacen pedidos grandes para dar en la fiestas de cumpleaños.

Doña Martina necesita este credito para la compra de hojas de elote, variedad d chiles, aceite, sal, carne, elotes para la elaboracion de sus productos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pueda prosperar y asi sus ganancias aumenten para darles un poquito mas a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y pueda mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Martina is 39 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Eduardo, who works as a taxi driver.  They have three children, but only one of them is in school.  Doña Martina and her family reside in a region that is known for being one of the main producers of sugar.  

Doña Martina says that nine years ago she decided to start her business of selling tamales because she wanted to provide her family a better quality of life.  She also wanted to help her son who is in school so that he can pursue a profession.  

Martina sells tamales by taking orders on the day before she makes them.  On the following day, she wakes up very early so that she can make the tamales.  Afterwards, she delivers them to her customers and collects payment.  Martina says that she makes extra tamales so that she can sell them by going house-to-house to earn some additional income.  On other occasions, she receives large orders for birthday parties.  

Doña Martina needs this loan to buy corn husks, a variety of chili peppers, oil, salt, meat, and corn for making her products.  She hopes that this investment will prosper her business and increase her income so that she can provide a little more for her children in order for them to go to school.  This will also help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corn husks, a variety of chili peppers, oil, salt, meat, and corn for making tamales.

loans.name: Dabo 01 Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe Dabo 01 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois. Il  est composé de 21 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Baldé  (assise l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  51 ans, mariée et mère de sept  enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse  de jus et de glace dans son village, de même elle a un étalage de légumes. Au début elle ne vendait que des légumes. Avec  années d’expérience de ce domaine d’activité, elle compte d’avantage varier son activité.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter les différents produits pour la fabrication de jus et s’approvisionner en légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des membres de la famille en nourriture, santé et scolarité.
texts.en:
The Dabo 01 group was created on July 12, 2008, and has had five loan cycles with Banc Villageois. The group is made up of 21 women who live in the same village. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Madame Baldé (seated, far right) is the group's leader. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She sells juice and ice in the village, and she also has a vegetable stall. At first, she only sold vegetables. After several years of experience, she decided to add some variety. With this new loan, she will buy items necessary to make juice, and she will stock up on vegetables for re-sale. Profits from these activities allow her to support her husband in paying for food, healthcare and schooling for the family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make juice and to buy vegetables to re-sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James says that hardships and difficulties are the stepping stones toward success. 

He is a responsible father who raised his family in a village. Due to the hardships of life, he worked hard and tried harder to feed his family and send his two children to school. 

The main source of their living is through farming. They plant rice and raise livestock for sale. The fruit of their patience and hard work helped their children to earn degrees and becomes professionals. They are proud to say that it is their big accomplishment in life.

Despite this, James wants to continue and improve the business to have a stable source of income. He wants to ask additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He hopes that in the future, he can raise more pigs and make the business grow as he continues to work hard for it.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano es agricultor con al ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Con el dinero del crédito cubrirá el costo de una motobomba para mejorar la producción de papa y quinua. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Vicarani en la provincia  Aroma; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito, pues el análisis financiero indica que cuenta con los recurso necesarios para el repago de la deuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Feliciano is a farmer and has the help of his wife and children. The money from this loan will cover the cost of a water pump so that he can improve his production of potatoes and quinoa. Feliciano lives in his own home in the town of Vicarani in Aroma Province. He is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan. The financial analysis indicates that he has the necessary resources to repay this debt.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Lurui

texts.en:
Kurui is 28 years old and married to his wife Stella, who helps in supporting the family. They are blessed with two children, ages 3 and 6 years. He runs a posho mill (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava; like porridge) and he has been in business for three years, with a monthly income of 6,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He is borrowing a loan of KES 10,000, with which he intends to purchase spare parts for his posho mill. He plans to open a kiosk with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan, and his hopes and dreams are to improve the life span of his machine and to open a big shop.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 42-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan.

Fareeda makes pastries, coffee, and prepares "shehsha" (water pipes) out of her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay rent for a new location for her business.

An aspiration of Fareeda's is to open a quiet spot at her new location for "Shehsha" and she is looking also to improve her family's living conditions so that she can provide needed medications for her sick child.

loans.use: to rent a new location for her home-based project.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has eight children aged 9 to 27. She has been a maize farmer for 23 years. 

Christine is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop. She will use the loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production.  With profits from her farming, Christine will invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Benancia

texts.es: La señora Benancia nacio en la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive en la comunidad de Chaqui Cocha km 76 sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz. La vivienda que habita la clienta es rustico de las características de adobe y techo de paja prácticamente rustico. La actividad a que se dedica es la agricultura que produce los tubérculos y cereales en su comunidad, los trabajos agrícolas realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos en ayne y mink'a. El presente crédito está solicitando para la compra de insumos agrícolas de esa manera mejorar el incremento de su actividad económica y la calidad de vida en la familia.
texts.en:
Benancia was born in Tiraque province, Department of Cochabamba. She currently lives in the Chaqui Cocha community, on the 76th km of the old Santa Cruz road. She lives in a rustic house with adobe walls and straw roofs.
Benancia makes a living of agriculture and produces cereals and root vegetables for her community. She plants with the help of her family and, occasionally, her neighbors in collaborative schemes such as ayne and mink’a. Benancia is asking for this loan to purchase agricultural supplies that could help her increase her economic activity and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Yolanda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Olga Gricelda

texts.es: Olga, quiere invertir en frutas frescas por eso solicita otro préstamo, ya que considera que debe mantener efectivo para realizar compras e inversiones periódicas en el negocio, por el momento comprará uvas, frescas, melones, manzanas, para mantener el negocio, ella cree que esta nueva inversión será igual de provechosa al anterior, de la cual su familia ha recibido mejores beneficios y ella ha logrado ser una buena cliente con su pago puntual.
texts.en: Olga would like to invest in fresh fruits and thus is requesting another loan since she believes that she must have cash to make periodic purchases and investments in her business. At the moment she will buy grapes, strawberries, melons and apples in order to maintain her business. She believes that this new investment will be as advantageous as the former one, which has provided her family with better benefits. She has also been a good client in making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy grapes, strawberries, melons and apples to sell.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La Señora Nélida es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia. Nos cuenta que tiene un taller de Corte y Confección donde realiza trabajos de alta costura como trajecitos,  Vestidos, Camisas y otros.
Comenta que el taller que tiene lo heredo de su mamá y que gracias al esfuerzo que ella le pone ha podido crecer y hacerse de una clientela considerable. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien no le teme a ningún desafío ni trabajo, y lo ha demostrado levantando en negocio que tiene.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, gomas y botones, los cuales son indispensables para ella, ya que son los insumos que utiliza en su taller. Está mu agradecida por la ayuda que le dan kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en: Nélida is from the city of Villarrica, Paraguay. She is 51 years old, married and lives in her own home. She says that she has a sewing shop where she does haute couture like suits, dresses, shirts and other items. She says that she inherited the shop from her mother, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to grow it and have a considerable customer base. She defines herself as a hard-working and enterprising woman who isn't afraid of any challenge or task, and she has demonstrated that with her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, rubber and buttons, which are indispensable items for her workshop. She is very grateful for the support from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, rubber and buttons.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort lives at Nkrontrodo with 6 dependents and her husband, who is a driver. Comfort sells soft drinks, maize, groundnuts, and beans. She has done this for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.

Comfort will use her loan to purchase more soft drinks, maize, groundnuts, and beans for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, maize, groundnuts, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AÏDOTE est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité et mènent des activités communes. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Tawa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Tawa est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Tawa est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Mouseldik. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tawa a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Tawa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Tawa vend des friperies depuis vingt cinq ans ; ce qui lui de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants. Tawa s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Tawa sollicite, ensemble avec du groupe AÏDOTE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des friperies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 57 years old widowed and blessed with four children aged between 34 and 16 years old.

She has been into vegetable and horticultural farming business for twenty three years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.11,000.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya,she intends to buy more vegetables seeds and fertilizers for her farm in the village as she anticipates to save and pay fees for her children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to have a successful and stable business in the future

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for her farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vic is 27 years old and a mother of two. She began her trading activities approximately 5 years ago shortly after junior school. She sells both rubber and leather footwear. She participated in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN in September, 2006. Currently, she is negotiating with a major supplier to provide regular supply of the goods. She therefore expects to be assisted with the loan from KIVA to increase the capital base.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Milka would like to buy textile materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add to fish stock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is a 28 year old married woman and is from Uromi of Edo State.  She is a Hair dresser by profession and has studied hair dressing for three years.  She is and has been a LAPO client for 4 years and has been in the hair dressing business for seven years.  She needs the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy freezer, weavons and ladies wears

loans.name: Martire

texts.en:
Martire runs her colmadito (small neighborhood grocery store) by herself and is asking for her fourth loan to expand her inventory. She is very responsible with her income and savings and keeps a record of her expenses, sales, and inventory in a notebook she carries everywhere with her. With her past loans, she has managed to use her savings to buy a freezer. She says her ability to purchase this freezer has been the key to her success. She is now able to sell perishable items, cold water, and cold beer to her neighbors—and as a result has greatly increased her sales.

Martire says it has been a hard life; she supports her three children, her mother who is very ill, and her husband by herself. She is grateful, however, that one step at a time, she has been able to improve her income and the welfare of her family members. Martire is very involved with her Catholic Church, and the local Club de Madres (Mothers' Club). She is most grateful for these loans and believes that they have truly changed her life for the better.

loans.use: Expand inventory with vegetables, fruit, beverages, canned food, bread, etc.

loans.name: Florinda Francisco

texts.pt:
Florinda Francisco C. is 47 years old, single, and the mother of 6 children. She lives in the Bagamoyo district in Maputo. She sells firewood and charcoal in the market and at home. She entered the program in 2004 as a member of the Bagamoyo group, having taken a first loan of 1,800 meticais. Now she'll be in her 4th loan cycle as an individual client and will take a loan of 5,000 meticiais. All the loans have been applied to the business. She has shown herself to be a person of good character and has not missed payments.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Florinda Francisco C. tem 47 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos. Vive no bairro Bagamoyo em Maputo. Vende Lenha e carvão no mercado e em casa. Entrou para o programa em 2004 como membro do grupo Bagamoyo,tendo tomado 1.800MT como 1º empréstimo.Vai agora para o 4º cilclo como cliente individual e vai tomar 5.000MT. Todos os empréstimos tem aplicado no nogócio. Tem demonstrado ser uma pessoa de bom carácter e não tem falhas nos pagamentos.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Haitali

texts.ru:
Haitali K. is 56, has a high school education, is married and has 5 children. Currently he is unemployed. Haitali wants to start his own business. He wants to purchase a car and offer taxi services to the local residents. He has some money that he was able to save up thanks to his son who is currently working in Russia. However this money is insufficient to be able to purchase a car. The loan that Haitali is requesting is the exact amount of money he needs to buy a car. The region that he lives in lacks a permanent mode of transportation that would link it to the center of the region or the center of the city. There are not that many people offering this kind of service. The appearance of an additional taxi will allow the locals to go to the center of the city or the center of the region and take care of business without having to wait an excessive amount of time for transport. Haitali is planing to repay back the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караев Хайтали, возраст – 56 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Хайтали в настоящее время не работает. Он хочет заняться своим видом бизнеса, а именно купить автомобиль и оказывать услуги такси населению района, где он проживает. У него есть немного своих денег, которые он накопил за счёт средств, которые ему пересылает сын из России, но этих денег не хватает на покупку автомобиля. Размер запрашиваемого кредита, это именно та сумма, которая не хвататет ему для покупки автомобиля. Так как в данном района отсутствет транспортное регулярное сообщение с центром района и города и не так много людей, оказывающие подобного рода услуги. Появление ещё одного таксиста даст возможность местным жителям ездить в город, в центр района по своим делам, при этом не ожидая транспорта. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase a car

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with two children.  Kadiatu is well-known in her community for her fish sales.  There is high demand for fish in Kabala, and for Kadiatu to make greater profits, she is requesting a loan to expand her business.  With the profit, she is able to support her family, especially her husband who has been unemployed for the last two years.

loans.use: Kadiatu would like to increase the amount of fish she is able to buy and sell  within her community.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mrs. Khin K., 49, works with her husband as gas sellers together earning $5.20 per day. They have 6 children. One of the elder daughters is a food seller (selling rice and food in front of her house to nearby customers) and earns about $3.30 per day. This couple wants to buy a plot of farmland to plant a variety of vegetables to gain more profit. This family would like a loan from KIVA that is $1000 to purchase farmland.

loans.use: This couple use this loan to purchase a plot of farmland to plant variety of vegetables.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is an enterprising business owner from Pavlograd, Ukraine. She has an attractively arranged women’s clothing store situated at the Ulana “rhinok,” or market, in Pavlograd. Margarita has been in business for five years. Loans she has received through Nadiya Ukraine have been instrumental in the success of her business. Margarita is married and has two children, a son and daughter. Her son is currently finishing college.

Margarita has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a selection of jackets for the upcoming spring season. She hopes to continue making a good profit and earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase 20 spring jackets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. prepares doughnuts for sale. She is married and has six children. The price of the flour, which is the major raw material for the preparation of doughnuts, has increased and it is affecting her income.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to offset the cost of increased flour prices.

loans.use: Additional capital to offset the cost of increased flour prices

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: “Since I began to take out loans from LAPO seven years ago, my business has been increasing," says Beatrice B.. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Beatrice lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and earns income buying oil in drums and supplying it to retailers in gallons. She was trained in this business for two years and currently needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more oil for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of oil for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine M. sells mobile phone airtime cards and airtime transfers. She is single and must fully support herself. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf, 26 years old, was living with his wife and 1 child in the Palestinian camp of Naher Al Bared in the North of Lebanon. Unfortunately, he was obliged to leave his home after Al Bared war, and moved to another village where he rented a barber shop for men's haircuts. He needs  USD 1,000 to open his own shop and purchase new materials. Ashraf has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years and has always repaid his debts on-time.

loans.use: Opening of a barber shop

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana is the mother of 2 children. She was born in 1981. This young woman lives in Khachmaz region. 6 years ago she started cattle breeding. Now she needs a loan of US$ 875 to buy 2 calves.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Hagai

texts.en:
Hagai E. sells rice, sugar, gari, tomatoes, and other products at Abrobiano in Elmina. Hagai has received senior high school education. She is divorced and has 2 children.

Hagai has been selling rice, sugar, gari, etc. since 1982. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and for housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to add to her capital to buy more food items for re-sale

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz  N. is the responsible father of two children who has always watched over his family's financial security. He accomplishes this by means of caring for his animals on a daily basis. 

He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few number of cattle, and now, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns two cows to fatten and sell at the local market. 

He holds great hopes for the present time of year because it is high season for wedding parties and meat is a very popular item for the celebrations. For this purpose, Mubariz has applied for a loan of US$1200 in order to purchase one cow and two calves. Your generosity can change this family's lives.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin O. owns a supermarket and sells medicines and household provisions. He buys the products and medicines from Onitsha, Lagos and Benin. Godwin is 50-years-old and is married with eight children, who are all attending school.

Because of the high demand for his goods from his customers, he needs a loan to increase his inventory of medicines and provisions. He expresses his profound gratitude to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 20 años, vive con su esposa. Freddy ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y ganadería, heredó de sus padres sus tierras y animales, es así que con mucha dedicación está sembrando papa, arveja, quinua entre otros productos, nativos de su tierra. Durante el día trabaja sin tener un horario fijo, espera poder ver pronto la recompensa de su trabajo, después de varios meses de cosecha. Así mismo, ha sembrado pastizales para sus animales y cada semana, los días viernes los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad, por lo cual su deseo es incrementar lo que posee para que pueda dar toda la comodidad a sus hijos que han de venir. Es la primera vez que Freddy  solicita un préstamo en MFP, por lo la cual se compromete en ser un cliente responsable con sus pagos. La cantidad solicitada será invertida en sus actividades agrícolas, comprando un saco de abono y un torito más para su ganado, lo que le permitirá posteriormente venderlo engordado en la feria ganadera.
texts.en:
Freddy is 20 and lives with his wife. Freddy has worked all of his life in agriculture and livestock, he inherited the land and animals from his parents, with a lot of dedication he grows potatoes, peas, quinoa and other products native to his land. During the day he works without a set schedule, he hopes to soon see the reward from his work, after a few months of harvest. He has also grown feed for his livestock and every week, on Fridays, he sells them in the local livestock fair, his wish is to expand to be able to provide a comfort life to his future children. This is the first time that Freddy requests a loan through Microfinanzas Prisma, and he commits to be responsible with repayments. The amount requested will be invested in agricultural activities, buying a sack of fertilizer and a small bull that he will raise and sell at the livestock fair.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Lucerito Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité  fue la señora Rosana V., está casada con el Señor Diosnel Evancio es madre de 2 Hijos ella es Peluquera vive en el km 8 Monday de C.D.E. A la señora le agrado mucho el Programa de comité e Mujeres Emprendedoras contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se denomina “Lucerito”, está constituido  por 15 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser:
Ramona A.	Venta de Frutas
Rosana V.	Peluquería
Beatriz D.	Venta De Huevo
Margarita R.	Despensa
Estela Ramírez	Venta De Ropa Interior
Eulalia Espínola	Venta De Cubiertos
Gregoria M.	Venta De Frutas
Gladys Ibáñez	Venta De Materiales De Limpieza
Asunción C.	Venta De Ropa
Maria T.	Venta De Ropa
Noelia A.	Venta De Joyas
Elisa A.	Venta De Ropa
Maria V.	Venta De Huevo y Queso
Rosana A. 	Venta De Verduras
Librada Agüero	Venta De Gallina


El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta como: pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, pulseras, cadenas cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, rapo de piso, detergente, suavizante y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo y desean invertir en una actividad extra.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 c/u
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosana V. formed this committee. She is married to Mr. Diosnel Evancio and is the mother of two daughters. She is a hairdresser and lives at Km 8 Monday de C.D.E. She is very grateful to the program of the committee and the Mujeres Emprendedoras' contact with neighbors and friends to form the committee in this zone. The committee is called Lucerito (Little Star) and is made up of 15 very active and supportive women all from the same neighborhood. They all have different professions such as: Ramona A. Fruit sales Rosana V. Hair dresser Beatriz D. Egg sales Margarita R. Shop owner Estela Ramírez Sale of undergarments Eulalia Espínola Sale of cutlery Gregoria M. Fruit sales Gladys Ibáñez Sale of cleaning products Asunción C. Clothing sales Maria T. Clothing sales Noelia A. Jewelry sales Elisa A. Clothing sales Maria V. Sale of eggs and cheese Rosana A. Sale of vegetables Librada Agüero Sale of chickens The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise and needed items such as: pants, t-shirts, tomatoes, onions, bracelets, chains, face creams, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, candies, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, mops, detergent, fabric softener, and other things that will bring in more work and provide a fixed income and allow investments in additional activities. The woman are requesting a loan of Gs 300.000 c/u.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of fruits, vegetables, chickens, cosmetics, eggs, candy, beverages, cutlery, plastics, clothing, foods, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Hairiddin

texts.ru: Саидов Хайриддин жиьтель города Яван.Возраст 32 года , имеет шестерых детей. Работает на стройке подсобным рабочим и его заработной платы не хватает на такую большую семью. Поэтому у него есть небольшое хозяйство , где он оразводит бычков . Теперь он решил получить кредит и использовать его на покупку дойной коровы. Получаемое молоко он будет реализовывать на рынке . Это немного улучшит его положение . Погасть кредит сможет в течение восьми месяцев.
texts.en:
Hairiddin S. resides in Yavan town. He is 32 years old and has 6 children. He is a helper at a construction site and his income is not enough to support his large family. Therefore he raises bull calves. Hairiddin decided to get a loan for buying a milk cow. Selling milk at the local market would help improve his financial situation. Hairiddin would be able to pay off the loan within eight months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Harakati Group

texts.en:
Adam R., age 35, is married with three children ages 2, 8 and 12. He sells second-hand clothes at the Karuma market. He started this business in 1998 and works daily from 6am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $104. 

This will be Adam’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to increase his capital so that he can get a larger stock of clothes for his business.
	
Adam will share this loan with his loan group, Harakati, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable to pay back their loans. In the picture, Adam is in the middle wearing a grey shirt.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, actualmente está viviendo en la casa que heredó de su padre. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, a las 4.00am inicia el amasando de los bollos en la panadería y a las 6.00am se ubica en el parque de su pueblo con la canasta de panes, vende hasta las 8.00am, luego regresa a casa hasta las 2pm para preparar los alimentos y atender a sus hijos, para que después comience nuevamente el amasado de los panes para la hora del lonche (refrigerio al anochecer) ubicándose en el parque de su pueblo, hasta  las 7.00pm. Pese a ser muy cansado su trabajo Martha dice estar muy contenta porque le agrada vender y estar en contacto con la gente. Cada día inicia con un capital de 20 a 30 soles, de los cuales sus ganancias se incrementan hasta 50 o 60 soles. Ella nos comenta su alegría por su  negocio, pese a sus dificultades de salud, por madrugar constantemente y trabajar en el intenso frío. Una de sus metas futuras es comprar una casa para poner una pequeña tienda donde vender varios productos y dejar el parque y el frío, así captar mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar y para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar los pagos correspondientes de acuerdo el cronograma fijado por el asesor de crédito de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita Martha es para la compra de sacos de harina para la elaboración de sus panes.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old, a single mother, has four children, and currently is living in the house that she inherited from her father. For 11 years she has dedicated herself to the baking and selling of bread. At 4:00am she begins kneading the dough in the bakery and at 6:00am she situates herself in the park of her village with the basket of breads which she sells until 8:00am. She then returns home until 2:00pm to prepare food for and attend to her children, and begins anew to knead dough for the lunch hour (afternoon meal). She again situates herself in the park of her village until 7:00pm.

Despite being very tired from her work, Martha says she is very content because she enjoys selling and being in contact with the people. Every day she starts with a capital of 20 to 30 PEN with which she earns 50 or 60 PEN. She tells us of her joy for her business despite her difficulties in health due to constantly rising before dawn and working in the intense cold. One of her future goals is to buy a house where she could put a small store for selling various products and to leave the park and the cold, thereby capturing better income for her household and for the well-being of her children. This is her first loan with MFP which she commits to pay on time according to the payment plan established by the loan officer of her communal bank. The money that Martha asks for is to buy sacks of flour for baking her breads.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour

loans.name: Makunguru B Group

texts.en:
Getruda has been a clothes and snacks seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and snacks item for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Getruda is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rehema, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: Buy more clothes and snacks to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla P. sells used clothes in the flea market. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. She is also engaged in the food business. When she is not busy in her ready-to-wear (RTW) business, she sells food to earn additional income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to sell. In that way, she believes, she will earn more income to support her children in their schooling.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start their own business. They provide credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her RTW business.

loans.name: Manaen

texts.es: El señor Manaen I. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales le han servido para hacerle mejoras a su casa, pero le está haciendo falta el vitropiso, para poder habitarla ya que actual mente está vivienda con una hermana y su familia ya necesita su propio espacio y privacidad.  Portal motivo esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo lo más pronto posible su mejora.
texts.en:
Mr. Manaen I. has had two loans with FVP that he utilized to make improvements in his house. He still needs the complete the flooring to be able to move into it. He is presently living with his sister but he and his family need their own space and privacy. Therefore he requests a new loan to be able to proceed with the necessary improvements as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing of flooring in his house

loans.name: Irsalat

texts.ru: Ирсалат женщина 50 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Ирсалат откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Ирсалат продает их на скотном рынке. Ирсалат кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Ирсалат планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ирсалат очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Irsalat is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Irsalat feeds the livestock at home; then, once the livestock is ready, Irsalat’s husband sells it at the market. She has been a borrower at our organization for 1 year. She successfully repaid two previous loans and now wants to obtain another one. Irsalat plans to increase the quantity of her livestock, which will increase profits for her family. Irsalat likes the terms of our lending very much, and happy that there are such organizations that support the society.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling livestock

loans.name: El Trapiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Trapiche” esta compuesto  por 17 personas representados por la señora Norma quien es su presidenta. Las socias del grupo se dedican a actividades como la venta de pan, verduras, cosméticos por catalogo, y productos e la época, alguno de los socios varones se dedican al transporte público de pasajeros. El nivel competitivo de este grupo es alto es por esta razón que requieren de un apoyo económico para la compra de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayudará a realizar un producto mas atractivos para el mercado competitivo y de esa manera generen mayores ingresos que servirá para bríndales a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El grupo se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, honestidad y responsabilidad en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "El Trapiche" group is comprised of 17 people who are represented by señora Norma, who is their president. The members of the group have different jobs like selling bread, vegetables, cosmetics by catalog, and seasonal products. Some of the male members have public transportation businesses. The competitive level of this group is high, and this is why they need economic support to buy materials and tools that will help them have more attractive products in the competitive market. In this way they will earn better incomes that will let them give their families a better quality of life. The group is on its third loan and has been punctual, honest, and responsible with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kory Jaulitas Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “ Kory Jaulitas” que significa “Jaula de Oro” es un grupo de señoras muy unidas y alegres, con aproximadamente 5 años de vida se encuentra en el Centro Focal “German Busch”, sus integrantes en su mayoría se comunican con el idioma aymará (idioma nativo), así también, la mayoría se dedica al tejido de diferentes prendas, puede ser a mano o a máquina, una de ellas es Reyna L. su especialidad es tejer ropa de bebe y en esta época de frío tiene mucha demanda. Todas las integrantes de Kory Jaulita manifiestan que el  crédito que están obteniendo les permitirá tener mayor movimiento económico y podrán comprar materia prima como la lana.
texts.en:
The “Kory Jaulitas” Communal Association, which means “Jaula de Oro (Cage of Gold)”, is a group of very united and happy women who have been meeting for approximately five years at the “German Busch” Center. The majority of the members communicate in the Aymará language (their native language), and the majority are in the business of knitting different garments, both by hand and machine. One of them is Reyna L. whose specialty is to knit baby clothes and in this season of cold weather she has a lot of demand. All of the members of Kory Jaulita indicate that the loans that they are receiving will allow them to have a better financial situation and they will be able to purchase premium material such as wool.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of premium material

loans.name: Fuseina

texts.en: Fuseina is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She operates a licensed chemical shop in the village in which she lives with her family. She has been operating the shop for eleven years to help her husband care for their family. She gets her supplies from Kumasi and sometimes from suppliers who come to her. With the loan, she wants to restock her shop with drugs that are frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to save her profits to meet her children's educational needs.

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 56, is married and has 6 children. She currently lives with husband in Kampong Cham province and she is unemployed. However, the family is supported by her four children who are working in the city at a garment factory. Her children are able to send her money of US$150 per month to cover her expenses. Her husband is a traditional musician who performs at wedding parties and he typically is able to make US$0.8 per day. S. and her husband have recently noticed that their motorbike is not holding up well and they need to purchase a new one to maintain their income. She has requested a loan of US$250 from CREDIT to replace their old motorbike so that her children are able to go to work. S. sees this as way to increase their daily income through funds that will no longer be needed for repairs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah N. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a married lady who has owned a poultry business for one year and a farming business for 5 years. She has over 300 broiler chickens that she sells to her customers every two months. In her farming business, she grows food mainly for home consumption, but she plans to increase production so that she sell the excess. At the moment, she makes a monthly profit of 300,000/= (/= means shillings) and she hopes to increase this amount if she can expand to accommodate more egg-laying chicks. She needs a loan to be able to buy more feed for her birds.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Fernando B. le está haciendo falta pintarla principalmente y desea cambiar la fachada de la misma. Pretende realizar algunos maceteron de concreto algunas molduras que hagan ver una casa más bonita.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esos cambios a su vivienda, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo.
El planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo de técnico de eléctrico de la comisión de agua potable (municipio), es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que tiene dos hijos adolescentes quienes están estudiando. 
El señor B. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pagó puntualmente.
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es su esposa la señora Lucina Martínez ella nos atendió el día que se realizó la visita a la vivienda de la familia B..
texts.en:
The home of Mr. Fernando Baez is in need of painting and exterior finish work, but at this time he lacks the money necessary to repair his home. This is why he is requesting a loan for the exterior finishes. He plans to pay the credit with the income from his job as an electric technician at a potable water company. This is also the income he has for his family, which includes two teenagers who are students. Mr. Baez has already had a credit with FVP which he pays punctually. The person who appears in the photo is his wife Mrs. Lucina Martinez, who was the person that assisted us the day the visit was made to the home of the Baez family.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pintar la vivienda y realizar una fachada para su casa.

loans.name: Xaveur

texts.en:
Xaveur N. is 31 years old and is married with one child. He has been running his shop for three years working ten hours a day.

Xaveur is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through buying more products. With that expansion, Xaveur hopes to earn more profit than before. Then, through that profit, he will be able to buy his own house and save for his family.

Through accessing this loan, Xaveur expects to have a positive change in his life and a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 45 años, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos de 21, 17 y 15 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas con ayuda de sus hijos, que en ese entonces eran niños y con el tiempo fueron incrementando sus esfuerzos. Hoy tienen varias cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino, y cuentan con algunos terrenos donde cultivan hortalizas y papa. Por ello, todos los días Flor vende la leche de sus vacas y supervisar el buen crecimiento de sus plantaciones. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con sus cultivos y mejorar la raza de sus vacas.  
Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, para ella trabajar con el apoyo de un banco comunal es una experiencia nueva. El dinero que está solicitando será para la compra de sacos de abono que le servirán para sembrar alfalfa (alimento de sus animales) y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Flor is 45 years old. She is a widow and lives in her own house with her 3 children, aged 21, 17 and 15. For the past 17 years, she has worked in agriculture with the help of her children, who began when they were young and have been able to contribute more and more over time. Today, the family has several cows and sheep, as well as a few plots of land where they cultivate potatoes and other vegetables. Every day, Flor sells the milk from her cows and checks on the progress of her crops. Her desire is to continue expanding her cultivated fields and improve the quality of her cows. This is Flor's first opportunity to take on a loan with MFP; for her, working with the support of a communal bank is a new experience. The funds she is requesting will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer, which will allow her to plant alfalfa (to feed her animals) and more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Aïssatou Combé

texts.fr: Aïssatou Combé, 55 ans, mariée, 8 enfant en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 7 ans. Avec son crédit elle développe une activité de vente de poisson séché. Elle participe à la prise en charge quotidienne de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Combé, aged 55, is married and has eight children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for seven years.  With her loan, she's developing a business selling dried fish.  She participates in covering day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her small business

loans.name: Sharav

texts.en:
T. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son, 22, works as a coach; her oldest daughter, 20, is a university student; and her youngest daughter, 17, attends a local secondary school. T. and her husband operate a grocery business out of a rented stall at a local market.

She began her business in 1991 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD), and, since that time, her business has grown steadily and her working capital has now reached 4,600,000 tugrugs (~4050 USD). Not only has her business grown in terms of profits, but she has also managed to rent another grocery stall at another local market so that she can reach more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own grocery shop where she can expand the amount and types of products she sells and expand the amount of customers she attracts. She says, “My wish is to educate my children in order to make them better people.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase seabuckthorn berries and oil from Uvs province.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase seabuckthorn berries and oil from Uvs province

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 57 ans elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF depuis mars 2002 et y a bénéficié de 16 crédits qui lui ont permis de développer une activité commerciale. Elle vent des fruits de saison tels que les mangues, les pastèques et les fruits d'agrume. Elle participe à la prise en charge scolaire et sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mariama D., aged 57, is married and the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of Village Bank of BAYOUF since March 2002, and has received 16 loans that have enabled her to develop her own business. She sells seasonal fresh fruit, such as mangos, watermelon and citrus fruits. She uses her income to support her children and send them to school.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her fresh fruit business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes D. is a self-confident woman with the willpower to rise above poverty. She is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is happily married to Ruben D., who is 59 years old. She lives in the village of Lower Zigzag, Antipolo City, Rizal Province in the Philippines. For almost a month, Gertrude has been preparing food for meriendas, the Filipino afternoon snack. Gertrudes decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA field partner in the Philippines, to gain access to capital for her business. Gertrudes is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fish balls, cheese sticks, bananas, cooking oil, sugar, cornstarch, and kwek-kwek (a hard-boiled quail egg fried in orange-flavored batter, and served with sweet sauce.) She believes that her business is in demand and will bring her enough income to cover her family's day-to-day expenditure. She dreams of sending her children to school and modernizing her house, so it it larger and sturdier. With all of these dreams, she wishes and prays to God to continue giving her good health and a strong mind to achieve her goals. She also grateful for the support of ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food for her meriendas (afternoon snack) business

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia es una muy buena cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que solicita ya que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya que tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella siempre le ha gustado pues ha sido el único medio de vida que ha tenido para salir adelante es por eso que siente muy motivada para seguir creciendo con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será invertido en la compra de maíz por quintal ya que de esta manera le resulta mucho más favorable. El deseo de Maria es proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio que son necesarias.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is a very good client of Fundación León 2000, so this is not her first loan, as the others have been of great help for her business. She’s been selling tortillas for more than 20 years. She loves her work and she’s thankful for it, as this is her only income. That’s why she’s so motivated to keep growing. She will use the money to purchase corn in bulk, so this way she can make a bigger profit. With the earning, she would like to make some much needed renovations in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Antonio V. tiene 45 años de edad, tiene un hijo y viven en el barrio Buenos Aires, en su casa de habitacion tiene su taller de carpinteria, tiene  4 años de tener su negocio en el cual elabora muebles para cocina, puertas, ventanas y tambien vende articulos como ser cameras, colchones, camas, ollas y otros articulos para el hogar.
Marco esta solicitando el credito para comprar madera y otros materiales para fabricar sus muebles.
 
Marco es una persona muy cristiana y nos comento que desea que todo el mundo este en paz.
texts.en:
Señor Marco Antonio V. is 45 years old, has a son and lives in the suburb of Buenos Aires. In his house he has a carpentry workshop, which he has had for 4 years. He makes kitchen furniture, doors, windows and also sells articles such as cameras, mattresses, beds, pans and other household articles. Marco is seeking a loan to buy wood and other materials to make his furniture. Marco is a very Christian person and tells us that he desires the world to be in peace.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, sandpaper, varnish, nails, screws and paint

loans.name: Wenna

texts.en:
Wenna S. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Wenna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Wenna owns and operates a business that makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Wenna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wenna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wenna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Wenna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Celestina Milena

texts.es:
La señora Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la venta de comida (viandas).

Celestina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  víveres para la preparación de la comida como: arroz, fideos, papa, verduras, carne,  etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias porque son muy alegres
texts.en:
Celestina has been a member of the community bank "Las Calceteras" for five years. She lives in the district of Juliaca in the San Román province in the Puno department. Celestina is 33 years old, she has a live-in partner and has three children. She completed her primary education and she now dedicates herself to the sale of food. Celestina tells us that she used the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 nuevos soles (PEN) to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy food supplies such as rice, pastas, potatoes,vegetables, meat, etc. which she uses to prepare her food. Celestina's dream for the future is to have her own home. What Celestina enjoys most from her community bank are the meetings with other members because they are very cheerful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, pastas, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Ketty Judith

texts.es: Ketty Álvarez Vásquez tiene varios negocios: vende mercancías, minutos telefónicos y junta con su mamá comidas, pero su principal oficio es la producción de artesanías, que son comunes en San Jacinto Bolívar, un municipio reconocido por la calidad de sus hamacas, mochilas y bolsos, donde en general las mujeres realizan artesanías, mientras los hombres se dedican a labores de campo. Tiene tres hijos entre 21 y 16 años de edad y vive con su cónyuge que se dedica a hacer mantenimiento y pintura de neveras y otros electrodomésticos. Ketty solicita un crédito con monto de $1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de de hilos para tejer hamacas y tambien comprar mercancías. Ella se vinculó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2008 y manifiesta que desde entonces ha aprendido manejar las deudas, hecho que se demuestra en sus pagos muy puntuales. Durante esta época tanto han aumentado sus ingresos familiares, como han mejorado las condiciones habitacionales. Además, tiene el negocio de venta de minutos gracias a la Fundación. Ha tenido situaciones difíciles debido a un accidente del hijo en el cual descapitalizó un poco su  negocio hace ya un tiempo; sin embargo, se concentra en sus sueños de mejorar su vivienda, aumentar los ingresos ampliando la venta de mercancías, promocionando sus artesanias y en brindarles educación a sus hijas. Se siente muy agradecida de pertenecer a la Fundación como usuaria
texts.en:
Ketty Álvarez Vásquez has various businesses. She sells merchandise, telephone minutes, and she sells food with her mother. But, her main job is making handicrafts that are common in San Jacinto Bolívar. It is a municipality that is known for the quality of its hammocks, backpacks, and purses. The women generally make handicrafts, and the men work in the fields. She has three children between 21 and 16 years old. She lives with her life partner. He performs maintenance and paints refrigerators and other domestic appliances. Ketty is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 COP to buy thread to weave hammocks. She will also buy merchandise. She associated with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 2008. From then on she has learned to manage her debts, which she demonstrates with her very punctual payments. During this time her family income has increased a lot, and her living conditions have improved. Also, thanks to the Foundation, she has a business selling minutes. She has had difficult situations because of an accident her son had. She had to take a little money out of the business for some time. Nevertheless, she concentrates on her dreams of improving her house, increasing her income by expanding the sale of merchandise, promoting handicrafts, and giving her daughters an education. She is very grateful to belong to the Foundation as a user of their services.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread to weave hammocks, and also buy merchandise

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
El comité Los Rosales del barrio Colonia Juan de Salazar de la ciudad de Limpio, se formó mediante que algunas integrantes del comité Restaurador del barrio Isla A. decidieron formar un nuevo comité en su localidad a fin de no tener inconvenientes para la asistencia a las reuniones. 
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 17 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Ceferiana A. se dedica a la venta de leche e invirtió el dinero en la compra de alimentos  para la vacas que ella mantiene en su tambo, ademas también invirtió en la compra de tambores para reciclar la leche y compró una ordeñadoras herramienta esencial para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Los Rosales (Rose-Bushes) Committee of Colonia Juan de Salazar in the city of Limpio was formed when some members of the Restaurador (Restorer) Committee in the Isla A. neighborhood decided to form a new committee in their locality in order to avoid difficulties in attending meetings. Presently, the group is in its 5th cycle of loans with the Enterprising Women's Committee Program, sponsored by the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation). The group is composed of 17 members who invest in distinct activities. Mrs. Ceferiana sells milk and has invested her money in buying feed for the cows she maintains in her shed, as well as in buying drums for recycling milk, and buying a regulator instrument that is essential to improving her work.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FEED FOR COWS AND WORK TOOLS SUCH AS DRUMS AND REGULATORS

loans.name: Jemilat

texts.en: Jemilat sells drinks and sachet water to make a living. She hopes to make her businesses more sustainable. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN70,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Adpat N°2 Group

texts.fr:
L’Association pour le Développement des Parcelles Assainies de Thiès (ADPAT) est un groupement mixte composé de personnes habitantes toutes dans un même quartier  les  Parcelles Assainies, un quartier très grand à Thiès. Elle a été créée en 2003 sous l’influence d’un groupe de femmes  qui étaient en tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). Cependant, les membres sont animés d’un même objectif qui est de créer la solidarité et de développer leur cher quartier les Parcelles Assainies.   
  L’association est actuellement dirigée par Madame Diallé Ndir, une  dame très engagée et qui connait bien la culture associative.  Elle est scindée auprès de U-IMCEC en 9 sous groupements avec un président et un trésorier pour chaque sous groupe afin de les faire profiter de ses services.
Pour ADPAT N°2, Madame Fatimata Nadia Dème est la présidente. Née en 1963, Madame Fatimata Nadia Dème est couturière depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s’est investie depuis un certain temps dans le commerce de divers produits à savoir tissus…etc. En d’autres  termes, Madame Dème s’intéresse dans presque toutes les activités de développement de son quartier. Elle est présentement la présidente du comité de gestion au niveau du collège de son quartier. Cependant avec l’argent demandé, elle prévoit de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour son commerce comme toutes ses sœurs avec lesquelles elle partage le sous groupe. 
Il s’agit entre autre de Madame Aby K. âgée de 63 ans et vendeuse de tissus, savon et oignons, Madame Maguette Gueye née en 1957 et qui vend de l’huile, Niébé ou haricot local, et des poissons séchés, Madame Ramatoulaye N. 22 ans et vendeuse de beignets et petit déjeuner et Madame Fatou N. qui vend des chaussures, sacs et des habits…
texts.en:
ADPAT, which stands for The Association for the Development of Parcelles Assainies (one of the large urban districts of Dakar) is a group of women who originally formed in 2003 as a “tontine” – a group financing system in which everyone makes periodic contributions, the funds thus raised being lent to each member in turn. They all share the desire to improve their beloved neighborhood, Parcelles Assainies. Today, the Association is directed by Mme. Dialle Ndir, an involved, experienced leader and community organizer. Under the auspices of U-IMCEC, The Association is divided into 9 sub-groups, each with a president and treasurer. The president of ADPAT N°2 is Mme. Fatimata Nadia Dème, who was born in 1963. She has worked as a seamstress for more than 10 years. For some time she has also sold a variety of goods, notably cloth. She is active in almost all development activities in her neighborhood. She is president of the board of the local middle school. With the loan money, she plans to purchase merchandise for her business, like all of her “sisters” in the subgroup. Other members include Mme. Aby K., aged 63, who sells cloth, soap and onions; Mme. Maguette Gueye, born in 1957, who sells oil, dried fish and Niébé, a type of kidney bean; Mme. Ramatoulaye N., ade 22, who sells fritters and breakfast foods, and Mme. Fatou N. who sells shoes, purses and clothing.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for resale

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara L. is 27 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Sara has 1 year of experience in this business.  Sara needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sara join the program to help develop her business.

In 2010, Sara joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Sara's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Camen  tiene 48 años, tiene dos hijos uno mayor de edad. 
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos cárnicos, los distribuye a varios negocios de su barrio y también está empezando a realizar sus ventas en algunas ciudades  del interior. Se inició en esta actividad en el año 2006. 
Su vivienda está ubicada en la Ciudad de San Lorenzo. El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de una buena cantidad de planchas de carne, para cubrir sus pedidos en nuevos negocios y carnicerías en el interior del país.
El anhelo de Doña Carmen es poder construir un amplio salón para montar allí su propia carnicería- distribuidora y de esta forma no tener que salir mucho de su hogar y estar mas tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 48, has two children, one of whom is an adult. She is a meat merchant. She sells to various businesses in her neighborhood and is starting to sell in some of the cities in the interior of the country; she started her business in 2006. Her home is located in the city of San Lorenzo. She will use the funds to buy a good quantity of slabs of meat to fill the pending orders she has in stores and butcher shops in the interior of the country. Carmen’s dream is to set up a spacious shop where she can install her large-scale butcher shop/meat distributorship so that she no longer has to leave home so much and can spend more time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy slabs of meat.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra C. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City,Isabela. She is 50 years old. Petra is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Petra raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Petra has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Petra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Petra is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Petra from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio Gabriel, tiene 35 años y su esposa se llama Nélida. 
Gabriel y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo jeans. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ellos tienen sus puestos de venta en los centros comerciales el Paraíso, Molino y Polvos Celestes en la ciudad del Cusco. El requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo Jeans. El sueño del socio es tener su propia fábrica de jeans.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old. His wife is called Nélida. Gabriel and his wife sell clothes, such as jeans. They have been working in this type of business for 20 years. Work has gone well, thanks to the hard efforts they have made. They have stalls set up at the Paraiso, Molino, and Polvos Celestes shopping centres in Cusco. Gabriel requires the loan to buy more merchandise. His dream is to one day have his own jeans factory.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as jeans

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”

La Sra. Miluska pertenece a la alcancía comunal “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”, que tiene trabajando  doce años con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, conformada por diez socias que se dedican a su familia y trabajo D. forma constante y dedicada.

El nombre D. la alcancía “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”, surgió con la idea D. una antigua socia, que a fallecido hace poco, la antigua socia siempre hablaba D. la estrella D. Belén y que todas las participantes deberían tener un punto fijo en donD. mirar para así alcanzar sus objetivos, bajo esta premisa se fijo el titulo “ESTRELLA D. BELÉN”; La Sra. Miluska tiene ocho años con el cargo D. secretaria y ha demostrado un excelente compromiso con su grupo.

Miluska es comerciante, venD. CD’S educativos, juegos didácticos, portarretratos e identifica y aprovecha el material o productos para vender según la fecha festiva. Ella también es profesora D. un colegio D. nivel inicial, solo trabaja en la mañana y por la tarD. con mucho esfuerzo sale a la calle a vender sus productos educativos.
Trabaja como comerciante desD. que ingresó a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD y gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta organización, ha logrado muchos ingresos con su negocio como comerciante, con los que ha conseguido construir su casa y darles estudios a sus hijos, su esposo se encarga D. pagar los gastos como alimentación y los servicios básicos D. agua, luz, teléfono, etc.

Sus planes para futuro es seguir ahorrando y lograr mudarse, debido a que la zona en donD. vive es peligrosa y no muy agradable. El préstamo que ha recibido lo usara para capital D. trabajo y seguir mejorando su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Star of Bethleham” Community Bank Mrs. Miluska belongs to the “Star of Bethlehem” Community Bank. She has been working for twelve years with “Edaprospo-Prosperidad” along with the ten members. All the members are always dedicated to family and work. An older member that died recently suggested the name of the bank, “Star of Bethlehem”. The older member always spoke of the Star of Bethlehem and that all of the members should have a fixed point to look towards to achieve their goals. This is why they choose the name “Star of Bethlehem”. Mrs. Miluska has been a member for eight years. She is the group secretary and has maD. an excellent contribution to the group. Miluska is a saleswoman. She sells educational CD’s and games and picture frames. She looks for and buys materials and products to sell according to the time of the year. She is also a teacher of level one at the secondary school. She only works in the morning. In the afternoon, with a lot of effort, she goes out to the streets to sell her educational products. She has worked as a saleswoman ever since she started with “Edaprospo-Prosperidad”. Thanks to her efforts and the efforts of the organization she has earned a good salary in her business as a saleswoman. With her earnings she has built a house and provided an education for her children. Her husband is in charge of paying for expenses like food and basic services like water, light, telephone, etc. Her plan for the future is to continue saving and move. The area where she lives is dangerous and not very pleasant. The loan that she receives will be used for working capital and to improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy educational materials to fill previous orders. To celebrate the Peruvian Independence Day she will buy flags, rosettes, posters related to Independence Day and previously ordered items.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: L. delphine est une femme de 28 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et est mère de 2 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de hountigomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales et s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. après remboursement d'un premier crédit elle sollicite un autre crédit pour l'achat de maïs, sacs de mil, sorgho et autres céréales pour s'approvisionner suite à la baisse de son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Delphine L., 28, is very energetic. Married with two children, she lives with her family in the Hountigomé neighborhood. She sells cereals, which she buys in local markets in Lome. She has repaid one previous loan, and is asking for another to buy corn, millet, sorghum and other grains to rebuild her depleted inventory.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereal grains

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino T. P. is 36 and married with five children (ages 1 - 14).  She owns a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Fuatino has three years of experience in this business.  Fuatino needs a loan of WST $1,700 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2008, Fuatino joined SPBD.  This is her third loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fuatino's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.
