Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Juntas Podemos, se conformó en fecha 27 de Julio del 2.010, con mucho esfuerzo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, y  de apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
Una de las integrantes  es la de la Sr. Ramona B.  quien se dedica a venta de carbón, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico. 
Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio  ayuda a  la economía de la  familia ya con el mismo  mejoró bastante, y actualmente posee  además del ingreso de su marido quien trabaja como jornalero, con  el ingreso de la venta de carbón.
 Según la Sra. Ramona   mencionó que las actividades que realizan con la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron  desarrollar sus  capacidades de trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carbón ya que hay mucha demanda por la temporada fría.
texts.en:
Description: The Juntas Podemos (Together We Can) committee was founded on July 27, 2010 with much effort but united and mutually supportive within the program. Besides each member’s individual work they also develop group activities to earn funds so that the group can have capital and be able to support their families economically. One of the group members is Mrs. Ramona B. who is a charcoal merchant. She commented to us that the loan allowed her to improve her business quite a bit as well as her standard of living and income. She also comments that the family’s economy improved considerably with the loan. She can now add her income from the charcoal sales to her husband’s salary as a day laborer. According to Ramona, activities they undertook with Fundación Paraguaya were very important because they developed their work skills. She is asking for funds to buy charcoal because demand is very high during the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal.

loans.name: Luis Gregorio

texts.es: El Señor Luis tiene dos hijos pequeños quienes no estudian,  viven en la casa de su suegra quien es una señora muy buena les ayuda con el pago de la luz, agua y otros. El ya lleva trabajando dos años en el transporte quien también vende zapatos para bebes con su esposa viajan al desaguadero para traer estos ya que allá es mas económico, ellos llevan a Brasil para vender por mayor y les da un ingreso considerable, trabajan muy duro para darles un buen futuro a sus hijos poder comprar una casita para ellos. El crédito que solicitaron es para la compra de llantas  para su movilidad y poder así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Luis has two small children who don’t go to school yet. They live in his mother-in-law’s house. She is a very good woman who helps them pay electricity, water and others. He has worked for two years in transportation and he also sells infant’s shoes with his wife. They travel to Desaguadero to bring merchandise because it’s less expensive there. They take it to Brazil to sell and this means considerable income. They work very hard to provide a good future for their children and to be able to buy a little house of their own. The loan they asked for is to buy tires for the car so that he can provide better customer service. He is very grateful for the opportunity he has been given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy G. is married and lives in Sitio Canonoy, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a cafeteria. Her husband, Cirilo G., who is 46 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have four children between the ages of 11 and 16 years old. 

Juvy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Juvy  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to pay for more merchandise for her sari-sari (general) store business, so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and the education of her children. Juvy G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Karin Lily

texts.es:
Karin es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos y vive en la zona urbana del distrito de Nueva Arica una comunidad pequeña dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 5 años a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su propio domicilio, el negocio es uno de los pocos que existen en la zona por lo que siempre cuenta con clientes que atender. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Karin se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un prestamo de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, de modo que pueda hacerlo crecer y con los nuevos ingresos que obtenga pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.

Karin es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos dan buenas referencias de ella y la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Karin is 36 years old, the mother of a family, and lives with her husband and their 3 children. She resides in the urban zone of Nueva Arica district. This is a small community dedicated principally to agriculture, and it's located 1 ½ hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For over 5 years, Karin has been selling beer and soft drinks from her own home.  The business is one of the few existing in the zone, which is why it always has customers to attend to.  The income she receives from this activity is used to help her husband sustain the family economy.

This is the 1st time that Karin has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She needs 2,000 new sols to expand her business, acquiring more products to make it grow. The new income she will obtain should improve her quality of life.

Karin is a very stable and responsible woman.  In the zone where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances give her good references and consider her a trustworthy person.

loans.use: BUYING BEER AND DRINKS TO EXPAND HER SALES BUSINESS IN HER HOME

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She has lived with her family in the area named Kot kabeer in a 2 room brick house for the last 16 years. She is married to M. N., who has a business of selling ice blocks in his community.

Razia herself owns and operates a milk selling business in her community. She has a buffalo at her home which gives her almost 8kg milk every day. She takes care of her buffalo by providing timely food and water.
  
She is a mother of 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are young and don’t go to school because Razia and N. didn’t have enough resources to afford their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her milk selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo for increasing the milk quantity and sales. She is hopeful that this loan investment will bring positive changes to her business and makes her income double in size. 

Razia is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In this photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Davaadolgor

texts.en:
Davaadolgor S. is 51 years old and lives with her husband. three children and two grandchildren in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her oldest daughter works for the newspaper and the other two children operate private businesses. Her two granddaughters attend a local kindergarten. 

Davaadolgor and her husband operate a shoe repair service in the local market. She started her own business in 1996 after working at a company as a shoemaker between 1993 and 1996. She also produces traditional Mongolian shoes (Buriad shoes) that are just right for the cold Mongolian winter. Her business is usually very busy during winter months. She says, "I try to be a responsible client to the bank. I want to be a trustworthy customer who always pays the loan principle and interest rate on time." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT  loan to purchase more materials and supplies in order to produce and sell more shoes for the upcoming winter when the demand for such products rise.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 51 años, vive al lado de su hija en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, en donde tiene becerros y cerdos, que luego de un tiempo vende la cría de cerdos, ya que son muy cotizados en el mercado a cambio recibe buenas ganancias. Su hija la ayuda en el negocio así como en la crianza de estos animales. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica en la venta de comida en la feria comercial de su zona. La venta de animales le ha resultado beneficiosa ya que ha aumentado su capital y con la ganancias lo invierte en la siembra de algunas verduras como alfalfa y maíz, por tal razón continuará con la venta de animales menores con la meta firme de tener más capital. Es el crédito número 6 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas  responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más cerdos.
texts.en:
Luz is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in her own house.  For the last 10 years, she has raised animals, including calves and pigs.  She recently began selling the pigs, which are very sought-after in the market, so she makes a good profit.  Her daughter helps her raise and sell the animals.  She also sells food in the commercial area in her neighborhood.  

Selling animals has been very beneficial for her and has increased her capital.  With the earnings, she invests in planting vegetables like alfalfa and corn. For this reason, she will continue selling young animals with the goal of earning more income.  

With this loan, she will buy more pigs. This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to have a financial support, and she likes being part of her community bank because all of the members are very responsible and supportive.  She is also thankful to all the people who manage the loans because they are very useful in the advancement of her business.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy N. is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Sophal Morn, is 50 years old.  They live along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1982 and have seven children:  two sons and five daughters. Three of them are married, one is a security guard, one is a monk, and the other two attend school.

Savy and her husband have been growing rice and fishing since they married. Savy is asking for her first loan of $400 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. 

Photo: Mrs. Savy N. and her husband were at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide for farming

loans.name: Nyabihoko Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Levi A. is the leader of the Nyabihoko Tutungukye group in Kihihi. He is 30 years old and married, and has three children. Two of his children go to school. He also cares for other dependents. 

Levi has operated a retail shop in the Bugiri Trading Centre in the Nyabihoko Cell for 5 years. He sells general merchandise and is able to make 70,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profit each week. Levi needs a loan to buy commodities to sell in his shop. Before starting his retail shop, he was selling tea leaves. He used the profits from his tea business as startup capital for this general store. His dream is to expand further to get to a wholesale level.

loans.use: Buy commodities to sell in his shop

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Justine has a dry-cleaning business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase polythene jackets for keeping the clothes clean. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work.

loans.use: To purchase polythene jackets to protect cleaned items of clothing

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel J. is from the town of Banga. He is 45 years old. Joel is married. To make a living, Joel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. 

Joel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Joel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, es una mujer dedicada y hábil, de 60 años. Es separada y vive en su casa propia, en compañía de sus 3 hijos mayores e independientes. Por muchos años Elena tuvo una bodega de productos perecibles, pero lo tuvo que cerrar debido que no lograba recuperar lo que invertía. Por ello en la actualidad, se dedica en vender artefactos electrodomésticos, prendas de vestir, sábanas, fundas y almohadas; prendas que ella misma confecciona en su casa, mientras que los artefactos, los compra al por mayor en el centro comercial de Lima,  para luego venderlas a sus clientes y ofrecerlas en sus domicilios. Ambos negocios le esta yendo muy bien; ya que de cada producto que vende gana casi al doble, y ese es el motivo que desea intensificarse en la confección y venta de cobertores y sábanas. Ahora con este negocio Elena dice “sentirse más relajada y menos ajetreada”, por ello en adelante desea comprar telas al por mayor, comprar diversidad de mercadería y terminar de construir su casa, para vivir de sus rentas y de su negocio. Elena, pertenece a un grupo comunal de pocos integrantes, y esté es el primer crédito individual adicional a su grupo que tiene con  MFP, ya que demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que también promete a serlo nuevamente. Elena, cada mes compra la mercadería necesaria para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias telas y artefactos, para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Elena, 60 years old, is a dedicated and able woman.  She is separated and lives in her own house with her 3 grown and independent children.  For many years, Elena had a grocery store selling perishable items, but she had to close it because she could not make back what she invested in it.  Because of that, she now sells electrical appliances, clothing, sheets, pillowcases, and pillows.  She sews the garments herself at home.  She buys the appliances wholesale at the Lima shopping center and then sells them to her customers at their homes.  Both businesses are going very well, since she earns almost double on every item she sells, and that's why she wants to increase her production of bedspreads and sheets.  Now, with this business, Elena says she feels "more relaxed and less hectic".  In the future she would like to buy fabric wholesale, buy a variety of merchandise, and finish building her house, in order to live on rental income and on the money from her business.  Elena belongs to a small community group, and this is the first individual loan apart from her group that she has with MFP, since she demonstrated responsibility with her payments.  She promises to be responsible again.  Each month she buys the merchandise she needs for her business, so she will use the loan she is asking for to buy various fabrics and appliances to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to continue making sheets and also to buy appliances

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman who lives in Quezon, Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling fruits & vegetables.  Her husband Conrado, who is 59 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are 12 to 37 years old. Carmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she added to her working capital, helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell so that she can continue to save up for the higher education of her children and expansion of her business. Carmelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team (http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines) on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with two school-aged children. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a tuk tuk business (for public transport means) for the past five years.. In addition, he also operates a video business.  Mohamed faces a major challenge of tuk tuk maintenance, as it is very costly. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase another tuk tuk for public transport. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To purchase another tuk tuk for public transport.

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 35 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Rica works very hard to provide for them.

Rica runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Rica has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Rica would like to expand her general store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen S. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 45 years old and the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Helen S.'s Group.

Helen is married and has 8 school-aged children. She owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados y crianza de animales y también ella trabaja en un grifo desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes vende los helados, la socia quiere ampliar los negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los helados y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the village bank, "San Isidro de Yanahuara." The bank is located in the Urubamba district of the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Luz Marina is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her work selling ice cream and raising animals. She also works at a gas station from 8:00am to 1:00pm and she sells ice cream in the afternoon. She would like to grow her business. She requested the loan in order to buy ingredients to make ice cream and animal feed. 

Luz Marina is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make ice cream and animal feed.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the tailoring business for twenty years. This has enabled her to educate her children, and two of them have now completed university. Her hardship is debtors and her vision is to start another business in addition to continuing to educate her children. Mariam needs the loan to buy cloth for making dresses.

loans.use: To buy cloth for dress making.

loans.name: Rawya

texts.en:
Rawya is a mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary and she is a housewife. Rawya borrowed money from her brother to pay her children's tuition fees earlier this year.

Rawya took out a loan from FATEN to pay back her brother and repay FATEN on a monthly basis as it is easier than repaying the brother at once. Rawya feels much better that she could repay her brother as he is not a rich man and this amount would help him.

Rawya's husband Mahmoud appears in the picture here instead of her as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: to pay children's school and college tuition fees.

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en:
Diomedes is a 48-year-old married man living in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro, Isabela. Diomedes has two children. Diomedes' spouse works as a housekeeper.

He earns about PHP 2,000 per month in his shop where he repairs washing machines and other kinds of electronic appliances. Diomedes has been in the business for nine years. According to him, he plans to use this loan to buy new materials needed in his repair shop such as scissors, tape and other spare parts. He hopes to continually develop his business through his hard work and patience. He said that his last loan was really helpful and he really needs more assistance from the KIVA lenders. 

In the future, Diomedes hopes that his request loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his repair shop such as scissors, tape and other spare parts

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 48 years old and married with three children. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver for three years. His wife earns money by raising rabbits at house. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

They would like to take a loan to expand their rabbit rearing business by buying more rabbits to raise and sell.

He hopes that the business of raising and selling rabbits will increase their income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits to raise and sell

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ana lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Karla Patricia de 35 años q uien se dedica al comercio de repostería, cosa de horno, arroz de leche, pilloquinto…etc. Este es un negocio familiar que con su esfuerzo y labor ha sacado adelante. 
El crédito lo invertirá en reforzar su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de productos
Las otras integrantes son Marta de 38 años quien vende repostería y cosa de horno y Ana de 40 años se dedica al comercio de cosa de horno (ella las realiza y vende) desde hace 8 años.
texts.en: The Santa Ana Group is composed of three hard working and entrepreneurial women. The group's coordinator is Ms. Karla Patricia, who is 35 years old and sells confections, baked goods, rice pudding, pio quinto [Nicaraguan rum cake], etc. Hers is a family business that, with her work and efforts, has progressed. She will invest the loan money to strengthen her business by buying products in larger quantities. The other group members are Marta, 38, who sells confections and baked goods, and Ana, 40, who has worked with baked goods (she makes them and sells them) for eight years.

loans.use: to buy products in larger quantities

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 58 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He does small-scale farming and sells all his produce in the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer, which he will sell at the local market. He will also use part of the amount to pay his casual worker.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Xiomara de profesion docente, y comerciante, esta logrando aumentar su capital, con su pequeña pulperia,con dos años en las ventas, que como objetivo es el crecimiento, para el bien comun.
Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos e esposo quien labora como docente, pues han colaborado al negocio. Y con Afodenic quien ha otorgado financiamiento a plazos, para este fin de crecimiento. Lo que le ayudado para pagar los gastos basicos de agua y luz, a si como gastos personales que son de gran relevancia para la salud.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo invertira en la compra de granos basicos, en arroz azucar, frijoles, cereales en avena, pinolillo, papel higienico, jabon de baño, cajas de fosforo,cloro, axe, cajas de mantequilla, galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, logrando obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Xiomara is a teacher by profession. She is also a merchant and she has been able to raise her capital in her little store she has had for two years. Her objective is growth, for the common good.  

She has her children's and her husband's support. Her husband works as a teacher , and they all have cooperated with the business. Afodenic has given her a loan to re-pay in installments, to help with this growth. This has helped her to to make her basic payments of electricity and water, as well as personal expenses which are very relevant to her health.  

Today with this loan, she will invest in buying basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oat cereals, pinolillo, toilet paper, bathroom soap, boxes of matches, bleach, Axe deodorant, boxes of butter, cookies, candies, and soft drinks, in order to have better sales..

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, and cereals, among other products that raise her sales and grow her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a resident and farmer in the Eldoret town area of North Rift, Kenya. She has been in poultry farming for over four years, producing poultry birds and eggs, which she sells to the local market. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She owns a grocery business that supplements her farming income.
Sarah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to expand her poultry business by buying more poultry birds and building a poultry unit. She says the business will enable her to educate her children. She also plans on making an entry into dairy farming. Sarah appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services and says it will raise farmers' living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Gregoria Hortensia

texts.es: Gregoria Hortensia  de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive con sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y quienes ya aportan para el sostenimiento del hogar. Gregoria posee una tortillería desde hace muchos años y gracias a la cual pudo criar a sus hijos, sus tortillas son las más vendidas del lugar pues son muy ricas, la atención es rápida y las vende a un buen precio; Gregoria es una mujer llena de metas que está dispuesta a cumplir, ella piensa que la fe en el éxito garantiza los resultados, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo en su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela. Gregoria Hortensia no se atiene al aporte económico de sus hijos y ella dice que mientras exista vida continuará trabajando para darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Gregoria Hortensia, 45, lives with her children, who are now adults and contribute to the maintenance of the home. Gregoria has had a tortilla business for many years, thanks to which she was able to raise her children. Her tortillas are the most widely sold in the area since they are quite delicious. Turnover is rapid and she sells them at a good price. Gregoria is a woman full of goals she is ready to achieve. She thinks that having faith that she will succeed will guarantee those results. She wants to see her business grow and for that reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan will enable her to buy corn wholesale so she can continue producing tortillas and satisfying the demands of her customers. Gregoria Hortensia cannot always rely on the economic support of her children and she says that as long as she is alive she will continue working in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is a 45-year-old married woman.   She is a mother of four children who are living under her income.  Leng is a hardworking woman who supports her family. Presently, Leng generates her profit by farming. She is married to Pheap, who is a farmer too.  Aside from farming, Leng also has another business as a vermicelli seller in a market near her community. She earns about $5 each day. 

Leng and her husband wish to purchase a plowing machine to do her farm work and to employ labor, but they lack capital, so she and her husband would like to request some funds through HKL partner and Kiva. Leng has requested a loan for US$1,100 to add to her working business capital. She hopes that this fund will help her family make more profit and be happy.

loans.use: purchase a plow

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 45 años, convive con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos Diego y Ridick, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Todas las mañanas desde hace 16 años, se despierta muy contenta; pues gusta de atender en su pequeña tienda de verduras, alimentos, frutas y panes. Nelly es muy conocida y respetada en su barrio, porqué todo los sábados y domingos se dirige a la ciudad a comprar los productos que venderá en su tienda durante la semana que entra. Ella es la única que abastece el lugar con productos alimenticios, por ello le va muy bien en su negocio. Con el pasar de los años, Nelly equipó su tienda con carnes, azúcar, arroz y ahora quiere adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los habitantes. Además tiene una tienda de fertilizantes naturales donde aprovecha vender a los agricultores de su zona. Asimismo su esposo José se dedica al trasporte público con el auto que adquirieron hace poco; con ello obtienen un dinero extra para el hogar. Y todo esto lo realizó gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal. Ella pertenece al banquito Virgen de Fátima” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que ofreció su banco comunal en el progreso de su tienda. Nelly de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years old, and lives with her husband Jose. They have 4 children together but only 2 of them, Diego and Ridick, live with them in their own house located in the village of Patay.

Every morning for the last 16 years, she has woken up happy. She likes taking care of her little store of vegetables, food, fruits and bread. She is very well known and respected in her neighborhood because every Saturday and Sunday she goes to the city to buy the products that she will sell in the coming week. She has the only place that supplies food products, so she is doing very well in her business.

As the years went by, Nelly stocked her store with meat, sugar, and rice and now she wants to buy more products in order to meet the needs of the residents. 

She also has a store of natural fertilizers where local farmers in her area can shop. Her husband, Jose, is a taxi cab driver using the auto that they have had for a short while, earning extra cash for household expenses.

All of this was made possible thanks to the support of her communal bank. She belongs to the little bank of “Virgen de Fátima” and this is her 12th loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the support that the communal bank has offered in the growth of her store. Nelly will use the money from the loan to stock the store with staples.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to supply her store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is aged 48 and has been in farming in her home area in Muranga, Central Kenya for 28 years producing coffee, beans, and bananas for the local community. She is married with five children, three of whom are adults while the other two are of school-going age.

Nancy has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo of 30,000 KES to purchase a water pump at 20,000 KES and irrigation pipes at 10,000 KES. This is her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo. She says the availability of a constant water supply will improve her output and her family livelihood.

She says Juhudi Kilimo’s financial services have made access to finance very simple for farmers.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La señora Nilda se dedica a la elaboración de masitas las mismas que las comercializa y vende. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser: harina, levadura, azúcar y otros para continuar con negocio. Vive en casa  de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Cotahuma de la Ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Nilda se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, pues esta es la tercera vez que requiere de Kiva para el fondeo.
texts.en:
Sra. Nilda makes and sells pastries. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients so that she can continue her business. Nilda lives at the home of her parents in the District of Cotahuma in the city of La Paz. She is single and has two children.

Nilda is very satisfied with the previous loans that have been provided. This is the third time she has requested funds through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Mariakani. She is married and a mother of three children. She runs a restaurant which has been in operation for the last 11 years. Mary has been a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. She plans to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals for her business. Her dream is to own a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize meal, salt, cooking oil, charcoal, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Melba Ernestina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Melba, tiene 55 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo una hija la misma que ya es mayor de edad y aun vive con ella.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y para que a sus hija no le faltara nada desde hace 8 años y con unos pocos recursos que tenia empezó un  negocio de venta de ropa, el mismo que sigue teniendo hasta la actualidad, ahora también está vendiendo productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) esto es lo  que le ha servido para subsistir honradamente, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres días por semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y cosméticos Avon. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es excelente. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The village bank "20 de Abril" meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo), known for its rich precolonial culture and craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and around the world. It is famous for Panama hats made of palm fiber. 

Here we meet Melba, 55, separated, and a mother of one grown daughter who still lives with her. 

In order to earn a living, and make sure that her daughter didn't lack for anything, she took what few resources she had and started a business 8 years ago selling clothing. She still has the same business today, and is now also selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories). This has helped her to sustain herself honorably. She sells her products door-to-door, working 3 days a week. She leaves items on credit and collects payment on the weekend. 

This loan will help her to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, shirts and Avon cosmetics. She has been with the village bank since the beginning, is the president of the group and likes it because the group is excellent. 

Her dreams are to continue moving forward with her business and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts and Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen tiene 46 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y es la presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “El Arbolito”. Se dedica a la compra y venta de artefactos usados; con el cual  lleva 8 años y que comenzó con la venta de triciclos usados a raíz de poder conseguir abrir una chatarrería y así obtener mayor rentabilidad para su negocio. Hasta ahora ha logrado construir su casa y comprarse algunos electrodomésticos, sus ingresos están destinados a los gastos de casa y ahorro, su plan para el futuro es abrir una chatarrería cerca de su casa y comprarse una moto; Carmen tiene pensado usar el reciente préstamo para seguir adquiriendo artículos de segunda como refrigeradoras, congeladoras, televisores y otros electrodomésticos para así revenderlos. 

Ella comparte los gastos con su esposo, quien se encarga del pago de luz y agua, tiene 3 años con el grupo el cual esta conformado por 10 personas y que se formo a través de la visita por parte del analista a una de las señoras pertenecientes al grupo; Carmen lleva 2 años como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is married and has three children.  She is the president of the El Arbolito communal bank.

Carmen has been working buying and selling used appliances for eight years.  She began with the sale of used tricycles as a result of being able to open a scrapyard and so get greater profits for her business.

Up to now she has managed to build a house and buy herself a few electrical appliances.  Her income is dedicated to household expenses and savings.  Her plan for the future is to open a scrapyard near her house and buy herself a motorcycle.

Carmen plans to use the recent loan to continue acquiring used items such as refrigerators, freezers, television sets, and other electrical appliances to resell.

Carmen shares expenses with her husband, who is responsible for paying the electricity and water.

She has been with the group for three years, one of 10 people who formed a group after a visit from an analyst to one of the women in the group.  Carmen has been president of the group for two years.

loans.use: to buy appliances such as freezers and refrigerators.

loans.name: Monica Cecilia

texts.es:
Monica, es una Madre Soltera de 41 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que cursan el nivel secundario, ella  dedica a brindar el servicio de comida rápida ya que desde muy pequeña veía a su madre cocinar es por eso que ella eligio este oficio y porque le parece que este negocio es rentable.
Monica vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Monica es una mujer ejemplar, luchadora, trabajadora y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, pese al desafió por la falta del padre de sus hijos Monica brinda este servicio de comida rápida (salchipapas, salchipollo, hamburguesas, etc) desde en el año 2006 , gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 210 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Monica invertirá este crédito para la compra de insumos (papa, lechuga, etc),. El  sueño de la señora Monica es tener su propia casa en donde sus hijos estén cómodos y seguros para que así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y hacer crecer su negocio para que en futuro llegue a  ser una gran empresaria , su asesor cree es que una excelente cliente y que pagara sus cuotas puntualmente .
texts.en: Monica is a 41-year-old single mother. She has two dependent children who are in secondary school. Monica's business is providing a fast food service. She chose this trade as she used to watch her mother cook from a very young age. In addition, she believes that it is a profitable business. Monica lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital. It is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peru's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business. Monica is an exemplary, tenacious, hard-working and very responsible woman who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life, despite the challenge presented by the absence of the children's father. Monica has been providing her fast food service since 2006. She makes salchipapas (shredded sausage and fries), salchipollo (shredded chicken and fries), hamburgers etc. She earns, on average, 210 soles a week. With the loan for 2,000 soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva, Monica will invest in buying supplies (potatoes, lettuce, etc.). Monica's dream is to own her own home where her children are comfortable and safe and can enjoy a better quality of life. She would also like to grow her business so that, in the future, she becomes a big businesswoman. Her loan officer believes her to be an excellent client who will make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies (potatoes, lettuce, bread, etc.)

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. He owns a business where he sells and fixes washing machines.  He hopes that through this loan he will be able to build an attic for his store and to buy new washing machines. He hopes that once he builds the attic he will be able to have room for storage. That way he can bring in a large number of wash machines and will have a place to store them until they are fixed.

loans.use: build an attic and buy new washing machines.

loans.name: Reyna Esmeralda

texts.es: Reyna Esmeralda tiene 53 años de edad y reside en el Municipio de Patuca, Olancho. Desde muy temprana edad comenzo a vender queso en los alrededores de la comunidad y poco a poco con el apoyo de los prestamos obtenidos en FAMA a ido diversificando su negocio y ahora tambien cuenta con una pollera que tiene instalada en el patio de su casa. Ella sola atiende sus negocios y lo hace desde muy temprano por la mañana. Doña Reyna solicita el prestamo para comprar mas libras de queso y comprar mas pollitos ya que se avecina la navidad y espera que sus ventas aumenten. Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y que este le permita humildemente seguir sosteniendo a su familia. Reyna ha sido clienta de FAMA por varios años y siempre ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Reyna Esmeralda is 53 years old and lives in the city of Patuca, Olancho.  She began selling cheese around the city at a very young age and she has been diversifying with the help of the loans she’s gotten through FAMA.  She also has a chicken coup on her patio and runs her business on her own starting early in the morning.  Reyna is asking for this loan to buy more cheese and chickens; now that Christmas is approaching she expects her sales to increase.  Her greatest desire is to grow her business and that it allows her to continue supporting her family.  Reyna has been a FAMA client for several years and has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buys cheese and chickens

loans.name: Luis Bernardo

texts.es:
Luis Bernardo tiene 25 años vive en casado, vive con la esposa y un hijo, de un año. Vive en el Recinto San Temistocles en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luis Bernardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicita para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y ayudar al hijo en el estudio.

Le gusta hacer deporte con el hijo y con los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Luis Bernardo is 25 years old and married. He lives with his wife and one-year-old son in the San Temistocles precinct of the Ventanas canton.

The communal bank “Narcisa de Jesus," or “Daffodil of Jesus” is located in the San Temistocles precint, belonging to the Vantanas canton. This communal bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice. 

Luis Bernardo is a farmer and has been growing corn for three years. He buys his supplies in Ventanas and then sells his goods at a market in the same area.  

Luis Bernardo is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for sowing corn. The loan has helped him increase his income, which goes towards his family’s consumptions and towards investment. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and help his son get an education.

He likes to play sports with his son and people from the neighborhood.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer to sow corn

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 25 años es un joven padre de 3 hijos de 9, 5 y 2 años. Convive con Amalia hace 10 años. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Miguel, hombre trabajador y emprendedor. A su edad ya es responsable de una familia, a quien mantiene. Al inició no fue fácil, pero gracias a la ayuda de sus padres quienes le otorgaron parcelas de terrenos pudo iniciar sus propios sembríos. Ahora él cuenta con plantaciones de café y achiote. 
“Tengo una cuadra de café que me bota 10 sacos de 70 kilos cada uno”, explica. Miguel vende sus granos de café a 10 soles el kilo, por ahora. En temporadas de gran demanda, como son los meses de abril a julio, su precio llega a costar hasta 14 soles. En el campo recibe el apoyo incondicional de Amelia y confía que, con los años sus hijos también aprendan de las labores.
Miguel confiesa que críar 3 hijos a su edad, no es sencillo, requiere mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y no lo podría hacer sin Amelia. Es por eso que seguirán trabajando para que ellos crezcan con valores y sin carencias básicas.  Miguel piensa alquilar más terrenos para ampliar sus sembríos. Sería la primera vez que Miguel accedería a un préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece a “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, su banco comunal, del que espera progreso en equipo.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá mandar a limpiar sus cultivos, contratando a personal operario, a quienes pagará diariamente de 30 a 35 soles.
texts.en:
Miguel, 25, is a young father of three children who are 9, 5 and 2 years old.  He has lived with Amalia for ten years.  This family lives in their own house located in the indigenous community of Pachacutec in Chanchamayo Province.  Miguel is a hardworking, enterprising man.  At his age he’s already responsible for a family that he supports.  At the beginning it wasn’t easy but thanks to help from his parents who gave him some plots of farmland he was able to start his own crops.  Now, he has coffee and achiote crops.

“I have a cuadra [about 3.8 acres] of coffee that produces ten sacks of 70 kilos each,” he explains.  Miguel sells his coffee beans for 10 soles a kilo for now.  In high demand seasons like April to July the price can reach up to 14 soles.  Amelia helps him in the fields and he confesses that in time his children will also learn the tasks.

Miguel admits that raising three children at his age isn’t easy.  It requires much effort and dedication and he couldn’t do it without Amelia.  Because of this they will continue working so that they will grow up with values and with their basic needs met.  Miguel plans to lease more land to expand his crops.

This will be the first time Miguel gets an MFP loan and he commits to be punctual with his monthly installment payments.  He belongs to the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) communal bank and he expects them to make progress as a group.  He will use the money from the loan to clear his fields.  To do so he will hire day laborers that he’ll pay 30-35 soles daily.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Suhaila's Group

texts.en:
Suhaila is a member of this group from Iraq. Suhaila is 43 years old divorced. Suhaila started her sewing business eleven years ago with an old sewing machine to generate enough income to support herself.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy an air-conditioner  and  sewing machine  to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Suhaila and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients.
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Suhaila's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy air-conditioner and sewing machine

loans.name: Enagnons Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNONS est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même localité. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marguerite est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Marguerite est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Jean-Baptiste. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marguerite n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marguerite  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Marguerite  vend des condiments, du maïs et des conserves dans sa région depuis onze ans environ ; qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants. Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite sollicite, ensemble avec les membres du groupe ENAGNONS, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des  condiments, du maïs et des conserves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 59 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. 

Her business is selling clothes. She has been in the business for 5 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of clothes for sale. She will use the profits from expanded business to better her living standards. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business from retail to a wholesale.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Stoicho

texts.en: Stoicho V. is 39 years old. He is divorced and lives in Razgrad. He is funning his vegetable producing business for 8 years. Stoicho tills 30 decares land on which he grows tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onion, garlic and others. All production is being sold on two stand on the cooperative market in Razgrad. During the season Stoicho hires some workers who help him in his vegetable garden. Stoicho V. applies for this $ 1200 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy five more machines for training tailoring students

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Miss Thu is 37 years old. Her husband left her for another woman. She is currently supporting three children between the ages of 12 and 19. Her first son is mentally retarded and also suffers from cardiac disease. Her second and third children are going to school. She has 5000 square metters of land where she is planting baby cashew nut trees. Selling grocery is important to increase income by about $1.5/person/month. The average income in her area is $8/person/month. She now wants to borrow a loan of $50 again.

loans.use: selling grocery

loans.name: Mkwamba

texts.en:
Mkwebmba is a 53-year-old resident of Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with four children and two other dependents. For the past three years, she has been running a charcoal business at her home. She has suppliers from up-country, mainly from the Morogoro and Pwani Regions of central Tanzania, and she sells at place as a retailer. Apart from charcoal, she also rents chairs for various functions like weddings and other public gatherings, and this business is still in its initial stages.

She is need of 450 US dollars to help her boost her charcoal business.

loans.use: Expand Stock

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria C. Callisaya, works as a seamstress, creating blankets, duvets and other items as contracted or requested by her clients. Gregoria has been working as a seamstress for over 15 years, selling her wares at all the fairs in the city of El Alto, mainly for domestic use, as she is self-employed and doesn’t have the man-power to produce items in large amounts. Gregoria’s intention is to purchase a stall in the area of Villa Dolores, with the goal of establishing a place to sell all of her preparations, as well making an operational base for contacts and contracts. She already has the machinery necessary for the production of her goods, it is for this reason why she only requires money to purchase a stall as it will really fulfill her needs, in view of the fact that she has two children to maintain and a spouse who only works as a driver.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria C. Callisaya, se dedica a la costura y confección de fundas, edredones, y otros que vende a pedido o contrato, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. Ya son más de 15 ños que Gregoria viene desarrollando este trabajo, vendiendo por todas las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, principalmente para uso doméstico, ya que siendo una empresa unipersonal, no produce por mayor o en gran cantidad. La intención de Gregoria es la compra de un puesto de venta en la zona de Villa Dolores, con el fin de establecer un lugar de venta de todas sus confecciones, y hacer una base de operaciones para contactos y contratos. Posee la maquinaria necesaria para la producción de estas confecciones, por lo que solo precisa de capital para poder realizar la compra de este puesto que en definitiva colaborará mucho con sus intereses, en vista de que tiene dos hijos que mantener y un esposo que solo trabaja como transportista.

loans.use: Requires money to purchase a stall as it will really fulfill her needs, in view of the fact that she has two children to maintain and a spouse who only works as a driver.

loans.name: Dulce Mariza

texts.pt:
Dulce is a single mother. She lives with her son in her parents' home. She is a goldsmith - a craft she learned from her father. Earlier this year she joined the program and now she will get her second loan. Her residence is located in Maxixe and her small jewelery tent can be found at the local market. If business goes well, she plans on expand her small tent into a real jewelery store.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Dulce e mae solteira. Ela vive com o seu filho na casa dos pais. Ela e ourives. Ela fabrica brincos para a venda. Ela aprendeu esta arte com o seu pai.Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Este emprestimo e o segundo que ela vai tomar.Ela vive na Maxixe e tem a sua pequena ouriversaria no mercado. Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa no futuro transformar a sua pequena barraca numa verdadeira ouriversaria.

loans.use: Dulce wants to use the money to purchase raw gold to manufacture earrings.

loans.name: Safrida

texts.id:
Before Safrida started her own Padang food business, she worked in a Padang food restaurant. Due to her persistence and her own capital, she started the food shop with her husband. Now she already has regular customers. She buys the materials (meat and fish) in Badung market every morning. She opens the food shop from 10am to 10pm. The profit is Rp 200,000 (about $21) per week. The loan capital will be used for capital and rent fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Sebelum Safrida mempunyai Usaha Jual Makanan (masakan padang) sendiri, ia bekerja di sebuah warung makan padang. Berkat keuletan dan modal yang ia miliki, ia bersama suami membuka warung makan. Hasilnya sampai saat ini dia sudah memiliki langganan tetap. Ia membeli semua bahan – bahan yang ia perlukan (sayur daging maupun ikan) di Pasar Badung setiap pagi. Warung ia buka mulai pukul 10.00 sampai dengan 22.00. Keuntungannya Rp 200.000,00/minggu. Pinjaman modal senilai Rp 1.000.000,00 akan ia pakai untuk modal usaha dan sewa tempat .

loans.use: For capital and rent fee

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. sells rice in the community.  She purchases husked rice and palm kernels from farmers in the villages and processes them for retail sale. She intends to expand her business and is therefore requesting a loan.

Sarah is 45 years old and she lives in Yataya village Kabala, in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children.

loans.use: Sarah would like to be able to purchase larger quantities of raw materials to process and sale.

loans.name: Amina's Mtanzania Group

texts.en:
Amina, 23 years old, is married with one 5-year-old child. Amina started selling clothes in 2007, and everyday, she works from 9am to 7pm at her business.

In the past, Amina has successfully taken out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas has been a member of the Banco Comunal Ayni II for one year. She mentions that she likes her Banco Comunal because it provides training in diverse areas.

Felicitas lives with her partner. She is 28 years old and has two children. She owns a small store from which she sells CDs, DVDs, rolls of film (for a camera), car radios, and other products that she brings from the cities of Lima and Tacna. She says that she started with capital in the amount of 100 soles, selling in the streets and growing little by little. Currently, she is opening a new branch in the Ayacucho jungle.

Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of DVDs, CDs and film.

Felicitas dreams are to grow her business, start a new business selling fertilizers, and that her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 1 año, Felicitas menciona que le gusta su Banco Comunal porque les brindan capacitación de diversos temas.

Felicitas es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Felicitas tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende CD, DVD, rollos para cámara, auto radios, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima y Tacna. Felicitas cuenta que inició con un capital de 100 soles, vendiendo en las calles y poco a poco fue creciendo. Actualmente esta aperturando una nueva sucursal en la selva ayacuchana.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD, CD y rollos.

Los sueños de Felicitas son ampliar más su negocio, iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de agroquímicos y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of DVDs, CDs, and film.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 32 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages10,8, and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 13 years old. Fatuma is a clothes seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Mercedes is a member of “Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad”, located in Jr Revolución 520, District of Calleria of the Department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a teacher, and with a previous first loan received from Manuela Ramos, S/.300, doña Mercedes decided to invest in a business selling prepared meals. Presently at her house she sells soups from very early in the morning and breakfasts which are very popular because of the area where her house is located, and therefore she gets up very early to get ready and have everything prepared for her customers. With this loan of S/.1,500 ($550) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 box of cooking oil, 1 sack of rice, 1 bag of noodles, 1 sack of salt, 1 box of milk, meat, vegetables, etc. Doña Mercedes is happy as the loans allow her to go on working and feel useful supporting the economy of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Revolución 520, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es profesor, es así que Mercedes con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de comidas. En la actualidad vende desde muy temprano en su casa caldos, y desayunos que tiene mucha demanda por la buena zona donde esta ubicada, para ello se levanta muy temprano para alistarse y tener todo listo cuando lleguen sus clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 1 saco de arroz, 1 bolsa de fideos, 1 saco de sal, 1 caja de leche, carnes, verduras, etc. Mercedes se siente feliz por que gracias a los prestamos puede seguir trabajando y sentirse útil para ayudar en la economía de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
MRS. GLORIA, ever since being a little girl, has been involved with agricultural work and now that she is a mother she carries out her work for the benefit of her beloved family. Her production has increased notably and along with this is the requirement for natural manures and fertilizers in order to obtain products of excellent quality. Due to the increase in the costs of these products she is asking for a loan in order to acquire them and obtain an excellent harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DOÑA GLORIA, desde pequeña se ha relacionado con la labor agrícola y ahora que se ha convertido en madre se desempeña en beneficio de su amada familia, su producción se ha incrementado notablemente y con ella la exigencia de abonos y fertilizantes naturales para obtener productos de excelente calidad, debido al incremento del costo de los mismos solicita un préstamo para adquirirlos a fin de obtener una excelente cosecha.

loans.use: Purchase of manures and fertilizers

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Issa K. is 40 years old and married with five children. He sells basic building materials such as wiremesh, nails, and a few bags of cement. With his previous loan, he diversified his business; now he would like to do this again to increase his income. His plan is to establish a large building materials shop.

Issa is the group leader for three other members. Henry C. owns a small pharmacy selling basic medicine; Fatmata K. sells rice, peanuts and palm oil; and John K. sells plastic sandals and cotton clothes. The group is requesting a loan to expand their individual businesses.

loans.use: Increase stock of building materials, medicines and food items.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. sells fabric, shoes, and bags, and she also makes doughnuts for sale. She is married, but her husband's income alone is not sufficient for the two of them, although they have no children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Jesus Angel

texts.es:
Jesús inicio su negocio ya que necesitaba de un ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar y de sus 4 hijos: Juan Carlos de 6, Jesús Adrian de 4, María Guadalupe y María del Carmen R. Martínez de 2 años, empezó hace 3 años con la elaboración y venta de pan, empezó primero solo vendiendo a sus vecinos hasta que poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que lo recomendaron y logro tener un negocio mas prospero.

El necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio, con tu apoyo esto será posible.
texts.en:
Jesús started his business because he needed a steady income to support his family. He has 4 kids: Juan Carlos (6 years old), Jesús Adrián (4 y.o.) María Guadalupe y María del Carmen (2 y.o.). He began his business 3 years ago making bread and selling it himself. At the beginning his customers were only his neighbors, but little by little the business grew by word of mouth and he started to do better.

Jesús needs a loan of US $475 that he would repay in 6 months. He need it to buy raw materials and keep the business running. Your help would make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira I. has worked in the Joint-Stock Company "Navbakhor" for a long time. She recommends herself as an executive and a strong-motivated worker. She works in the spheres of making both euro-styled and national-styled women's wear. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She shows loyalty and is a serious client. Working in making clothing requires special furniture that produces goods of a higher quality that are more engaging. Now Nazira requests a loan of 3100 STJ for 4 months to purchase the special furniture that is necessary. Nazira also trades women's wear in the local bazaar. This additional business will bring the family more income.

loans.use: Nazira would like to purchase special furniture to make women's wear.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married and has two children. He has a small store where he sells sport clothing and underwear. The business is located in a small, beautiful town that attracts lots of tourists. They are his main clients. 

Mykola has been in this business for 10 years already. He runs it with his wife, Alexandra, who encouraged her husband to start this business and is very supportive even now. They have already invested 45,000 UAH in goods and would like to expand the business even more.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase more goods. This business has its high season now. Mykola believes that opening second place of retail will give him an advantage over his competitors and provide his family with more profit in the coming Christmas season.

Note: this is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas y cotillones, para cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos.
Trabaja a pedido con los comerciantes de la calle Illampu, lugar donde se comercializa todo tipo de trajes y cotillones para todo acontecimiento en general.
Vive en la zona de Alto San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz tiene cinco hijos y uno que esta a su cargo ya que es el único que genera ingresos en su familia porque es viudo.
Es la Décimo tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas y cotillones, para cumpleaños, matrimonios, bautizos. Trabaja a pedido con los comerciantes de la calle Illampu, lugar donde se comercializa todo tipo de trajes y cotillones para todo acontecimiento en general. Vive en la zona de Alto San pedro de la ciudad de La Paz tiene cinco hijos y uno que esta a su cargo ya que es el único que genera ingresos en su familia porque es viudo. Es la Décimo tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El contacto para formar el comité fue la señora Ana P. que trabaja vendiendo remedio naturales en una de las principales avenidas de la ciudad. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona.

 El comité está constituido por 18 integrantes todas tienen actividades productivas y generan ingreso dentro de sus hogares. Las actividades que realizan cada una son: 
Irmina Espínola 	Venta de Comida  
Maria P. 	Limpiadora 
Solana Ramírez 	Modista 
Florinda Báez 	Venta de Productos  Avon
Liliana G. 	Venta De Bolsos P
Fidencia P. 	Venta De Ropa Interior 
Julia A. 	Venta de Ropa 
Reina Báez	Despensa 
Maria  Asunción P. 	Venta de Comida 
Zulma G. 	Venta de Ropa 
Amelia D. 	Manicurista 
Epifanía B. 	Venta de Ropa 
María O. 	Modista 
Patricia F.  	Venta de Ropa 
Justina V. 	Venta de Comida 
Trinidad P.	Confección de Ropa 
Felicia E. 	Venta De Joyas 
Francisca B. 	Venta De Frutas 

Cada una retira un monto distinto de préstamo pero todas se comprometen en conjunto a pagar semanalmente por su crédito, para lo cual realizan reuniones semanales para juntar el dinero de la cuota, además de tocar temas de interés para el crecimiento del grupo. Ellas también realizan diversas actividades en conjunto para poder recaudar fondos adicionales que lo ahorran.

Este grupo a demostrado ser uno de los más disciplinados y organizados y ellas cuentan que se encuentran muy contentas trabajando y obteniendo capital de sus créditos.
texts.en:
The group's contact is Ana P. who makes a living selling natural medicines on one of the city's main avenues. She recruited her neighbors and friends to form the committee in her area. The committee has 18 members who have businesses and generate income for their households. Their respective businesses are:

Irmina Espínola Food Sales Maria P. Cleaning Solana Ramírez Dressmaking Florinda Báez Avon Sales Liliana G. Purse Sales Fidencia P. Underwear Sales Julia A. Clothes Sales Reina Báez Grocery Maria Asunción P. Food Sales Zulma G. Clothes Sales Amelia D. Manicurist Epifanía B. Clothing Salesa María O. Dressmaking Patricia F. Clothing Sales Justina V. Food Slaes Trinidad P. Tailoring Felicia E. Jewelry Sales Francisca B. Fruit Sales

Each withdraws a different loan amount but they jointly promise to repay the loan. They meet once a week to collect a weekly payment and to touch on issues of mutual interest. They also operate businesses together in order to collect additional funds for their joint savings.

This group has proved to be one of the most disciplined and organized and the members say that they are very happy working and using their loans to earn incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for various businesses.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Mrs. Alma T., a 32-year-old married woman with 4 kids, lives in Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman.  She and her husband only received elementary-level education, so they know that they cannot obtain high-paying jobs.  

Nevertheless, they have a great deal of determination and courage and, as a result, they applied for membership at Paglaum MPC because they had heard of the cooperative's lending operations.  They have often thought about venturing into the fishing and fish-selling business, but they had insufficient capital on hand to get the business of the ground.  

Due to her desire to help her husband, she applied for a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 from the cooperative. Their neighbors are their customers, yet such neighbors also display their goods and products in the market.  The small business is doing so well that she has now decided to expand the business and to hopefully one day own a pumpboat of their own.  Alma is able to pay her loan on a timely basis, so she is always in good standing with her loan.  In the future, she wants to make sure that all of her children complete their studies. She has high hopes that God will bless their business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing a fish net and other fishing accessories

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is engaged in the hog raising business. She and her children are living in the rural village of Pilitan in Tuamuini, Isabela where farming is the main source of income by the people and their main products are corn and tobacco.

Her husband Carlos is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and she was left temporarily with their four children: Boyet, 23, a high school graduate; Arlene, 21, is already married and a graduate of computer technology classes. Two of their children are still studying, one in college and one is taking vocational courses. Ofelia said that they have a relatively good family situation and they are facing every challenge without complaints, as God is always there for her.
