Through the remittance of her husband, Ofelia was able to start hog raising business. This is her way of helping her husband in providing the educational needs of their children and household needs. Ofelia and her children dislike being away from her husband and this is her reason for having a small business--to keep her busy and at the same time assist in their financial needs. She is now requesting for a loan of $75 (PHP 3,000.00) to purchase feed for her hogs. Her business is really helping her in supporting their needs and she hopes that she can become successful with her endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase feed fo rhogs

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Shida has been selling clothes in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175.  Everyday she works at her business for eight hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Shida is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Fidelia, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks. Since the demand of her customers is high, she wants to satisfy them. Josephine needs the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She lives in  Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ahmad Fawad Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Fawad is the group leader of Ahmad Fawad group. There are four members in this group and each of them is taking a loan to expand her or his business.

Ahmad Fawad wants to take a loan to repair his taxi. Bebe Sheren wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a small restaurant. Bebe Sheren's husband wants to purchase a new desk and chairs for his restaurant. M. Nauim wants to take a loan for the tailoring business and he wants to buy a new machine for his shop because he has lots of problems with old one he has during sewing. He also wants to hire a student to support him in his business and to enlarge his business. Farad wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring.

They requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs in the progress of their business.

loans.use: for business progress

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel L. de 49 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón junto a su hijo el cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. María posee una venta de ropa para bebé, de la cual obtiene el dinero para todos los gastos del hogar, a pesar que su hijo colabora, ella necesita mejorar sus ingresos, es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar más ropa de bebé de manera que aumente su inventario para tener mucha más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera María espera poder mejorar su economía y así mismo obtener una vida más tranquila junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Isabel L. is 49 years old. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her son, who helps her with the household expenses. María owns a baby clothing business, from which she earns the money for the household expenses. Even though her son helps out, she needs to improve her income. This is why she is requesting a loan, with which she will have the capital she needs to buy more baby clothing so she can increase her inventory and have more variety to offer her customers. In this way María hopes to improve her economic situation and achieve a more tranquil life along with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.ru: Эшов Хабабуло проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Хабибуло занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Старший сын находится на заработках в России. А другие помогают отцу по бизнесу. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена пшеницы для посева. А потом собрав, продать. На полученный доход от бизнеса, хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Habibulo E. lives in Tursunzade. He is 46 years old and is married with 7 children. He is an agricultural worker, and he has been for 20 years. His elder son works in Russia and the others help his father. Habibulo is planning to use the loan for the purchase of wheat. He would like to plant wheat and sell the harvest. He will use the profit for home renovation.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat grain

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 61 años, es soltera, vive con su hijo y su nieto de 8 años de edad en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales, tales como la mandarina, naranja, limones, etc. Anteriormente vendía en el mercado de su localidad, pero ahora acondiciona un espacio en su casa para esto, ya que por la zona donde vive transitan muchas personas y tiene buenas ventas. A Mercedes le gusta mucho su labor porque se mantiene ocupada y sobre todo se siente útil ante la sociedad. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que son personas muy divertidas, pero también muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más frutas, además de construir un kiosco para poder vender con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 61 years old, single, and lives with her son and 8-year old grandson in her own house. For three years, she has sold local fruits such as mandarins, oranges, lemons, etc… Previously, she sold in her neighborhood market, but now she set-up a space in her house. Since there are many people that pass through her neighborhood, she has good sales. Mercedes likes her work because she stays busy and, above all, she feels useful to society. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that it’s a fun group of people, but they are also very responsible with their payments. With the money that she requests, she will buy more fruits in addition to constructing a kiosk so that she can sell more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and build a kiosk

loans.name: La Buena Fe, Group 10

texts.en:
Elena J. is 22 years old and lives in the medium-sized town of El Seybo, in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. She is the group coordinator for La Buena Fe (The Good Faith) bank, Group 10 of Kiva and Esperanza International. Her story is typical of her fellow group members' experiences with Kiva and Esperanza.

Today, Elena is looking to take out her second Kiva loan to grow her clothing and food retail business. She currently sells clothing, bananas, habichuela (a staple Dominican bean dish) and vegetables, but she would like to diversify her merchandise to offer earrings as well. Although she has been running her own business for at least the past five years, Elena only became a client of Kiva and Esperanza six months ago, after her mother had success as a borrower of microloans. Since becoming a Kiva and Esperanza client, Elena reports that both her business and her life have changed significantly for the better. Elena has already been able to grow her business so that her second loan is twice the amount of her first. This additional access to capital is especially important to Elena because, although she has no dependents, she lives on her own and supports herself entirely through her independent retail outlet.

With her new loan, Elena hopes to expand her merchandise offerings and to have further success with her in-home business. She is pictured in the center of the photo with her fellow members of La Buena Fe bank, Group 10.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise to sell

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
D. Akmaljon is a 48 year old man. He is married and has two children. Akmaljon’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God will continue to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Isfara city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 5 years. Today Akmaljon’s car needs maintenance. That is the reason he wants to borrow $ 1300 USD to purchase spare parts for his car. Akmaljon sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car.

loans.name: Manzooran Muhammad Rafiq Group

texts.en:
My name is Manzooran and I’ve been a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I am married to M. R., who lives in our community. He has 10 years of experience selling clothes. It’s a very profitable business because people are fond of wearing new dresses. I am applying for a loan to buy more clothes to advance my husband’s business.

This loan is for four additional people: Khursheed Baji and Shahnaz Baji each want a loan to buy bicycles to sell. Jamila Naz Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sugran Baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies for reselling. Manzooran Baji is seated in the center of the bajis in this photo.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Janibichi Group

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Janibichi borrower group in Mwanjelwa,mbeya ,she is 44 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 16 years.

Anna started her own food business selling tomatoes,banana 6 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is anna`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more Tomatoes,banana,onions.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Anna hopes to save money and expand her business.

Faraja,Ambwene are another member of the same borrower group,they also requested loan amount of 200,000Tsh in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more banan,onions,tomatoes

loans.name: Vandyeck

texts.en: Vandyeck T. is married and has nine dependants. He has received senior high school education.  Vandyeck sells soft drinks in whole sale at Bosodwina near shama junction, which he has been doing since 2004. His wife is a trader.  Vandyeck uses his income to pay bills and school fees.  Vandyeck will use the loan to buy more soft drinks in bulk to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Vandyeck plans to save towards building a house.

loans.use: Vandyeck will use the loan to buy more soft drinks in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 55 years old and she is engaged in the 'sari-sari' business (running a community-based store). She is married and her husband is working as a farmer. They have seven children and having a big family is very challenging especially in providing their needs and in sending them to school.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 22,000 from KIVA lenders. She believes that this amount will really help her in making her store more profitable and also to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en: Kiden T. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour. Kiden is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour

loans.name: The Eden Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Eden son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ellas se caracterizan por ser humildes, a continuacion se detalla cada una de las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
la sra. MARIA ELIBERTA I. M. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años atras.
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, Maria necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que en estos momentos no tiene mucha variedad de productos. desea tener bien surtida su pulperia para dar una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
 
la sra. MARIA MAGDALENA BETANCURTH La principal y única fuente de ingresos es su pulperia que tiene 05 años de tenerla, su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Morazán de la ciudad de san Lorenzo.
ella necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio.

la sra. Maria Patrocinia G. tiene una pulperia que le a ayudado a salir adelante,  tiene varios años de tener su negocio, durante este tiempo sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. ella solicita el credito para ampliar y surtir mas su negocio.

todas ellas necesitan el credito para sacar adelante sus negocios y sus familias. el negocio de la pulperia es muy comun en nuestro pais, ya que muchas personas montan un negocio de estos para ganarse la vida, ademas que es facil de administrar y provechoso para muchas mujeres que tienen hijos pequeños, ya que la mayoria de estos negocios son en sus casas de habitacion asi trabajan y cuidan a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The women of the Eden Group are hardworking and eager to succeed. They are known for their humility and engage in different business activities.

Sra. Maria Eliberta I. M. started selling groceries several years ago. This business is her only source of income. Maria needs a loan so that she can restock her business because she does not carry a wide variety of products at the moment. She wants her store to be well-stocked so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Sra. Maria Magdalena Betancurth also manages a grocery store as her only source of income. She has been in business for 5 years. Her store is located in the Morazán subdivision of the city of San Lorenzo. She will use her loan to restock her business.

Sra. Maria Patrocinia G. has a grocery store that has enabled her to get ahead. She has been in business for several years and her living conditions improved during this time. She is requesting a loan to expand and restock her business.

These women need their loans to move their businesses and their families forward. Grocery stores are very common in Honduras, so many people start this type of business to earn a living. They are easy to manage and convenient for women who have young children. Most grocery owners run their businesses out of a room in their homes so that they can work and take care of their children at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock their stores

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Mariposas” esta representado por la señora Blanca  y conformada por 12 miembros de amigas y socias muy unidas, activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. La actividad principal de todas las socias es la venta de productos como comida, venta de lácteos, shampoo, cosméticos y la mayoría de los socios se dedican a la construcción de viviendas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia de sus familias, en caso de que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería en desaguadero y la adquisición de insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The group "Las Mariposas" is represented by Mrs. Blanca and consists of 12 members, who are very close friends and partners. These active and enterprising people desire to perform activities to bring them closer together and therefore become more united as a group. The main activity of all of the partners is the sale of products, such as food, dairy products, shampoo, and cosmetics. Additionally, the majority of our partners work in the construction of homes. In regard to the competitive environment, we can mention that although competitors are present in their neighborhood, our partners have faithful clients that constantly generate the necessary economic activity for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things are not going well for them in their neighborhood, they direct themselves to another place or diversify their economic activity in a way that they are able to fulfill their childrens' needs. This credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise in Desaguadero and the acquisition of materials and tools that will help them generate better products and greater earnings in order to provide their families a higher quality of life. As for experience with credit, our partners have received financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time they have worked with an institution that provides them with confidence and economic support, for which they hope to continue growing together with us.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and merchandise

loans.name: Estrellas De Mar Group

texts.es: Edith T. es la presidente de  la asociación “Estrellas de Mar” del centro Focal Villa Exaltación, ella al igual sus compañeras, desea iniciar un negocio propio, el cual le permita  llevar el sustento a su familia, Edith desea abrir una sala de Internet, ya que este negocio se esta haciendo cada vez mas rentable, afirma. Ella necesita capital para iniciar su negocio. sus compañeras trabajaran con distintos negocios por ejemplo Juana venderá ropa, Jennifer tarjetas de cumpleaños, Inés reciclara papel y chatarras, Flora y Rosmery elaboraran comida, Marcos se dedica  a la costura de calzados. La asociación en su totalidad necesita capital para iniciar sus negocios compraran  mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
Edith T. is the president of the “Estrellas de Mar” group, which is part of the Villa Exaltación regional office. Like her colleagues, she wants to start her own business so that she can support her family. Edith wants to open an Internet café since, as she explains, this business is becoming more and more profitable. She needs capital in order to start her business. Her colleagues work in different businesses—for example, Juana sells clothing, Jennifer sells birthday cards, Inés recycles paper and scrap metal, Flora and Rosmery prepare food, and Marcos earns a living making shoes. All of the members of the group need capital so that they can purchase merchandise and supplies in order to start their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for starting their businesses

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia ALBERTINA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tienen tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer. La hija mayor es independiente y los menores estudian en el Instituto Superior “ESITUR” la carrera profesional de Gastronomía. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde vende almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para construir su domicilio y mejorar el restaurante refaccionando el piso.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Albertina is a humble member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. She is 45, married, and has three children. She has two boys and a girl. Her daughter is independent, and the younger two children go to the post high school Esitur Institute for a professional career in gastronomy. They live in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small restaurant in her home where she sells lunch and dinner. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to build her house and to improve her restaurant by refurbishing the floor. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her house and to improve her restaurant by refurbishing the floor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to change her house's electric system

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es: La señora Estefana G. G. es una cliente distinguida e nuestra Institución en donde todos sus pagos se han registrado con puntualidad, sus créditos anteriores fueron para la inversión en la tienda de abarrotes “Abarrotes G. “ que inicio hace un par de años negocio que ha dado fruto gracias al esfuerzo y la dedicación por parte de la solicitante, ahora nuevamente esta tramitando para un mejoramiento de su vivienda donde su proyecto es ampliar su vivienda para una mayor comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Estefana G. G. is a distinguished client of our Institution where she has always made her payments on time. Her previous loans were used to invest in her grocery store, called "Abarrotes G.," which she started a couple of years ago; it has produced profits thanks to her efforts and dedication. Now, she is again requesting funds, this time to do some home improvements; her project is to enlarge her house for greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For house addition.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie C. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Rosie owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Hector Ramon

texts.es: Don Hector Ramòn de 44 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos el mayor de 16 años esta estudiando su quinto año de secundaria, el menor acaba de cumplir dos añitos de edad, trabaja en la empresa Formunica desde hace 2 años como ejecutivo de ventas, su esposa la Sra. Gloria Gutierrez, labora como docente en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 22 años, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos  adquiridos ya que son  una familia bien unida, està solicitando su primer crèdito a la Instituciòn, para poder construir una habitaciòn para su hijo mayor y brindarle mayor comodidad y privacidad, el sueño de Hector es  tener un porvenir mejor para sus hijos y cada dia que pasa estar bien con Dios y la Familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hector Ramòn is 44 years old, married, and has two sons. The oldest is 16 years old and is in his fifth year of secondary school. The younger son just turned two years old.

He has worked for the Formunica company for two years as a sales executive. His wife, Mrs. Gloria Gutierrez, has worked as a teacher in the Mauricio Cajina school for 22 years. They both help with the expenses of the home and are a very united family. He is asking the Institution for his first loan to be able to build a bedroom for his older son to provide him greater comfort and privacy. Hecor's dream is to have a better future for his sons and to be approved of by God and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina C. C. es casada tiene cuatro hijos una a su cargo, habita en el barrio el Rosario es profesora de primaria en el  centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace quince años.

La señora Albertina además de ser profesora también tiene un taller de bordado y confección todo para bebe en su casa de habitación, cabe señalar que es primer crédito que se le otorga.
texts.en:
Señora Albertina C. C. is married and has 4 children, 1 in her care. She lives in the suburb of Rosario and has been a primary school teacher at the education centre Jesús de Nazareth for 15 years. Apart from being a teacher Albertina also has an embroidery and children's clothes workshop in her house. She would like to point out that this is the first loan that she has sought.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Sirya Thoya

texts.en:
S. is 32 year old gentlemen who is married to Getrude and together have a daughter Josephine. 

He is in the business of motorcycle transport at Watamu-Malindi where he targets hotel employees and gets a monthly profit of Kshs 12000. His wife does small scale farming on their farm.

S. who is on his first loan and has had no prior credit history and he was introduced to Kadet by his business partners. He will utilize this loan by opening and stocking a new shop with Kshs 20000 and buying motor bike spare parts with Kshs 10000. With the extra income from this loan S. plans on accumulating the money for rental houses on his plot. 

A hardworking man he hopes to own a transport company.

loans.use: Open and stock a new retail shop and purchase motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: S. Félicienne est née en 1978 à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-podji, au Bénin. Félicienne vit depuis 14 ans à Agblangandan. Félicienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mariée à HOUNGA Blaise, un revendeur, Félicienne est mère de deux enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Félicienne et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour aider son mari, Félicienne vend des produits cosmétiques (lotions pour le visage,  crèmes, pommades etc.) et des tissus de façon ambulante. Félicienne s’approvisionne à Lomé, capitale économique du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Il y a cinq ans que Félicienne exerce son activité. Félicienne a déjà obtenu un prêt chez ALIDé, prêt qui a été bien remboursé. Félicienne désire obtenir un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son stock afin d’être à l’abri d’une pénurie.
texts.en:
Félicienne Sognibe was born in 1978 in Agblangandan, in the commune of Sèmè-podji in Benin. She has been living in Agblangandan for 14 years. She never attended school. Félicienne is married to Blaise Hounga, a vendor, and is the mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. The couple live together with the children. Félicienne and her husband share the responsibility of providing for the family needs. In order to help her husband, Félicienne sells cosmetic produts (face lotions, cremes, ointments etc) and fabrics as a street vendor. She buys her stock in Lomé, the economic capital of Togo, Benin's neighboring country. She has been in this business for five years. Félicienne already had one loan from ALIDé, which she duly repaid. She is seeking a second loan in order to boost her merchandise stock and avoid shortages.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics and cosmetics (face lotions, cremes, ointments etc) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more dry gin, powder, candles, etc., to  sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina S. is 49 and married with 3 children (ages 5 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Tina has 2 years of experience in this business.  Tina needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tina joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Tina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Zula

texts.en: Zula is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. Zula also takes care of additional family members. Zula sells second hand clothes in Kasubi  market. She sells to all categories of people but only at retail. She wants to use this loan of 200,000/= to get more second hand clothes. Zula buys these clothes from Owino market and uses public transport to and from shopping. Zula goes shopping once a week.   She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season because she works from an open place. Zula aspires to buy a plot of land. Besides this clothing business, Zula also sells tomatoes. She joined MCDT because she wanted to get start-up capital. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and market dues. Zula resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Amelia S. D. is hopeful that her sewing business will provide a steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life. Her sewing business has grown and requires more capital to sustain it. Because of this, Amelia is requesting a loan through Kiva partner, ASHI, so that she can support the growth of her business and meet the increasing demands of her customers. Without capital, Amelia’s business will not grow and she will not be able to provide suitable services to her customers. Through the support of ASHI and Kiva, she hopes that someday her family's standard of living will change and they will be able to break away from the ties of poverty. She is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance.
Amelia’s dream is for her only child to complete college. She also hopes to continue her sewing business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family and give employment to others in the community.

loans.use: To support the growth of her sewing business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene 22 años, es soltera y es natural de la ciudad Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es administrar su tienda de abarrotes que está ubicado en la urbanización de Amadeo Repetto del distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar un conservador de alimentos que cuesta S/. 1500 soles y también desea comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carnes y pollos. 

El sueño de la socia es abrir una agencia de viajes y comprar un terreno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa y ya está un año y medio prestándose créditos de la Asociación, ella se considera una persona responsable y no se atrasa con las cuotas de pago.
texts.en:
Roxana is a single 22 year old from the city of Cusco. Her main economic activity is tending to her grocery store that is located in the suburbs of Amadeo Repetto in the Santiago district of the Cusco province. She needs the loan to purchase equipment to keep her food fresh that costs 1500 soles, and she also wants to purchase food such as rice, sugar, meats, and poultry. Roxana’s dream is to open a travel agency and purchase a plot of land. She belongs to the communal bank “Kantu” of the Arariwa Association, and it has been a year and a half since she started borrowing from the association. She is considered to be a responsible person who does not fall behind her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine to keep food fresh and food such as rice, sugar, meats, and chicken

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
La señora Shirley Gladis socia emprendedora y entusiasta, tiene 62 años de edad, divorciada, con  3 hijos mayores de edad, su domicilio está ubicado  en la zona de Vitarte,  departamento de  Lima, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 20 años, se inicio invitada por una amiga, queriendo ser independiente, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ceviche por las necesidades que tenía que cubrir en su hogar. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo- Prosperidad desde hace 2 años, asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Dios es amor y mi guía” la cual está  conformada por 8 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta de ropa, venta de comida, bodega y otros.
Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar mercadería para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Hasta el momento ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales los gastos de su casa y la titulación de su hija.
texts.en:
Sra. Shirley Gladis, an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial associate, is 62 years old. She's divorced and has 3 grown children. She lives in the Vitarte area of the Peruvian "departamento" of Lima. She has earned a living selling beauty products for 20 years, a business she started with advice from a friend who knew that she wanted an independent income. Before that, she operated a business selling ceviche because she had to cover the household expenses. She started working with Edaprospo-Prosperdad two years ago and she is now president of the Dios es amor y mi guia (God is love and my guide) community bank, a group of 8 members who operate a range of businesses such as: recycling, clothing sales, food sales, a general store and more. With this loan, Sra. Shirley plans to buy merchandise for her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers. Up to now, she has successfully helped her children start professional careers, paid her own expenses and helped her daughter through university.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger B. is from the village of Cabisera 5. He is 38 years old. Roger is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Roger owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roger has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Roger joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roger from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth A. is from Barangay Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years and she is married with two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  Vestine is commonly known in the business of selling foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time.  Her business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Vestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Vestine will increase her business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs including wheat.  If successful, Vestine will keep expanding her business till she becomes a wholesaler.  If so, she really hopes that her business will be financially stable.

loans.use: a large quantity of foods for sale

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquileres de sus tiendas, ella alquila para diferentes negocios, algunas de sus tiendas falta refaccionar y arreglar, por medio de este negocio, ella puede sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar sus tiendas apara alquilar. La socia solicita el préstamo para refaccionar el baño de la tienda y comprar materiales como cemento. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorimankacha”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 53 years old, married, and has two children. Maria Luisa divides her time between her daily activities and her business renting storefronts to different businesses. Some of her properties are in need of repairs and remodeling. Thanks to her business, Maria Luisa is able to move her children forward. She wants to make improvements to her storefronts to make them available for rent, so she is requesting a loan to repair the bathroom in one of her stores and buy materials such as cement.

Maria Luisa is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair the bathroom in one of her rental storefronts

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida en el paradero llamado Sr de Cabildo, ella vende comida desde las 12:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, su esposo es obrero realiza diferentes obras de construcción en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener un restaurant donde pueda preparar las comidas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y también para comprarse una cocina nueva.  
 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 51 years old, married, and has four children. Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food at the Señor de Cabildo bus stop. She sells food between noon and 10pm. Her husband is in construction and works at different sites throughout the city of Cusco. Elsa wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare her meals. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire ingredients for cooking and to purchase a new stove.

Elsa is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking & a new stove

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria B. is from the village of Mitacas Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Manan-aw 2.

Gloria is 46 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a clothing business in her local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Rafiqaan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqaan lives in a small city in Pakistan called Jaranwala, which is famous for its agricultural industry. Rafiqaan has been living here with her family for the last 12 years in a 3-room brick house.

She is 40 years old and married to 45 year old G. S. who works in the field. He grows crops like wheat and rice in the fields. He works very hard to put three meals on the table for his family. Rafiqaan supports her family financially by operating a grocery shop adjacent to her home.

She has given birth to three daughters who are still very young and are below 10 years of age. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her grocery business. With the loan, she will buy groceries for her grocery shop and is hopeful that this investment will result in good profit for her and that her family’s financial condition will improve. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rafiqaan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He sells building materials, like corals blocks, timber, nails, and iron sheets for retail. His potential customers are housing contractors and neighbours. 

Peter faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to open a hardware shop and supply goods for wholesale in the future.  With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase coral blocks, cement, timber, nails, and iron sheets for resale. 

He decided to join Yehu to acquire loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase coral blocks, cement, timber, nails, and iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 28 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un hijo menor D. edad, resiD. junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Ciudad Eten, una zona que se ha hecho conocida por la elaboración artesanal D. sombreros tejidos a base D. junco. El lugar se encuentra situado a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a la comercialización D. pescado fresco en el interior del mercado D. su distrito. Ella adquiere su mercadería diariamente en el terminal pesquero D. la región y luego ofrece su mercadería a los vecinos D. la zona que diariamente recurren a este centro D. abasto para adquirir diversos productos D. uso diario. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo, que es obrero D. construcción civil, con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Petronila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más pescado fresco D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes. Adicionalmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Petronila es una mujer con mucho carisma y que siempre brinda buen trato a sus clientes. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer bastante responsable y confiable.
texts.en:
Petronila is 28 years old. She is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband in the district of Ciudad Eten, an area which has become known for its production of handmaD. woven straw hats. The area is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Petronila has worked selling fresh fish in the market of her district. She acquires her merchandise each day at the region's fishing terminal, and later she offers her products to neighbors in her area, who come to this supply center daily to acquire a range of everyday products. The income she receives from this work is used to help her husband, who is a civil construction laborer, to proviD. the family's economic support. 

Petronila wants to expand her business by purchasing more fresh fish so she can satisfy her customers' demands. In addition, she would like to make some improvements to her home. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which will help her achieve her goal. 

Petronila is a woman with great charisma who always provides good service to her customers. People who know her consider her a very responsible and trustworthy woman.

loans.use: Buying fresh fish to expand her business

loans.name: Ne

texts.en:
Mr. Ne L. is 23 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sopha Phal, is 20 years old.  They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Mr. Ne L. produces chairs and vases made of cement. His wife assists her husband in the business. 

Ne hopes to expand his business and to respond to his customer’s needs. So, he is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria R. is from the village of Lingu. She is 47 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Hilaria R..

Hilaria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $92 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ser

texts.en:
Mr. Ser Y. (shown in the photo) is 40 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Thyda Tep, is 31 years old. They live along national road number six about ten kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters. 

Ser is a mechanic. His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives.

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Hour S., 62, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.18 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 17 on the other necessary expenses. 

Hour S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to plant and sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Teacalco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Teacalco y esta ubicado en Morelos, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita crédito. Reyna G. B. es una de las integrantes del grupo, es casada y tienes 62 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, tiene un total de 4 hijos; 3 varones y una mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne, abarrotes, verduras y quesos negocio que inicio hace 31 años, la señora inicio su negocio para ayudar a su esposo ya que con el salario que gana no es suficiente para solventar los gastos de la familia, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía. Sus clientes la prefieren porque siempre encuentran los artículos que necesitan, y además de ser una persona muy amable y bondadosa. Al momento de solicitar el crédito ella se encuentra muy contenta porque va a poder pagar su pedido y comprar insumos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Teacalco” and located in Morelos, Mexico. The group consists of nine members and this is the third time they are requesting a loan.

Reyna G. B. is one of the group members. She is 62 years old, married, and studied through the third year of high school. Reyna has four children, three sons and a daughter. She sells meat, groceries, vegetables, and cheeses in her business that she started 31 years ago. Sra. Reyna started her business in order to help her husband since his salary is insufficient to cover the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. Her customers prefer to buy from her because she always has the items they need. In addition, they find her to be a friendly and caring person. Upon applying for her loan, Reyna felt very happy because she will be able to pay for her orders and acquire supplies.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Mrs. Emely A. is from the village of San Roque, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Emely is married to Victor A., a bus driver, and is blessed with four school age and two adult age children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending, particularly rice cakes. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for five years already and earns approximately $117 a month from this activity. 

In 2010, Emely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. 

She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially for her basic needs, savings, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: Ozamiz - Baybay Sta. Cruz, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 36 years old and is married, with two children.  For ten years, he has been selling vehicle spare parts.  He has employed two people to help him in his tasks.  He also does poultry farming to boost his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed a culture of saving.  He will be able to reinvest in his business.  He hopes to own real estate in the future.  He has requested  50,000 Kes to buy a gearbox and crank shafts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche is a 45-year old married woman. She has a 25-year old child. Her husband works as a jeepney dispatcher in their town. (Jeepneys are a popular means of public transportation in the Philippines.) 

Lyroche has been in the business of raising hogs for quite some time now. She plans to use her loan to purchase additional piglets and feed. Lyroche works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Elvira Almazan's Group

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from the village of Sinamar. Elvira is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elvira A.'s Group.
Elvira is 49 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Marcelina, es casada y tiene 44 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos es independiente, mientras que los otros tiene (20, 18, 17) años de edad, La socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y la ganadería actualmente ella compra y vende vacas y toros, la socia tiene vacas lecheras, toros, vaquillas, ella vende la leche de sus vacas en las ferias y a pedido, también elabora queso, la socia en esta oportunidad desea el crédito para poder invertir en el alimento de sus ganados, ella dice que debe comprar alimento balanceado, sutuchi de la cervecería y sales minerales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado y vitaminas para sus ganados.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” community bank which is located in the town of Zurite, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Marcelina is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  One of her children lives independently while the others are 20, 18 and 17 years old.  Marcelina's main business activity is farming and livestock raising.  She currently buys and sells cows and bulls.  She owns dairy cows, bulls and heifers.  She sells the milk from her cows in street markets and also to order.  In addition, she makes cheese.  On this occasion, she would like a loan to invest in feed for her animals.  She says that she needs to buy balanced feed, sutuchi from the brewery ('sutuchi' is the final residue from making corn-based drinks which is used as animal feed) and mineral salts.

Marcelina is requesting this loan to invest in buying balanced feed and vitamins for her animals.  She appreciates the loan she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 32 years old and married with three children. Sge works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, candies, groceries, etc. 

Edlyn has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and retailing gasoline.

Edlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is from the village of Labi, Dikilaan, Iligan City. He is 49 years old. Jose is married with three school-aged children. Jose has a service-based business providing motor or habal-habal services to local community members. He also runs a retail store with his wife. Jose has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jose is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jose from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed to maintain vehicles.

location.town: Labi, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 61 years old and a married mother of three adult children. She has been practicing mixed farming for over 30 years in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya. She employs one farmhand and sells her milk, beans, and maize to the local market. Farming has been her main source of income. Evelyn has made her second loan request through Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 Kes in order to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help improve her family's living standards. Her primary challenges have been diseases and low market prices for her farm produce. She plans to acquire more dairy cows in future to improve her milk production and earn her more income. She is grateful to Juhudi for these rural-based projects.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
Tat is a 54-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her husband is retired and she has been selling chicken in a small market for 15 years. 

Her family depends on her business as their primary source of income. She would like to take a loan to buy more chickens to sell in the market so that she can earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Judith Maria

texts.es: Judith de 44 años es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 25 años.  Ella vive en la ciudad e Barraquilla donde emprendió su negocio de peluquería y servicios de bellezas desde el año 2000, una vez se preparó en una academia para este propósito. 	Ella inicialmente prestaba el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen de sus amigas a través del corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure  y peinados en su propia casa.  Con el tiempo las personas que una vez accedieron a sus servicios empezaron por volver a buscarla y posteriormente y hasta la presente le envían  muchos referidos y por eso ella permanece en actividad todo el tiempo.  Su trabajo es su máxima motivación porque a ella le encanta, especialmente la línea de maquillaje en la que se desempeña muy bien. Sus hijos, ahora profesionales,   trabajan y su esposo siempre están apoyándola en sus gastos, pues  mantienen una excelente unidad familiar.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un espejo, una silla de peluquería y un lava cabezas, con ello sus clientes se sentirán más confortables y esto es lo que ella busca.  En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad del 60%, que planea aumentar en la medida en que diversifique su oferta con nuevos servicios que en un futuro planea contratar.
texts.en: Judith, 44, is married and has three children between 16 and 25 years old.  She lives in Barranquilla, where she has had a hairdresser and beauty salon since 2000, when she graduated from a beauty academy.  She initially did haircuts, manicures, pedicures, and styling for her friends from home.  Over time, people began to seek her out, and, through word of mouth, she built up a full-time business. She loves her line of work, especially the make-up, which is her strong point.  Both her children, now working professionals, and her husband always help her with expenses, as they are a close family. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair-washing basin.  This will make her clients more comfortable.  She has a profit margin of 60%, which she hopes to increase as she diversifies her offerings with new services in the future.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, a barber's chair and a hair washing basin.

loans.name: Sayagie

texts.en:
Sayagie, 36 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last six years.

Sayagie learned about KADET from credit officers. This will be his first loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sayagie's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Erlinda Elizabeth

texts.es: Erlinda, una joven de 26 años de edad, nació en la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de un niño de un año de edad, ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado en el mercado de la ciudad de León ,lleva 7 años en este negocio. Ella inicio en este negocio a los 18 años con ayuda de sus padres desde entonces hasta hoy en día este ha sido su único negocio y medio de subsistencia, su esposo ayuda en el hogar con el salario que el gana. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar zapatos e invertir en su negocio, pues su anhelo mas grandes es poder expandirse y ofrecer variedad y estilos de zapatos, pues le seria de gran ayuda ya que podrá crecer su negocio , introducir productos nuevos en su tienda ,hacer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es expandirse un poco mas ofreciendo mejores productos de calidad.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 26, was born in the city of León.  She is married and has a one-year-old son.  Her business is selling shoes in the market in the city of León, where she has been active for seven years.  She began her business when she was 18 with the help of her parents and since then this has been her only source of income.  Her husband uses his salary to help with household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes and invest in her business because she wants to expand and offer a wider variety and different styles of shoes.  This would help her introduce new products at her store, attract more customers and increase her income.  Her goal for the future is to expand a little more and offer better quality products.

loans.use: To buy shoes and invest in her business.

loans.name: Benkadi A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI A sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32   ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Banco ville, chef lieu de commune rurale, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA MADOU la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché de Banco et au niveau de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi A group are married women, 32 years old on average, who have on average 5 children. Most live in polygamous families in the city of Banco, the administrative center of the rural village, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the goal to be able to better organize their businesses for the beginning of winter. They grow, among other things, rice and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with the institution. With this loan, Fatoumata Madou, the middle person in the row of those standing, plans to buy the resources and small equipment and pay for labor costs to maintain about .5 hectares of rice. The harvest is sold at the Banco market at N’Golobougou to a clientele composed of men and women. They plan to earn on average about 25,000 CFA for each crop cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and small equipment

loans.name: Nonvignon Gbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON GBE est composé de vingt sept membres qui se connaissent parce qu’elles habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Célestine, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Célestine est mariée à un agent au Port nommé Gérôme et a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, seulement un est encore à la charge du couple. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Célestine et son mari habitent ensemble avec leur enfant. Célestine n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Célestine mène comme activité depuis trente ans environs, la vente de condiments et de vivres à son domicile. Célestine s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON GBE. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGNON GBE is composed of 27 members who know each other because they live in the same district in Benin. The president of this group, by the name of Célestine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of boosting their businesses in order to cope better with customer demands, the group members are requesting financial support from ALIDé.  

Célestine is married to a Port agent named Gérôme and has five children, who are all in school. Only one of the children is still a dependent. The couple jointly ensures that the various family expenses are met. Célestine and her husband live together with their child. 

Célestine never went to school. To support herself and her family, she has been running a business for 30 years selling condiments and staple foods out of her home. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and further satisfying her customers, Célestine and the other members of the group NONVIGNON GBE are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy condiments and staple foods

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is  30 years old.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 7, 3 and 2.  He has been farming for five years, producing milk and vegetables which he sells to the local market.

Martin has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says this second loan from Juhudi will improve his family's living standards and help him educate his children.  For additional income, Martin also runs a motorcycle business where he is just an employee but hopes to buy his own from the farming proceeds.

Martin says dairy feeds are usually expensive during the dry seasons and remains a persistent challenge in the dairy business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 47 años es una valiente mujer, pues se separó de su esposo hace un año, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo cuida a 2 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista. Fue difícil superar los 20 años de compromiso con su esposo, pero eso no la desanima; al contrario le brinda fuerzas para salir adelante. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, disfruto de ello”, menciona con alegría. Pues hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar arveja, maíz y habas. En los primeros años alquilaba los terrenos productivos donde sembraba, pero con su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprar unos propios. Además recibe el apoyo de su hijo, quien trabaja en el arado de la tierra con los dos toros que posee, ahí le pagan S/. 70 soles diarios, por lo que tiene una ganancia extra. Ahora se concentra en su cosecha de habas, como también en mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Teodosia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el mejoramiento del piso de su casa, asimismo en el techado y cercado de su patio.
texts.en:
47-year-old Teodosia is a courageous woman who separated from her husband a year ago.  The couple have four children and she cares for two of them in her own home which is located in the town of Bellavista.  It was difficult to get over the 20 years of commitment she had with her husband but she is not discouraged.  On the contrary, it gives her the strength to get ahead in life.  "I like working in the fields, I enjoy it", she says cheerfully.  

Teodosia started growing peas, corn and beans 15 years ago.  During the first years, she rented the land where she sowed her crops but, through her work and effort, she was able to buy some land of her own.
